commit_message:
Add REVIEWING documentation

This patchset adds reviewing documentation to Patrole which
is very similar to Tempest's reviewing documentation, except that
it omits sections that aren't so relevant (like requirements around
docstrings because currently Patrole has no such requirements) but
adds sections related to policy concerns.

Change-Id: I25c3a4b73f1d4f8beb7bce9c694f4bb3f904e038

commit_message:
[doc] Use openstack client command to replace neutron client

The neutron client commands will be deprecated, so use
openstack client commands to replace neutron client.

Change-Id: I18515f5faaa35a24c7316c864493cff521209417

commit_message:
Fixup ceph.conf templating

Ensure that code snips don't slurp to much whitespace,
resulting in a broken set of keys within the generated
configuration file.

Change-Id: I7cfe026c60c04ac19741a3a2b364cec3fb8746ba

commit_message:
Apply Ironic rolling upgrade logic

This patchset apply Ironic rolling upgrade logic [1][2]:
- Add ironic-dbsync online_data_migration to ironic-api image.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/contributor/rolling-upgrades.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/admin/upgrade-guide.html#rolling-upgrades

Co-Authored-By: Ha Manh Dong <donghm@vn.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I14edf639e5120ea9c81252295161b76bc4514cbe
Implements: blueprint apply-service-upgrade-procedure

subject: Consolidate nodepool graphs
messages:
[{'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-06-21 04:59:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-06-21 05:02:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-06-21 05:04:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I have deployed this manually on grafana02

 http://grafana02.openstack.org/d/MKTt6xNik/nodepool-all-providers?orgId=1

I'll leave it up for a while so reviewers can actually see it ..."}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-06-21 06:05:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-06-21 07:22:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-06-21 07:24:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-06-21 07:29:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@corvus I believe this addresses concerns

These graphs are live on grafana02.o.o for review, e.g.

 http://grafana02.openstack.org/d/8wFIHcSiz/nodepool-rackspace?orgId=1

Note grafana02.o.o is still in the emergency file.  I did mention I was going to swap it back to live, however I noticed that these graphs were not quite broken, but in a state of disrepair with invalid graph axes etc, and have put switching it on hold until our existing graphs work better with the new grafana.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-06-21 07:39:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-06-21 07:55:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-06-21 07:58:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-06-22 02:23:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-06-23 17:44:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

thanks, I like the approach - it would be perfect if we would not store the result of the script but inject the generated files directly to grafana, thus avoiding that somebody changes a single file by accident.

but one step at a time...'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-06-24 21:30:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

LGTM, leaving to corvus to make sure he approves.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-06-25 17:48:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-06-25 17:50:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Ian, please self-approve if this can merge now.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-06-27 08:08:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Workflow-1

i do want to switch over grafana02 to the live sever, it was waiting on this.  will do soon'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-07-19 04:59:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-21 04:59:21.000000000', 'message': 'Consolidate nodepool graphs

I think the graphs were organised like this before grafana supported
parameters.  All of these dashboards are the same, and have copied all
the same issues with them.  This makes updating anything a massive
pain, and leads to inconsistency across all the dashboards.

This implements a single dashboard, with a single paramater lookup for
the currently enabled regions.  Any time we add a new provider, all we
need to do is add a single entry in the query list and it will show
up.

You can select "All" for an overview of the entire nodepool ecosystem,
or start multiple selecting parameters to compare across providers or
regions.  Of course, selecting a single provider/region group is
essentially the same as any of these individual dashboards.

I have included a range of fixes.  The y-axis format has changed in
later versions of grafana.  The API time tracking is no longer scaled,
but we just tell grafana it is in ms and it displays it correctly.
The test nodes is now summarised corectly, and moved to a large single
graph at the top, as it is probably the most interesting graph.
Values for "null as zero" are consistently set.  Various formatting
fixes for the labels are included.

Change-Id: I5fbffaec3c82aa1fce0947f771de67edd15f7dfc
'}, {'created': '2018-06-21 05:02:53.000000000', 'message': 'Consolidate nodepool graphs

I think the graphs were organised like this before grafana supported
parameters.  All of these dashboards are the same, and have copied all
the same issues with them.  This makes updating anything a massive
pain, and leads to inconsistency across all the dashboards.

This implements a single dashboard, with a single paramater lookup for
the currently enabled regions.  Any time we add a new provider, all we
need to do is add a single entry in the query list and it will show
up.

You can select "All" for an overview of the entire nodepool ecosystem,
or start multiple selecting parameters to compare across providers or
regions.  Of course, selecting a single provider/region group is
essentially the same as any of these individual dashboards.

I have included a range of fixes.  The y-axis format has changed in
later versions of grafana.  The API time tracking is no longer scaled,
but we just tell grafana it is in ms and it displays it correctly.
The test nodes is now summarised corectly, and moved to a large single
graph at the top, as it is probably the most interesting graph.
Values for "null as zero" are consistently set.  Various formatting
fixes for the labels are included.

Change-Id: I5fbffaec3c82aa1fce0947f771de67edd15f7dfc
'}, {'created': '2018-06-21 07:22:41.000000000', 'message': 'Consolidate nodepool graphs

All of these dashboards are the same, and have mostly copied all the
same issues with them.  This makes updating anything a massive pain.

This implements a single dashboard template with a small script to
create individual dashboards for each provider and its regions.

I have included a range of fixes.  The y-axis format has changed in
later versions of grafana.  The API time tracking is no longer scaled,
but we just tell grafana it is in ms and it displays it correctly.
The test nodes is now summarised, and moved to a large single graph at
the top, as it is probably the most interesting graph.  Values for
"null as zero" are consistently set.  Various formatting fixes for the
labels are included.

Change-Id: I5fbffaec3c82aa1fce0947f771de67edd15f7dfc

but we just tell grafana it is in ms and it displays it correctly.
The test nodes history graph is moved to the top, as it is probably
the most interesting graph (note this splits itself out per region, if

commit_message:
Consolidate nodepool graphs

All of these dashboards are the same, and have mostly copied all the
same issues with them.  This makes updating anything a massive pain.

This implements a single dashboard template with a small script to
create individual dashboards for each provider and its regions.

I have included a range of fixes.  The y-axis format has changed in
later versions of grafana.  The API time tracking is no longer scaled,
but we just tell grafana it is in ms and it displays it correctly.
The test nodes history graph is moved to the top, as it is probably
the most interesting graph (note this splits itself out per region, if
mulitple regions are selected).  Values for "null as zero" are
consistently set.  Various formatting fixes for the labels are
included.

Change-Id: I5fbffaec3c82aa1fce0947f771de67edd15f7dfc

commit_message:
Fix charm upgrade broken by commit 862c362

Currently, upgrading this charm on a host that is running
ovs >= 2.6 will break because the OVS_DEFAULT config file
is not expected to be written by the charm.

Change-Id: I33352deb3b60231347045d5f39f3508a29dda61e

commit_message:
Ensure nagios is enabled when enabling cluster status checks

Move the installation of the cluster status checking into
the conditional that checked with the NRPE directory exists.

This ensures that the managment plugin can be installed without
the charm being related to Nagios.

Change-Id: I998ba7c4b70207bb38f9898046f4e47bcb5723a4
Closes-Bug: 1781582
(cherry picked from commit 4d4c998072c6795f2681a5836fa85046ee26eadb)

[{'created': '2018-07-12 11:43:23.000000000', 'message': 'Make L3 IP tc filter rate limit more accurate

Currently the L3 agent qos extension does not set the mtu for
tc filter rules, the default value is 2kb. Tc filter rules use
such mtu will result in an inaccurate bandwidth.

So in order to improve the precision, we set the mtu to 64kb.
For the test results, you can read the bug description.

For more information you can read the linux tc man page:
[1] https://linux.die.net/man/8/tc-tbf
[2] http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man8/tc-police.8.html

Closes-Bug: #1777598
Change-Id: I7a167ec6139ccc55988b34f82080a182116d02a3
(cherry picked from commit 5ddb2a4762eac52290cd0491881ec6ca15bb9217)
'}]
commit_message:
Make L3 IP tc filter rate limit more accurate

Currently the L3 agent qos extension does not set the mtu for
tc filter rules, the default value is 2kb. Tc filter rules use
such mtu will result in an inaccurate bandwidth.

So in order to improve the precision, we set the mtu to 64kb.
For the test results, you can read the bug description.

For more information you can read the linux tc man page:
[1] https://linux.die.net/man/8/tc-tbf
[2] http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man8/tc-police.8.html

Closes-Bug: #1777598
Change-Id: I7a167ec6139ccc55988b34f82080a182116d02a3
(cherry picked from commit 5ddb2a4762eac52290cd0491881ec6ca15bb9217)

commit_message:
Fix UT BridgeLibTest when IPv6 is disabled

There was missing mock of
ipv6_utils.is_enabled_and_bind_by_default() in BridgeLibTest
unit tests and that cause failing some of tests from this module
when tests are running on host with disabled IPv6.
Now it's mocked and tests are running properly and are
testing what they should test.

Closes-Bug: #1773818
Change-Id: I9144450ce85e020c0e33c5214a2178acbbbf5f54
(cherry picked from commit 8930d33c71e394c1cfaa1b9ad5493c79d394cb40)

memcache.Client is inherited from threading._local so instances are only
accessible from current thread or eventlet. Present workaround broke
inheritance chain so super() call is unusable.

Change-Id: I085f6f62ba293375f4e3502685c188d87e758b0f

commit_message:
Make memcache client reusable across threads

memcache.Client is inherited from threading._local so instances are only
accessible from current thread or eventlet. Present workaround broke
inheritance chain so super() call is unusable.

This patch makes artificial client class mimic inheritance from
threading._local while using generic object methods allowing
reusability.

This patch is copied from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/170835/

Closes-Bug: #1440493
Change-Id: I085f6f62ba293375f4e3502685c188d87e758b0f

commit_message:
Fix glance config copy when a service is disabled

In this patch, the glance-registry service was disabled:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566804/

However, the config task still tries to copy files for it, which will
break due to path errors.

commit_message:
Add reset_interfaces parameter to node's PATCH

Setting it to true when updating the node's driver resets all hardware
interfaces to their defaults, unless they're also updated.

Change-Id: Ie70dbbed2be0a46f024b859e8141572500fb47c6
Story: #2002868
Task: #22818

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I65758ef10d35a88cadf2e2d92660e502728479c5

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: If0670a00065486bf3db29ea22dc429dce4ee8bc7

commit_message:
Replace port 35357 with 5000 for "auth_url"

Based on the change in Keystone Install Guide [1],
this patch replace port 35357 with 5000 for "auth_url".

For more details, please check similar changes which have been done
on other projects: Nova [2], Neutron [3], Cinder [4], Glance [5].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541857
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562812
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566491
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565464
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558932

Change-Id: Ibadcdf88013eb72b1330f741b02170ea390a0ced

messages:
[{'account_id': 15285, 'date': '2018-07-14 05:35:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-07-14 06:46:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Thanks for writing this guide, Neerja. Please see my comments.'}, {'account_id': 15285, 'date': '2018-07-14 15:58:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-07-16 00:15:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(10 comments)

The swift type function means user stores the function code package in swift and create function by specifying the swift container and object name. When invoking the function, qinling will download the object from swift to the container, unzip the package and execute the code.

What's more, I suggest you test the process step by step after you make changes to make sure it does work in the real environment.

Let me know if you have any question about the whole process."}, {'account_id': 15285, 'date': '2018-07-18 18:19:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-07-18 21:38:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Updates in NS and VNFFG list commands

This patch will do 2 things:
1. Add 'vnf_ids' and 'vnffg_ids' fields as outputs from network
service list command. Users can know which VNFs or VNFFG, that
belongs to specific NS.
2. Add 'ns_id' fields to VNFFG list command, that shows which
network service the current VNFFG belongs to it.

Partially-implements: blueprint vnffg-ns

Change-Id: If6c5550f94e676fb2062e32ddc069acd5dfb6490

Is it just me, or did you forget to enforce the version? My "path-mangling" version did enforce v1, so then we don't need to invent another trick when v2 comes along. I don't this this doing it. Needs an X-Version header and enforcement.

In addition, I don't see an advantage.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-07-15 09:40:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-07-15 09:41:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-12 16:39:08.000000000', 'message': 'PUT+POST: Detect older object server by not sending content-type

This patch offers an alternative mechanism for detecting older object
servers that does not require changing the object server request path
format.

Older object servers will return a 400 if the PUT+POST protocol does
not include a content-type in the PUT request. Newer object servers
can check for the content-type in the POST request and apply it when
handling the POST.

Note: this patch does not revert the changes in the parent that
implement the path mangling solution.

Change-Id: I828623661a711671775ecb85a37e91d5bf52d82e
'}, {'created': '2018-07-15 09:40:26.000000000', 'message': 'PUT+POST: Detect older object server by not sending content-type

This patch offers an alternative mechanism for detecting older object
servers that does not require changing the object server request path
format.

Older object servers will return a 400 if the PUT+POST protocol does
not include a content-type in the PUT request. Newer object servers
can check for the content-type in the POST request and apply it when
handling the POST.

Note: this patch does not revert the changes in the parent that
implement the path mangling solution.

Change-Id: I828623661a711671775ecb85a37e91d5bf52d82e
'}]
commit_message:
PUT+POST: Detect older object server by not sending content-type

This patch offers an alternative mechanism for detecting older object
servers that does not require changing the object server request path
format.

Older object servers will return a 400 if the PUT+POST protocol does
not include a content-type in the PUT request. Newer object servers
can check for the content-type in the POST request and apply it when
handling the POST.

Note: this patch does not revert the changes in the parent that
implement the path mangling solution.

Change-Id: I828623661a711671775ecb85a37e91d5bf52d82e

commit_message:
Microversion 2.64 - Use new format policy in server group

Added support for microversion 2.64, which includes the
following changes:

- The ``--rule`` option is added to the
``nova server-group-create`` CLI that enables user to create
server group with specific policy rules.

- Remove ``metadata`` column in the output of
``nova server-group-create``, ``nova server-group-get``,
``nova server-group-list``.

- Remove ``policies`` column, , add ``policy`` and ``rules``
columns in the output of ``nova server-group-create``,
``nova server-group-get``, ``nova server-group-list``.

Depends-On: 3cd26f1e68b09ba7925e794ac8912566c239b6df
blueprint: complex-anti-affinity-policies

Change-Id: I903f4b5544806b9d3c8bac529448abbc9dd3cee9

v3password skips discovery, so v3password with unversioned endpoint

won't get clear errors if they leave out domain info.

Change-Id: Ia070ebafb608aec6a85a38feb746113f72c58eec

commit_message:
Add /v3 to the auth_url for vexxhost

v3password skips discovery, so v3password with unversioned endpoint
produces incorrect results. We could go to password, but then people
won't get clear errors if they leave out domain info.

Change-Id: Ia070ebafb608aec6a85a38feb746113f72c58eec

commit_message:
Update get-pip to version 3.3

Version 3.2 has a bug with it on some systems that can result in the
following stacktrace: [ http://paste.openstack.org/show/726064 ]. To
correct this issue the version of the get-pip script has been set to 3.3
which does not suffer from the same issue.

Change-Id: I61a7234dc4fbde1b9319874d82fe33578f490abc
Partial-Bug: 1779534

revisions:

From Rocky, the custom paths for --http-boot should come prefixed with
/var/lib/ironic/http-boot/*. The default command remains unchanged.

Change-Id: Iaed844569221722634f217a2649b84a2033d16f1
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix default http-boot for image upload commands

From Rocky, the custom paths for --http-boot should come prefixed with
/var/lib/ironic/http-boot/*. The default command remains unchanged.

Change-Id: Iaed844569221722634f217a2649b84a2033d16f1
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add systemd configs and update playbook uniformity

Systemd overrides have been added to the service unit files for all
beats and services. All of the playbooks have been updated to make them
look and feel uniform.

This also sets handlers within the playbooks so that we're improving the
idempotence.

Change-Id: I2dd3183dae4bfddc607cc74f9dfb7af115b80abc
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

IMHO, for now, this patch does not resolve some obvious race conditions:
1) one API try to create floating IP port_forwarding under router A, one API try to bind floating IP to a port under router B;
2) one API try to create floating IP port_forwarding, one API try to delete floating IP;
3) floating IP is binding to a port_1 under router A, one API try to update the binding to port_2 under router B, one API try to create floating IP port_forwarding under router A.
In general, the CURD actions of floating IP (including to port) and the CURD actions of port_forwarding may have potential race conditions.

So if these issues will not resolve in this patch, may be you can add some notes in the commit message:
such as `NOT READY TO USE`, `Experimental` and so on.'}, {'account_id': 15309, 'date': '2018-06-07 03:38:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

> @Liu yulong,
IMHO, for now, this patch does not resolve some obvious race conditions:
1) one API try to create floating IP port_forwarding under router A, one API try to bind floating IP to a port under router B;
2) one API try to create floating IP port_forwarding, one API try to delete floating IP;
3) floating IP is binding to a port_1 under router A, one API try to update the binding to port_2 under router B, one API try to create floating IP port_forwarding under router A.
In general, the CURD actions of floating IP (including to port) and the CURD actions of port_forwarding may have potential race conditions.

So if these issues will not resolve in this patch, may be you can add some notes in the commit message:
such as `NOT READY TO USE`, `Experimental` and so on.

REPLY:
hi yulong, at first, thank you for your review here. But I reply you several times about the usecase about this feature.
The floatingip must be use by a port resource or several port forwarding resources. Not both of them, we can not forecase user behavior, if a floating ip had been bound a existing neutron port, he/she run a app using protocol port 3344, we don't know that then create a port forwarding with port 3344 and the floatingip, this is the conflict usecase, it's invalid.
So as the desciption below, we kick off 3).
For 1) and 2), I told u the extend floatingip limitation not implemented in this patch, this patch is large enough(not good for review), this is just about port forwarding part, the limitation patch will be post in the following.
Yeah, for your sight, it's not ready to use, what I want is that the kind reviewers can leave some valuable comments in this specific part. Then we can move forward. Do you agree??
So I'm not happy that taking other issues in this patch again and again, eventhough I know there is race issue if not the limitation part. Do you agree??

But you mentioned here, this part is "NOT READY TO USE", I will mark it as you suggest.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-06-07 20:27:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review-1

For this feature, I have one idea:

much deeply, but all this excellent code is relying on your hard working : )'}, {'account_id': 15309, 'date': '2018-06-08 02:21:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

Thanks, @All, I think the next update would be delay as some deeper issues should be fixed. Thank you all you nice suggestion.

@yulong, 
You are correct. Recently, I try to find some good ways to decrease the effect of race condition, but It just decrease, not solve. Also the server side logic should also forbid the race happen. Such as check whether the fip_obj exist or whether fip_obj.fixed_port_id exist. And there are some works which I may miss, that's the associated Internal Neutron port. The expect behavior is that delete Internal Neutron port, the associated port forwarding resources should be also deleted. But not in fip delete case like the existing logic in this patch.
So please wait for the demo of extended patch. :). Any sugests are welcome. I will post the first version before the end of this weekend."}, {'account_id': 15309, 'date': '2018-06-08 03:01:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15309, 'date': '2018-06-08 09:53:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

@yulong, I found in the race condition, for example, in above discuss [1][2], the 2 API requests, if the create port forwarding request arrived, but get the fip in db before the second  requests, and update fip after the second one. The defualt neutron behavior will retry the whole request by StaleDataError, and the results are expected. But in reverse order, means that the update/delete fip requests get the associated pf before the create port forwarding request, then both of them will success, so I think the right way to do is make the Update/delete fip should aware the port forwarding, such as make them into 1 db transition, like your fip_qos did in neutron/db/l3_fip_qos.py. I think if users request the update/delete fip, we must make sure there is no port forwarding resource associate with it, even though add some validate functions by subcribing resource events, so I think when update_fip, it's better to do something like "update on match". How do you think?'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-06-08 15:33:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

Hi Zhaobo,

Thanks for your hard work. I am embarking in the next round of review of this patch and its follow ups. Since this is a patch is quite large, it is not easy to review, so I have a few questions:

1) What is the general approach you have adopted for handling the race conditions pointed out in the previews reviews?

2) Did you implemented the handling of the race conditions in this patch or in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574673?

3) Would it be possible to make some comments in Gerrit to indicate how are you handling the race conditions? No need to change the code just yet. Just leave some Gerrit comments in this patchset and https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574673, to make the reviewer life easier ;-)'}, {'account_id': 15309, 'date': '2018-06-28 01:09:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 24:

@Miguel, thanks for review. I will reply the questions and update the related patch comments today. :). But I think it's better to explain how to fit the race issues and better understanding.
1) What is the general approach you have adopted for handling the race conditions pointed out in the previews reviews?
As the port forwarding resource associated with 2 resources, one is floatingip, the other is neutron internal port resource.
So floatingip update/delete maybe in a conflict situation with port forwarding CUD. But for port, we just lack the logic to process port forwarding
during update port's fixed_ip and delete port. So my approach is that serialization,
as the key point here we must to make sure the fip/port existing during create/update port forwarding and also make sure whether
there is a port forwrading inused based on the fip during update/delete fip operation. So in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574673 . 
* for fip race issue, I introduce 2 functions in that patch.
_do_create_if_parallel lock by a external lock which based on its related fip_ip
_check_floatingip_request lock by a external lock based on its floatingip id.
So during floatingip update/delete, these functions will be locked to process serialize if they are procesing the same fip resource.
* for port, during update port fixed_ip or delete port, we will delete the associated port forwarding resources for free the fip protocol_port.

2) Did you implemented the handling of the race conditions in this patch or in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574673?
I fix in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574673

3) Would it be possible to make some comments in Gerrit to indicate how are you handling the race conditions? No need to change the code just yet. Just leave some Gerrit comments in this patchset and https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574673, to make the reviewer life easier ;-)
Thanks, Miguel. You are right, I will do that and describe what this patch does in commit message."}, {'account_id': 15309, 'date': '2018-06-28 11:13:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 25.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-06-28 18:51:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
[server side] Floating IP port forwarding OVO and db script

This patch implements the port forwarding OVO and db layer code.
Such as:
* Introduces a new OVO named 'PortForwarding'.
* Introduces a new db model for OVO.
* A migration db script for port forwarding function.

Partially-Implements: blueprint port-forwarding
This patch partially implements the following spec:
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/rocky/port-forwarding.html

The race issue fix in:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574673/

Fip extend port forwarding field addition in:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575326/

Partial-Bug: #1491317
Change-Id: If24e1b3161e2a86ccc5cc21acf05d0a17f6856e7

subject: Switch to pep8 output format
messages:
[{'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-07-17 12:42:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-07-18 05:20:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I think i'm ok with just switching to this as discussed in the other change, but I'd like to see

 - the prior change referenced in commit for clarity
 - a release note added that the output format changed
 - a comment above this code to be careful about compatibility of output
 - a note in the readme that the output format attempts to conform to pep8"}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-07-18 10:14:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-07-18 10:17:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-07-18 22:23:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

commit_message:
Switch to pep8 output format

Change output format so it would follow the same
default format used by pep8/pycodestyle which is
parsable by many tools.

Relates to https://review.openstack.org/335520

commit_message:
Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement two new variables:
- neutron_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host
- neutron_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

These are used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Change-Id: I163c33254651c95f9dfae2bd859fe727380a3b01

commit_message:
Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement two new variables:
- ceilometer_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host
- ceilometer_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

These are used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Change-Id: If59922884f893961feeb3b475b0c84160f348c49

'}]
commit_message:
[placement] Add gabbi coverage for inv of missing rp

There was no gabbi coverage for the case where a GET request was being
made for single class of inventory on a non-existent resource provider.
This adds it.

Note that it would have been possible to add an error code/comment for
the raised exception, but this was not done in this change because there
is another change in progress which is adding the appropriate code.

Change-Id: I1858f4eb617cc81b41610195bb9a33a9059850f7

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-22 16:38:52.000000000', 'message': 'Add missing policy actions to policy.json file

This patchset adds missing policy actions to the policy.json
file for several reasons:

1) It signals to operators all the policy actions that are
   enforced in the system. With the governance spec [0]
   urging projects toward policy in code documentation,
   it makes sense to document all policy changes in the
   policy.json as Neutron doesn't have policy in code.

2) It is consistent with Neutron's policy enforcement
   documentation [1]:

   "For each attribute which has been explicitly specified in the
    request create a rule matching policy names in the form
    <operation>_<resource>:<attribute> rule"

    So it makes sense to capture each policy that is enforced,
    including all those with these special attributes.

3) Why include "update_router:external_gateway_info" but not
   "create_router:external_gateway_info"? This is inconsistent.

4) It makes it difficult to validate Neutron's policy via Patrole
   if the policies aren't contained in the policy.json -- how else
   is it possible to determine which policies to expect if they
   aren't documented anywhere?

[0] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html
[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/pike/contributor/internals/policy.html#authorization-workflow

Change-Id: I40f84134f0b56cfd574dfd69e5ebbf6a3fc2b3df

commit_message:
Add missing policy actions to policy.json file

This patchset adds missing policy actions to the policy.json
file for several reasons:

1) It signals to operators all the policy actions that are
   enforced in the system. With the governance spec [0]
   urging projects toward policy in code documentation,
   it makes sense to document all policy actions in the
   policy.json as Neutron doesn't have policy in code.

2) It is consistent with Neutron's policy enforcement
   documentation [1]:

   "For each attribute which has been explicitly specified in the
    request create a rule matching policy names in the form
    <operation>_<resource>:<attribute> rule"

    So it makes sense to capture each policy that is enforced,
    including all those with these special attributes.

3) Why include "update_router:external_gateway_info" but not
   "create_router:external_gateway_info"? This is inconsistent.

4) It makes it difficult to validate Neutron's policy via Patrole
   if the policies aren't contained in the policy.json -- how else
   is it possible to determine which policies to expect if they
   aren't documented anywhere?

[0] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html
[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/pike/contributor/internals/policy.html#authorization-workflow

Change-Id: I40f84134f0b56cfd574dfd69e5ebbf6a3fc2b3df

commit_message:
Set max_microversion 2.43 for virtual_interfaces tests

The compute os-virtual-interfaces API is deprecated from the
Microversion 2.44, so we should set max_microversion = '2.43'
for compute virtual_interfaces tests.

Change-Id: Ie1793802fa33898ffbdad16b58b085894e66d4d1
ref: https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#list-virtual-interfaces

subject: Move MQ vhost/user creation into role
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-17 21:03:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13095, 'date': '2018-07-18 14:58:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-07-18 22:08:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 21:03:53.000000000', 'message': "Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement two new variables:
- designate_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host
- designate_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

These are used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Change-Id: I65203372e551d5ab3ef17a823f2089c23a2af8fe
"}]
commit_message:
Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement two new variables:
- designate_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host
- designate_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

These are used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Change-Id: I65203372e551d5ab3ef17a823f2089c23a2af8fe

commit_message:
Fix notify MQ defaults

The notify defaults are incorrectly referring to the rpc
defaults. This corrects them.

Change-Id: I0673cd59a620e6f915b7da6f03f3104925961ff5

commit_message:
Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement two new variables:
- heat_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host
- heat_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

These are used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Change-Id: I7deae4d8b8b0e2a7e5c810312a5859900a63901a

commit_message:
udp: remove wrong and useless tests

Those tests do not work on systems that are able to create AF_INET6 socket for
IPv4 addresses (e.g. Darwin). They also don't test anything since they're just
mocking stuff to check the logic.

Change-Id: I2205b969db09760dd96cfbc0fd701896ef944cf4

commit_message:
Fix usage of "|" for tests

With the more recent versions of ansible, we should now use
"is" instead of the "|" sign for the tests.

This should fix it.

commit_message:
Allow setting test API microversions in gate tests

Add MANILA_TEMPEST_MIN_API_MICROVERSION and
MANILA_TEMPEST_MAX_API_MICROVERSION to the ci
post_test_hook. These options default to
the values specified in the api_version_request.py
file.

Also add the API Version History to the api-ref.

Change-Id: I21b3a705986216afb0ce73ca1f92571dda757408
Closes-Bug: #1781671

commit_message:
Add pauch to the includepkgs

We gate paunch on tripleo so the latest version should be included
rather than using the promotion process.

Change-Id: I7f6f4e329c75771e1e5be16b3d699b3384693a21

commit_message:
Add check for OVS for objects that require it

OpenvSwitch is not required for os-net-config to run.  However, some
objects (OvsBond, OvsBridge etc.) rely on OVS being installed.  This
adds a check for the existence of OVS before creating objects that
require it. If not installed, an exception will be raised.

Change-Id: Ic3d5c00f0ae9e4f8169d418802d6be840ce5c2e1

commit_message:
add 'jobs switch packaging' command

Add a command to modify the project-config settings for all of the
packaging jobs that need to be updated to the new one.

Change-Id: I54bb5daeb5777bd13abc5cd7347dba77bd643c59
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add packages required for osprofiler

The following packages are required in-order to run osprofiler.
these packages will provide deployers the ability to profile
a service on demand should they choose to enable the profile
functionality.

Change-Id: I22bf333e42f4961a89eb593c95838fd65a966d93
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Replace Exception.message with str(Exception)

In Python 3 message was removed. Converting to a string gives us the
same result.

Closes-Bug: #1782194
Change-Id: I88f4546e0f78ffce86be192d2c0e10dbaa8c5859

commit_message:
net_utils: Add a random mac generator

If you want to generate thousands of mac addresses for ports in the same
subnet, it is much more efficient to use the generator as it will
guarantee that you will not get repeated macs. It is also about 2x as
fast when not counting repetition.

The use case for this in Neutron is for making the bulk port creation
perform all the port creation at once, without having to go one by one
internally as it currently does.

Implements: blueprint speed-up-neutron-bulk-creation
Change-Id: I8551c88ffe3ddefe617fb052eb7ca6f0d7d85069
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

commit_message:
Add packages required for osprofiler

The following packages are required in-order to run osprofiler.
these packages will provide deployers the ability to profile
a service on demand should they choose to enable the profile
functionality.

Depends-On: I3df2c670beeb78baaa1515bcd27e8f2b0d95b3a9
Change-Id: Ia6190b72b7611c0c2f9952c10051c80d01143233
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

[{'account_id': 21099, 'date': '2018-01-02 23:33:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2018-01-16 19:41:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Very overdue!!! Thanks for picking this up!

I didn't dig too far into this, because I think the first step here is to rework the inheritance hierarchy, and then a lot of the rest will shake out nicely...

All our volume adapters but one are in actuality using vSCSI (the technology), which the current modeling of our code does a very poor job of representing. Instead of introducing a new SCSIVolumeAdapter, I would like to see a VSCSIVolumeAdapter class that inherits from PowerVMVolumeAdapter and then make everything except NPIVVolumeAdapter inherit from that (or a subclass). Basically, I think we got it backward when we made FibreChannelVolumeAdapter a child of PowerVMVolumeAdapter and VscsiVolumeAdapter just an object."}, {'account_id': 21099, 'date': '2018-01-26 16:10:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21099, 'date': '2018-01-26 16:10:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(10 comments)

removing procedural -2 since queens has branched. Some inline comments, but I haven't gone through most of the changes yet so I will probably have more."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-02-09 21:08:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(5 comments)

I really only skimmed this.

It's encouraging that the unit tests pass.  But we're not testing any of this in the CI (right esberglu?) so I'd like to make sure it gets tested manually.  It's going to suck having to dig up test environments for all of the volume drivers, but c'est la vie."}, {'account_id': 21099, 'date': '2018-02-09 21:26:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 21099, 'date': '2018-02-09 21:26:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Refactor volume drivers

Refactor volume drivers (vscsi, iscsi, fileio, rbd) since there is
a lot of common code between them.
Pull out wwpn method from fcpvvscsi and npiv classes.

Change-Id: Iebad18421a1bb570d88dcafe16bbea4d2eab8e7c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-12 01:33:55.000000000', 'message': 'fix IBM i boot type logic

Replaces PowerVC-specific logic for determining IBM i boot type
with logic that is more appropriate for an OpenStack compute driver
that is not specific to PowerVC.

Change-Id: I0d6803f92913b5408694898f3eda8380a03ed8d6
'}, {'created': '2018-05-25 06:26:57.000000000', 'message': 'fix IBM i boot type logic

Fixes the logic for determining IBM i boot type by:
1) no longer checking for connection_info fields that never exist, and
2) properly distinguishing between NPIV and vSCSI when the driver
volume type is fibre_channel.

Change-Id: I0d6803f92913b5408694898f3eda8380a03ed8d6
'}]
commit_message:
fix IBM i boot type logic

Fixes the logic for determining IBM i boot type by:
1) no longer checking for connection_info fields that never exist, and
2) properly distinguishing between NPIV and vSCSI when the driver
volume type is fibre_channel.

Change-Id: I0d6803f92913b5408694898f3eda8380a03ed8d6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-24 02:55:09.000000000', 'message': "Add port_delete method to Linux bridge agent

This commit adds a port_delete method to the Linux bridge agent to
receive messages from the ML2 plugin when a binding is de-activated
for a port. After receiving that message, the agent un-plugs the
corresponding tap interface from the port's network bridge.

To support this, two arguments are added to the port_delete method in
the agents notifier. These arguments are cast to the agents and contain
the network and the host id where the binding has to be deactivated.

Finally, the activate method in the ML2 plugin is updated to use the
port_delete method in the agents notifier.

Change-Id: I3f4e34766791c472a2c81842190094f697baa05c
Partial-Bug: #1580880
"}, {'created': '2018-04-26 03:19:40.000000000', 'message': "Add binding_deactivate method to Linux bridge agent

commit_message:
Add binding_deactivate method to Linux bridge agent

This commit adds a binding_deactivate method to the Linux bridge agent
to receive messages from the ML2 plugin when a binding is de-activated
for a port. After receiving that message, the agent un-plugs the
corresponding tap interface from the port's network bridge.

To support this, a binding_deactivate method is also added to the agents
notifier. Finally, the activate method in the ML2 plugin is updated to
use the binding_deactivate method in the agents notifier.

Change-Id: I3f4e34766791c472a2c81842190094f697baa05c
Partial-Bug: #1580880

commit_message:
Update get_port_binding_host for multiple bindings

With the adoption of multiple port bindings, get_port_binding_host is
updated to select only the active binding

Change-Id: I57ee16aa970527de2c2d787ebf0df71241f01e74
Partial-Bug: #1580880

subject: Do not call crm_node -n when running in a container
messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-07-18 16:31:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-07-18 20:54:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-18 16:31:03.000000000', 'message': 'Do not call crm_node -n when running in a container

In lib/facter/pacemaker_node_name.rb we do the following:
Facter.add('pacemaker_node_name') do
  setcode do
    Facter::Core::Execution.exec 'crm_node -n'
  end
end

This is problematic because starting with pacemaker 1.1.19 crm_node -n
will trigger a newly-introduced CRM_OP_NODE_INFO query which will hang
if the container runs 1.1.19 code and the cluster runs 1.1.18 code.

Let's simply avoid running these queries when run inside a container.

Tested this by deploying successfully an overcloud with pcmk-1.1.19 in
containers and 1.1.18 on the host:
[root@controller-0 ~]# rpm -q pacemaker
pacemaker-1.1.18-11.el7_5.3.x86_64
[root@controller-0 ~]# docker exec -it galera-bundle-docker-0 sh -c "rpm -q pacemaker"
pacemaker-1.1.19-3.el7.x86_64

For this to work we also need the following RA fix:
https://github.com/ClusterLabs/resource-agents/pull/1173/

Previously this would fail with crm_node -n just hanging.

Change-Id: I9ae7df2f49f918507c5f98b2441b5b17423a38da
Closes-Bug: #1782231
(cherry picked from commit 966943a79e11eccac5ec0868836239c55e3845dc)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not call crm_node -n when running in a container

In lib/facter/pacemaker_node_name.rb we do the following:
Facter.add('pacemaker_node_name') do
  setcode do
    Facter::Core::Execution.exec 'crm_node -n'
  end
end

This is problematic because starting with pacemaker 1.1.19 crm_node -n
will trigger a newly-introduced CRM_OP_NODE_INFO query which will hang
if the container runs 1.1.19 code and the cluster runs 1.1.18 code.

Let's simply avoid running these queries when run inside a container.

Tested this by deploying successfully an overcloud with pcmk-1.1.19 in
containers and 1.1.18 on the host:
[root@controller-0 ~]# rpm -q pacemaker
pacemaker-1.1.18-11.el7_5.3.x86_64
[root@controller-0 ~]# docker exec -it galera-bundle-docker-0 sh -c "rpm -q pacemaker"
pacemaker-1.1.19-3.el7.x86_64

For this to work we also need the following RA fix:
https://github.com/ClusterLabs/resource-agents/pull/1173/

Previously this would fail with crm_node -n just hanging.

Change-Id: I9ae7df2f49f918507c5f98b2441b5b17423a38da
Closes-Bug: #1782231
(cherry picked from commit 966943a79e11eccac5ec0868836239c55e3845dc)

messages:
[{'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-07-12 19:20:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-12 22:18:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

I'm not sure we can fix this in a reasonable way without delving into PIP.

Perhaps we should consider *why* we don't allow post releases in general and in particular this one.  We might be doing ourselves a disservice"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-07-12 23:57:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-07-13 00:16:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-13 00:19:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-07-13 17:02:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-07-13 20:08:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-07-13 20:12:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-07-13 21:17:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

If we're not sure why we're preventing them, we should wait and see if they actually cause problems.

I know we have avoided supporting pre-releases or alphas & betas in the past because you have to give pip special instructions to install them. I don't think that applies to post versioned packages, since those are only supposed to have minor fixes for the package itself."}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-07-13 22:12:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-07-14 01:09:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-14 04:17:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> If we're not sure why we're preventing them, we should wait and see
 > if they actually cause problems.
 > 
 > I know we have avoided supporting pre-releases or alphas & betas in
 > the past because you have to give pip special instructions to
 > install them. I don't think that applies to post versioned
 > packages, since those are only supposed to have minor fixes for the
 > package itself.

Passing on the discussion on *all* .post releases which I think we need to have.

pyldap-3.0.0 is an *empty* package that just requires py-ldap-$some_version.  The only differences between 3.0.0 and 3.0.0.post1 are documentation and packaging.

 * afcd69d (HEAD -> master, tag: python-ldap-3.0.0.post1, origin/master, origin/HEAD) Bump version to 3.0.0.post1 to accomodate README/description change
 * 8e2aeee Add a warning about pip upgrade to README and package description
 * 47db63d Update python-ldap version and links


 README   | 28 ++++++++++++++++++++++++++--
 setup.py | 10 +++++-----
 2 files changed, 31 insertions(+), 7 deletions(-)

I think in the case of pyldap we really don't care about the .post1 as it's functionally identical to 3.0.0 and we should accept it in the next bot update.

I think we should think about a general policy and discuss it at the next team meeting."}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-07-14 04:25:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow-1

we can discuss this at the meeting -W til then'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-07-14 07:04:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Please explain the *rationale* in the git commit message, otherwise it isn't clear to me why we're doing this.

Concretely I don't understand what issue we have with post releases? In PEP440 they're not indicating instability, do they?"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-07-18 20:59:46.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

we are allowing post releases'}]

commit_message:
disable post-releases from being proposed

disallow them in requirements as well.

There are some libs that ONLY have post releases available.
We need a whitelist for those.

Change-Id: Id120c968adf99cbb878fcb00d9c5d5a46d61921f

trivial: Fix file permissions

No reason for these to be executable.

subject: standalone: introduce enable_pacemaker
messages:
[{'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-07-13 20:12:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-07-16 21:08:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-07-18 19:59:26.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Doesn't fit with out plans."}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-07-18 20:08:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Not particularly against it or not, but if we ever plan to let an All-In-One setup to scale up then there is really no way around something like this blueprint tbh.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-07-18 20:16:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

so we can easily make the standalone working with Pacemaker without this patch, we just need the right environment that sets Keepalived to None and enable Pacemaker.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-07-18 20:39:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> so we can easily make the standalone working with Pacemaker without
 > this patch, we just need the right environment that sets Keepalived
 > to None and enable Pacemaker.

I guess I am fine with either approach (undercloud option to enable it or specific role) (that is if the AIO scaling up use case becomes mandatory)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-13 20:12:16.000000000', 'message': "WIP - standalone: introduce enable_pacemaker

Unit tests aren't working yet, this patch is highly WIP:
- need to fix tests
- need a release note.

This new option will allow an operator to deploy an undercloud or
standalone deployment with Pacemaker instead of Keepalived. Note HAproxy
is still used for Load-Balancing.

Change-Id: I9a83a07b087cad9d35c3f7539998d0d3eaf25469
Blueprint: undercloud-pacemaker-default
"}, {'created': '2018-07-16 21:08:53.000000000', 'message': 'standalone: introduce enable_pacemaker

This new option will allow an operator to deploy an undercloud or
standalone deployment with Pacemaker instead of Keepalived. Note HAproxy

Change-Id: I9a83a07b087cad9d35c3f7539998d0d3eaf25469
Blueprint: undercloud-pacemaker-default

commit_message:
standalone: introduce enable_pacemaker

This new option will allow an operator to deploy an undercloud or
standalone deployment with Pacemaker instead of Keepalived. Note HAproxy
is still used for Load-Balancing.

Change-Id: I9a83a07b087cad9d35c3f7539998d0d3eaf25469
Blueprint: undercloud-pacemaker-default

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-11 00:40:16.000000000', 'message': "Add ability to specify mode to attachment-create

************* WIP ********************
Trying to untangle mv additions to the client to enable/support this
change.  Once that's done I'll make that a cross-repo dependency of this
change and remove the WIP status.
**************************************

This patch is the next step in simplifying how we create and
manage Read Only Volume Attachments.

Currently, we have multiple ways of doing this including
volume_admin_metadata and the connector that's supplied during
attachment processes.  The problem is that this method requires
you to set and match both settings; and there are a lot of places
things can go wrong.

If you use volume_admin_metadata, the volume must ALWAYS receive
a connector that has read only specified in it, otherwise if the
values don't match, the attach calls fail.

If you don't use the metadata setting (ie you don't want the volume
to be exclusively Read Only) you can just specify the mode in the
connector.  Rather than have these two different settings and juggle
the various attachment parameters that have been introduced
(attach_mode, access_mode, volume_admin_metadata:read_only...) it
would be much more straight forward to just allow the ability to
specify an attach mode during attachment-create and use that setting.

This change adds that option to attachment-create, but it also makes
keeps backward compatibility with the volume_admin_metadata for those
that are using it.  Yes, we could just do a version bump and eliminate
admin_metadata; but maintaining the two independently is more disruptive
than just keeping compatibility.

One thing that this change does that might be unexpected, is it
eliminates the requirement for volume_admin_metadata and the connectors
mode parameters to match.  It assumes that if an admin went through the
trouble to set a volumes admin_metadata to read only, then it should in
fact be read only regardless of the connector.  So we always revert to
the admin_metadata setting, and modify the connector if they don't
match.

The next step in getting completely away from admin_metadata is to
introduce the ability to create a Read Only volume via types; that will
by the global setting for a volume in terms of it's attachment setting.

None of this enforces anything on the consumer side (the old methods
didn't either) but it does set flags on the volume and attachment record
indicating what was requested and what we expect the consumer to be
doing with the volume.

Change-Id: I091f4eb8f1b464bb2dddb0a29245690a0430142e

commit_message:
Add ability to specify mode to attachment-create

This patch is the next step in simplifying how we create and
manage Read Only Volume Attachments.

Currently, we have multiple ways of doing this including
volume_admin_metadata and the connector that's supplied during
attachment processes.  The problem is that this method requires
you to set and match both settings; and there are a lot of places
things can go wrong.

If you use volume_admin_metadata, the volume must ALWAYS receive
a connector that has read only specified in it, otherwise if the
values don't match, the attach calls fail.

If you don't use the metadata setting (ie you don't want the volume
to be exclusively Read Only) you can just specify the mode in the
connector.  Rather than have these two different settings and juggle
the various attachment parameters that have been introduced
(attach_mode, access_mode, volume_admin_metadata:read_only...) it
would be much more straight forward to just allow the ability to
specify an attach mode during attachment-create and use that setting.

This change adds that option to attachment-create, but it also
keeps backward compatibility with the volume_admin_metadata for those
that are using it.  Yes, we could just do a version bump and eliminate
admin_metadata; but maintaining the two independently is more disruptive
than just keeping compatibility.

One thing that this change does that might be unexpected, is it
eliminates the requirement for volume_admin_metadata and the connectors
mode parameters to match.  It assumes that if an admin went through the
trouble to set a volumes admin_metadata to read only, then it should in
fact be read only regardless of the connector.  So we always revert to
the admin_metadata setting, and modify the connector if they don't
match.

The next step in getting completely away from admin_metadata is to
introduce the ability to create a Read Only volume via types; that will
by the global setting for a volume in terms of its attachment setting.

None of this enforces anything on the consumer side (the old methods
didn't either) but it does set flags on the volume and attachment record
indicating what was requested and what we expect the consumer to be
doing with the volume.

Change-Id: I091f4eb8f1b464bb2dddb0a29245690a0430142e

commit_message:
Add project_id filter for listing limit

Add project_id filter for listing limit. This filter
can be only used by system-scoped request to fetch the
specified project's limits.

bp: strict-two-level-model

Change-Id: I1b8cc227ed0710702aa099f09821f6eb897bb32c

commit_message:
Switch to using stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is
maintained project to which all Openstack projects
should migrate.
Let's switch it then.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Also update requirements to pass gating.

Change-Id: Ibc8575f9f1c6084ec3e695c1ba5827b712aba318
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <zulcss@gmail.com>

subject: requirements.sh: parallel build only on x86-64 please
messages:
[{'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2018-07-16 12:22:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2018-07-16 19:00:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The Cassandra build speed improvement was recommeneded for us to use and is Documented. What is the issue with it?

Also, we build numpy for x86 currently, so im not sure what you are saying in the commit message.

The way the build *should* work (and I won't claim no bugs), but it should preseve all packages it builds, and it builds all packages from upper-constraints.txt upstream.

To my nothing *should* need to change for ARM (unless there are bugs).

Can you provide additional details here?"}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2018-07-16 20:45:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2018-07-18 20:10:31.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-16 12:22:15.000000000', 'message': 'requirements.sh: parallel build only on x86-64 please

On !x86 we do not have binary modules from Pypi so have to build some of
them. Numpy for example - and as it takes lot of time other
installations fail as they assume that numpy is already present.

Change-Id: Ib3b2e43bd70c4d77a2c82d854fedc6430feb2752
'}]
commit_message:
requirements.sh: parallel build only on x86-64 please

On !x86 we do not have binary modules from Pypi so have to build some of
them. Numpy for example - and as it takes lot of time other
installations fail as they assume that numpy is already present.

Change-Id: Ib3b2e43bd70c4d77a2c82d854fedc6430feb2752

subject: pip_install: disable '--only-binary' for !x86-64 architectures
messages:
[{'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2018-07-16 12:22:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2018-07-16 19:06:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

We only pull native python wheels from pypi.

You are misunderstanding the purpose of this flag. This is to ensure that we *don't* build anything. The only time we build (or install build tools) is in the requirements image. Different architectures don't change this behaviour."}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2018-07-16 19:07:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2018-07-16 20:45:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2018-07-18 20:10:24.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

Change-Id: Ide01a3bec950e2e6f42eea8f0b3a7c477a1f59be
"}]
commit_message:
pip_install: disable '--only-binary' for !x86-64 architectures

Pypi provides binary modules only for x86 architectures. So build fails
on aarch64 one.

Change-Id: Ide01a3bec950e2e6f42eea8f0b3a7c477a1f59be

commit_message:
Deprecate store_add_to_backend()

A replacement, store_add_to_backend_with_multihash(), has been
introduced in Rocky.  The old function is kept in Rocky for
backward compatability.  This deprecation notice registers our
intent to remove it in Stein.

Change-Id: If09ae10ee160e3fbfafce94e4f3607994af63ec5

messages:
[{'account_id': 26734, 'date': '2017-12-18 19:05:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26734, 'date': '2017-12-18 19:06:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 26734, 'date': '2018-01-10 15:54:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26734, 'date': '2018-01-10 17:15:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-05-02 15:33:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-07-08 20:57:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-07-09 10:01:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Devstack setup failed on legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-07-09 10:01:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-07-09 11:16:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(3 comments)

Some nits, implementation looks good at the first glance.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-07-09 11:36:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

Abhishek: thanks for the review, you noticed some good stuff.

Going to rewrite this to eliminate the backward-incompatibility as we discussed in #openstack_glance this morning.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-07-10 17:42:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-07-10 17:49:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-07-10 18:07:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

just one nit, as you need to spin another patch. Will test this functionally tomorrow my time.

Just one question:
to avoid passing hashing_algo as keyword argument you have written that decorator right?'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-07-10 19:05:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

@Abhishek: yes, what the decorator does is allow you to call add() as you do now.  With no hashing_algo specified, it will feed the add() 'md5', which will be ultimately thrown away, but is fast.  After the wrapped function returns, it will return a 4 tuple without the multihash value.  If you supply a hashing_algo, either as named argument or positionally, it will return a 5-tuple including the multihash."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-07-10 19:06:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-07-10 19:32:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-07-12 05:19:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

Code looks solid, I have put one more inline question. If its desired way I will put +2.

Thank you Scott and Brian!'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-07-12 12:47:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

Reply to Abhishek inline.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-07-12 12:52:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

Thank you Brian, comments in the decorator helps a lot to understand what exactly is happening!!'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-07-12 12:53:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

So far just reviewed the wrapper.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-07-12 12:56:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: -Code-Review

I was under impression that we don't want to introduce hashing_algo as default variable in the decorator, if we do so what erno is saying is correct."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-07-13 15:56:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I disagree with Erno.  What we want is to have hashing_algo be a required parameter without a default in the updated store.add() methods.  So we really do need to go through all the fiddling for the decorator to make it backward compatible with the non-multihash-required add() function.  Plus, it's not like there aren't tests to make sure the decorator is working correctly."}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-07-13 17:20:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> I disagree with Erno.  What we want is to have hashing_algo be a
 > required parameter without a default in the updated store.add()
 > methods.  So we really do need to go through all the fiddling for
 > the decorator to make it backward compatible with the
 > non-multihash-required add() function.  Plus, it's not like there
 > aren't tests to make sure the decorator is working correctly.

Like said yesterday in IRC my point was not to judge it's current operability but rather maintainability for futureproofing the development. If we definitely want to keep the "hashing_algo" as positional argument rather than kw argument we can still replace the decorator with much simpler one that won't break in case that function definition changes again. For example like https://paste.openstack.org/show/725841'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-07-13 17:22:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

paste.openstack.org seems to be http only, sorry for that http://paste.openstack.org/show/725841'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-07-17 22:53:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-07-17 22:54:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Will rebase when I get back from dinner.  Uploading this patch anyway in case I get hit by a bus.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-07-18 02:11:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-07-18 02:17:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Thanks to Erno's example, I was able to vastly simplify the backward-compat decorator.  It should be a lot easier to understand and maintain now."}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-07-18 08:25:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

Minor nit, done some testing with current glance + multiple backend + multihash, backward compatibility is intact. Tested import and create api's."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-07-18 12:49:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)

Thanks for the review Abhishek, and especially your testing.  I'll put up a new patch fixing the docstrings, might as well get them all consistent, especially since the design of glance_store encourages developers to work specifically on one particular driver ... an inaccurate docstring is worse than no docstring at all!"}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-07-18 13:02:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-07-18 13:15:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2

Based on Abhishek's testing and previous CI results, this update looks good and addresses the remaining comments. Looks ready to go to me."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-07-18 13:28:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-07-18 13:28:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Added one more test for the wrapper.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-07-18 13:38:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-07-18 17:03:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2

Looks better, Thank you Brian!!'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-07-18 17:36:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Additional release note deprecating store_add_to_backend is here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583657/'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-07-18 18:35:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Multihash Implementation for Glance

Adds the ability to compute a "multihash" (see the Glance spec
for what this is exactly).  To maintain backward compatability,
a new store_add_to_backend_with_multihash function is added.
Backward compatability for each store's add() method is achieved
by a back_compat_add wrapper.

Co-Authored-by: Scott McClymont <scott.mcclymont@verizonwireless.com>
Co-Authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I063d0900b7dc7e0d94dfb685971eb9b17ed67c7b
Partially-implements: blueprint multihash

commit_message:
fs027: enable pacemaker on the undercloud

This is WIP for now, but used for testing.

This patch will replace Keepalived by Pacemaker on the Undercloud only
job (featureset027).

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583052/
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583049/
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582682/

Change-Id: I86422455f78ad556c221ca2b7c157b2136a7f725
Blueprint: undercloud-pacemaker-default

commit_message:
Allow to set enable_pacemaker for undercloud.conf

Allow to configure enable_pacemaker (false by default) in
undercloud.conf. Note this is to replace Keepalived by Pacemaker on the
undercloud, when SSL is enabled.

Blueprint: undercloud-pacemaker-default
Change-Id: Ic2c0376b60afbbb6b4a4f0314ed007e742fdf1e7

commit_message:
standalone/undercloud roles: add Pacemaker services

Add the Pacemaker services to the Standalone and Undercloud roles by
default, so we can later enable them. By default, the services are
disabled.

Change-Id: I19e13e13bd332d19e8e45d08ec66e6e891e0651c
Blueprint: undercloud-pacemaker-default

installed the api-paste.ini, this file is not treated as a dpkg
configuration file, and as a result @ Queens, the file from the
package is not installed over any previous version.

commit_message:
Render api-paste.ini from charm

Due to misc bugs in the way older versions of the gnocchi packages
installed the api-paste.ini, this file is not treated as a dpkg
configuration file, and as a result @ Queens, the file from the
package is not installed over any previous version.

Include api-paste.ini as part of the charm to ensure that a good
paste configuration is installed for all Gnocchi releases.

Change-Id: I1362a64368f0df8e07c7d29d5b504edaf96a70de
Closes-Bug: 1781468
(cherry picked from commit 60678f23b107d346f2de5acdded2ea48c624cd94)

commit_message:
Update WSGI process group

Ensure WSGI processes run under the 'gnocchi' group to
support restriction in permissions to /etc/gnocchi/* to
root or members of the gnocchi group.

This change also picks up changes in charms.openstack
to support this functionality, as well as fixing
misc issues with upgrades.

Change-Id: I14d865cd96b7c250ad92c8bdee74693a6eccc769
Closes-Bug: 1780490
Closes-Bug: 1779062
Related-Bug: 1781468
(cherry picked from commit bc1745115b6a9c7837075a4353d60a1e5a1e2ca9)

commit_message:
Notify apache for nova placement

If you are running a node with only placement
and not the api at all (under apache) we must
make sure to notify the apache service to refresh
on nova::service::begin anchor refreshes otherwise
the placement service will never be refreshed.

Change-Id: I34462faa4b318030d74a43dfbd8b861c47a12b22

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-09 18:34:23.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate some neutron.db._utils methods

The filter_non_model_columns and get_marker_obj methods
in neutron.db._utils are now marked as deprecated and will
be removed in a future release.  They are already available
in neutron_lib.db.utils, so all remaining callers were
changed accordingly.

Removed the _filter_non_model_columns and _get_marker_obj methods
since they were just re-directing to the neutron.db._utils code
and were not being used.

Change-Id: Ibbc737ca7e1ca215476dc53465c0ae9894230256
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate some neutron.db._utils methods

The filter_non_model_columns and get_marker_obj methods
in neutron.db._utils are now marked as deprecated and will
be removed in a future release.  They are already available
in neutron_lib.db.utils, so all remaining callers were
changed accordingly.

Removed the _filter_non_model_columns and _get_marker_obj methods
since they were just re-directing to the neutron.db._utils code
and were not being used.

Change-Id: Ibbc737ca7e1ca215476dc53465c0ae9894230256

Add tests for --wrap option for driver-properties output

Test default and several alternative wrapping values.

Change-Id: I382675bed9f8ebdb0a8c87973afe9f822ca68f1e

commit_message:
Add functional tests for VIFs with ironicclient commands

Add tests for commands:
  ironic node-vif-attach
  ironic node-vif-detach
  ironic node-vif-list

Closes-Bug: #1662966
Change-Id: Ifd986c76d9763e10d1ac7b73c06487d3e6fda9ac

commit_message:
Pluralize binding relationship in Port

As a consequence of implementing multiple bindings for ports, [1] made
the following attributes lists:

- 'port_binding' in the in the SQLAlchemy Port model
- 'binding' in the Port OVO

This patch pluralizes their names to 'port_bindings' and 'bindings'
respectively

[1] Ie31d4e27e3f55edfe334c4029ca9ed685e684c39

Change-Id: I4ebe47cf9d51a700310aad8dcccc82fea3f00a16
