revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-07 03:03:10.000000000', 'message': 'Bump hacking to 1.1.0

hacking 1.0+ adds a couple of additional checks that are helpful as part
of the transition to Python 3. However, hacking 1.1.0 incorporated
flake8 2.6.x, which transitioned from pep8 to pycodestyle. Tempest
provides some hacking extensions and these use pep8 imports. As things
stand, projects that wish to use these hacking extensions must either
constrain themselves to the same older hacking versions or install pep8
manually. Neither of these approaches is particularly attractive so
instead transition to hacking 1.1.0 ourselves. This has the benefit of
giving us the additional checks for Python 3.

Based off https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580634/1/

Change-Id: I8ed5aa0ccd02a792d26d3bef1949a7e1a3f600ed

commit_message:
Bump hacking to 1.1.0

hacking 1.0+ adds a couple of additional checks that are helpful as part
of the transition to Python 3. However, hacking 1.1.0 incorporated
flake8 2.6.x, which transitioned from pep8 to pycodestyle. Tempest
provides some hacking extensions and these use pep8 imports. As things
stand, projects that wish to use these hacking extensions must either
constrain themselves to the same older hacking versions or install pep8
manually. Neither of these approaches is particularly attractive so
instead transition to hacking 1.1.0 ourselves. This has the benefit of
giving us the additional checks for Python 3.

Based off https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580634/1/

Change-Id: I8ed5aa0ccd02a792d26d3bef1949a7e1a3f600ed

commit_message:
Add zuul jobs for tripleo-modify-image

The minimal jobs plus scenario001 are added. scenario001 gives good
coverage because it aims to update packages inside images during both
undercloud and overcloud install.

Change-Id: I2ddf73192efc95e5d4102ea264650ccaa3437e5a

[{'created': '2017-09-19 19:59:00.000000000', 'message': "Document endpoint interface and region behavior

After some debugging following [0] to figure out why ksm was
not connecting to the specified auth_url, found out that
ksm connects to the identity server on the 'admin' interface
[1] after authenticating with auth_url and fetching the catalog if
keystoneauth is being used. Otherwise it connects on identity_uri
and disregards the service catalog [2].  This behavior was not
documented.

[0]. http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-keystone/%23openstack-keystone.2017-09-19.log.html#t2017-09-19T17:50:06
[1]. https://github.com/openstack/keystonemiddleware/blob/master/keystonemiddleware/auth_token/__init__.py#L932-L933
[2]. https://github.com/openstack/keystonemiddleware/blob/master/keystonemiddleware/auth_token/_auth.py#L121-L130

After some debugging following [0] to figure out why ksm was
not connecting to the specified auth_url, found out that
ksm connects to the identity server on the 'admin' interface

commit_message:
Document endpoint interface and region behavior

After some debugging following [0] to figure out why ksm was
not connecting to the specified auth_url, found out that
ksm connects to the identity server on the 'admin' interface
[1] after authenticating with auth_url and fetching the catalog if
keystoneauth is being used. Otherwise it connects on identity_uri
and disregards the service catalog [2].  This behavior was not
documented.

[0]. http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-keystone/%23openstack-keystone.2017-09-19.log.html#t2017-09-19T17:50:06
[1]. https://github.com/openstack/keystonemiddleware/blob/d1b7a1f0922419f956001f4bf14ad3e77449c860/keystonemiddleware/auth_token/__init__.py#L936-L938
[2]. https://github.com/openstack/keystonemiddleware/blob/d1b7a1f0922419f956001f4bf14ad3e77449c860/keystonemiddleware/auth_token/_auth.py#L121-L130

Change-Id: Ide40835de856012ac4dd71975beac9d32771f356

commit_message:
Add sqlite to validate_re

When doing spec tests on your custom modules
you want to have as little dependencies as
possible so specifying sqlite is the simplest.

If you specify mysql or postgresql you'll need
your custom testing grabing the upstream puppetlabs-mysql
or puppetlabs-postgresql modules which just adds unnecessary
deps instead of a few bytes in a validate_re function.

Change-Id: If25e8c0161bdd487f11460884883f42ea13074b3
(cherry picked from commit c8fb3d1b5cadad66c298fb1b39068954a20d2208)

commit_message:
Add sqlite to validate_re

When doing spec tests on your custom modules
you want to have as little dependencies as
possible so specifying sqlite is the simplest.

If you specify mysql or postgresql you'll need
your custom testing grabing the upstream puppetlabs-mysql
or puppetlabs-postgresql modules which just adds unnecessary
deps instead of a few bytes in a validate_re function.

Change-Id: If25e8c0161bdd487f11460884883f42ea13074b3

(4 comments)

Looks great Raildo! Cleaner than I thought that it would be. I was concerned about not caching the values in self.__cache but the value can go to both caches and still be retained in the one from the sources. I make a few comments to the code still.'}, {'account_id': 8866, 'date': '2018-06-27 13:52:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8866, 'date': '2018-06-27 13:52:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8866, 'date': '2018-06-27 15:21:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2018-06-27 16:10:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-06-28 22:01:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I think on a complete reload we are still going to need to clear this cache.  I left a comment inline at the relevant location.  Maybe we can extend the clear_cache decorator to optionally clear the driver cache?

Also (and I realize this is probably a non-trivial ask), is there any way we can write tests for this behavior?  It's probably going to require a lot of mocking of driver bits and such, but it would be good to have a test that verifies the cache correctly handles (or more accurately, doesn't handle) a mutation.

A couple of other things inline, one of which is a nit and the other I'm just not sure about.  I'm not sure I understand why we clear the cache on some calls so I don't know if it applies to this cache or not."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-29 14:59:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-29 14:59:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

rebased'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-29 15:58:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

I wonder if it would be easier if we just made the driver interfaces deal with mutability.'}, {'account_id': 8866, 'date': '2018-06-29 17:42:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hey Ben, well, I agree that would be awesome to have some unit tests for that, but I didn't find any test related to the cache scenarios for the default cache, so would take some time to implement those tests. Maybe we can add this tests without block this patch?

Also, I agree that makes sense to clear this cache for the cases that you point out in your comment,"}, {'account_id': 8866, 'date': '2018-07-05 14:11:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 8866, 'date': '2018-07-05 14:44:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-07-09 15:21:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-07-10 18:28:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Okay, this works for me.  Let's give it a shot."}, {'account_id': 8866, 'date': '2018-07-16 11:46:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2018-07-16 16:37:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I noticed Zuul failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1739482

Some of the tests failed in a way that we did not understand. Please help us classify these issues so that they can be part of Elastic Recheck http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/'}, {'account_id': 8866, 'date': '2018-07-17 23:54:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-07-18 15:10:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
New cache layer for external sources

Add a separate cache for values coming from external sources,
this will protect us from having options from external sources
mutated when we reload the configuration files

Change-Id: Icf72f4e1745a0ddf53e661cc08d0fe7428cd9a41
Blueprint: oslo-config-drivers

subject: Add arguments for MemcacheClientPool init
messages:
[{'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-02-08 11:04:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-15 18:23:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Can we test this somehow?'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-02-20 16:33:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

> Can we test this somehow?

This is, unfortunately, very hard to test due to how the pool works.

This is another reason why we need to move away from python-memcache and to something better (in oslo.cache) where the pool can just be dropped.

The test scenario would be to standup a functional test with a memcache behind it or patching the backend driver to be all dict based.'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-02-22 07:46:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > Can we test this somehow?
 > 
 > This is, unfortunately, very hard to test due to how the pool
 > works.
 > 
 > This is another reason why we need to move away from
 > python-memcache and to something better (in oslo.cache) where the
 > pool can just be dropped.
 > 
 > The test scenario would be to standup a functional test with a
 > memcache behind it or patching the backend driver to be all dict
 > based.

yeah. Seems that we don't have a suitable way.

But I can add a test for the _MemcacheClientPool initialization to ensure the error is fixed."}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-02-22 08:28:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27383, 'date': '2018-03-01 08:07:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

codes ok to me,but use oslo.cache as a memcached pool of keystonemiddleware seems untested & unused, if anyone has used it,this problem can be found in a moment'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-03-16 09:16:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-03-24 10:45:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-07-18 18:02:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Cherry Picked

commit_message:
Add arguments for MemcacheClientPool init

Now keystonemiddleware use oslo.cache to init the
MemcacheClientPool. The MemcacheClientPool in
Olso.cache needs (urls, arguments, **kwargs) parameter
to init, but keystonemiddleware passed only
(urls, **kwargs). Then it leads the error:
__init__() takes exactly 3 arguments (2 given)

This patch fixed this issue.

Please note that even this error is fixed, set
"memcache_use_advanced_pool = True" will lead another
error, see bug #1747565 for the detail. It will be
fixed in the following patch.

Closes-bug: #1748160
Change-Id: I642f959ab8b010207314312a6b6a06a6de23e92c

commit_message:
add support for keystone federation

This adds the Apache mod_auth_openidc and mod_auth_mellon packages to
the Keystone container to support Keystone federation (as described in
https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/9.3.0/configure_federation.html)

Change-Id: Ia32176eb33737e6f7425bd5e63b4f95eb595cd5f

[{'created': '2018-07-16 13:29:51.000000000', 'message': "Fix haproxy checks

that's always pingable, else the ping command is incomplete
and will always fail, which would result in haproxy always down.

Change-Id: I2f818fd8ed6600ffc0de9557ad56a769ec09881e
"}, {'created': '2018-07-17 09:31:59.000000000', 'message': "Fix haproxy checks

In the precedent patch [1], I suggested the removal of the test script
used, but that change was not included in the commit.

Therefore, the wiring is currently done with a ping test script,
but the test script has no ip address to ping (incomplete command),
leading to failures.

Instead we should ping on an IP that's reachable on all cases,
which defaults to the default route, or a localhost, unless
the user decides to define its own ip address (like an upstream
router, or a public IP).

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580379/

Change-Id: I2f818fd8ed6600ffc0de9557ad56a769ec09881e
"}]
commit_message:
Fix haproxy checks

In the precedent patch [1], I suggested the removal of the test script
used, but that change was not included in the commit.

Therefore, the wiring is currently done with a ping test script,
but the test script has no ip address to ping (incomplete command),
leading to failures.

Instead we should ping on an IP that's reachable on all cases,
which defaults to the default route, or a localhost, unless
the user decides to define its own ip address (like an upstream
router, or a public IP).

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580379/

Change-Id: I2f818fd8ed6600ffc0de9557ad56a769ec09881e

Can we merge it without requiring a new major release of saharaclient then?'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-07-12 17:35:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

It will be a major release.

But it is relatively safe to do so, because sahara-tests,sahara-dashboard,Rally,Heat,etc are all already using session for authentication. And we have had a deprecation notice there for a long time. I doubt any users will be horribly surprised.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-07-13 13:42:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

The deprecation notes landed 3 years ago:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/147773/

We could remove the old authentication method (without a session object) directly even within the boundaries of what it is allowed for services aka https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/tags/assert_follows-standard-deprecation.html (even if this a library, not a service). 

I guess that the reason for a major version would be the modified signature of the constructor of Client, which would break the users passing positional parameters.

But then, if we manage to not break it for s3, maybe...'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-07-18 16:34:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

So let's go for 2.0. Users of saharaclient which are doing The Right Not Deprecated Thing will still work."}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-07-18 16:39:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Rework saharaclient authentication

Just accept session objects.

This will require a new major release of python-saharaclient (2.0).

Change-Id: I9021a7ebeeecf94d48170e332b26ac6e80187501
Story: 1747838
Task: 6896

commit_message:
The undercloud is containerized by default, doc changes

- Update the undercloud install/upgrade manuals to reflect what we have
  done in tripleoclient, the undercloud is now containerized by default.

- Document that we can disable this feature with --use-heat=False.

- Remove useless redirect commands for upgrades, the logfile is created
  by tripleoclient anyway.

- Document how to cleanup an undercloud after the upgrade.

Change-Id: Ib597bd75e6c922f37a003588a172b817d990ac4f

commit_message:
Allow fields filter on single object GETs

The LBaaSv2-API spec had this, and tempest seems to test for it.
We missed adding it when we implemented the v2 API in Pike.

 Conflicts:
	octavia/api/v2/controllers/listener.py

Backport-Candidate: Queens Pike
Change-Id: I16c04b6f12fe4db9f1a2a0dc1d2b6fb54d24fd38
(cherry picked from commit 84ef448a87ac7251a8087e435778f3ed761706b5)

commit_message:
API: add support to abort queued live migration in microversion 2.65

This patch bumped API microversion to 2.65 to add support for
abort live migrations in ``queued`` and ``preparing`` status.

Part of blueprint abort-live-migration-in-queued-status

Change-Id: I4636a8d270ce01c1831bc951c4497ad472bc9aa8

[{'created': '2018-07-17 09:19:26.000000000', 'message': 'Prepare Google Backup driver for latest libraries

With every new google library, there are small changes that need to be
done to the Google Backup Cinder driver to stay compatible.

This patch updatest the code and the unit tests for libraries:

  google-auth===1.5.0
  google-auth-httplib2===0.0.3
  google-api-python-client===1.7.3

While maintaining compatibility with earlier versions:

  google-auth===1.4.1
  google-auth-httplib2===0.0.3
  google-api-python-client===1.6.7

Code has also been manually tested against Google Cloud Storage to
ensure backup and restore works with the new libraries.

Change-Id: I4e0c36217338fd757445aa172f6e962fb9ec507c
'}]
commit_message:
Prepare Google Backup driver for latest libraries

With every new google library, there are small changes that need to be
done to the Google Backup Cinder driver to stay compatible.

This patch updatest the code and the unit tests for libraries:

  google-auth===1.5.0
  google-auth-httplib2===0.0.3
  google-api-python-client===1.7.3

While maintaining compatibility with earlier versions:

  google-auth===1.4.1
  google-auth-httplib2===0.0.3
  google-api-python-client===1.6.7

Code has also been manually tested against Google Cloud Storage to
ensure backup and restore works with the new libraries.

Change-Id: I4e0c36217338fd757445aa172f6e962fb9ec507c

commit_message:
Switch to python-ldap

pyldap is deprecated and merged with python-ldap, so we should depend
on it directly instead of the deprecated wrapper. For details see
https://pypi.org/project/pyldap/

Change-Id: I2c8ee2c792a476fe12c234a55af24144e6b511cd
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582973/

commit_message:
Fix configured haproxy restarts

In the unlikely even that the haproxy restarts after being
configured, if the amphora is using systemd, the haproxy may
fail to start. This is due to a missing "peer ID" command line option.
This patch fixes the systemd unit to have the required "peer ID".

Conflicts:
      octavia/amphorae/backends/agent/api_server/templates/systemd.conf.j2

Story: 2002638
Task: 22294
(cherry picked from commit 7564834b01b6fe97bff16fccdde99d026a6334d7)
Change-Id: I79cfc9a2e53b249337a189bdb08d13b24807021e

commit_message:

The health manager reports an ERROR for each heartbeat from a spare
amphora. This patch resolves that issue.

Story: 2002621
Task: 22653
(cherry picked from commit 5cef93df2ec4e32888d7b8406da45fb2be62e557)

commit_message:
Add pool session persistence validation

This patch adds validation to the pool session persistence options.
It validates the cookie_name specified and whether that option is valid
for the session persistence type specified.

The current rally job is always execute report command at the end,
and it always succeeds regardless of the rally task result.
Since the values.yaml in the rally chart already includes sla check,

commit_message:
Add sla check in rally task

The current rally job is always execute report command at the end,
and it always succeeds regardless of the rally task result.
Since the values.yaml in the rally chart already includes sla check,
you should execute sla-check command at the end of the job
so that you can check whether the test has passed or not.

Change-Id: I4c91950b86622b1211aea3e9e908cb04711c0e76

messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-17 21:09:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-07-18 14:32:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13095, 'date': '2018-07-18 14:40:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 21:09:03.000000000', 'message': "Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement two new variables:
- sahara_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host
- sahara_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

These are used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Change-Id: I72c26ad851beb5a48cd2d841dca67c547a074847
"}]
commit_message:
Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement two new variables:
- sahara_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host
- sahara_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

These are used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Change-Id: I72c26ad851beb5a48cd2d841dca67c547a074847

attributes [1] also include a revision number that helps

since the removal of toosl/tox_install.sh: having 'neutron'
as a required-project for the functional job. Not having
it, resulted in the use of stable/queens neutron which test
DB migration up to queens, but not any migration script
defined for rocky.

commit_message:
DB models: add standard attributes

Beyond their intrinsic marginal usefullness, standard
attributes [1] also include a revision number that helps
avoid some races in OVO-based RPCs for resource updates.

This changes adds standard attributes for the BGPVPN model
and Net/Router/Port Association models.

Note that this change adds something that had been missing
since the removal of toosl/tox_install.sh: having 'neutron'
as a required-project for the functional job. Not having
it, resulted in the use of stable/queens neutron which test
DB migration up to queens, but not any migration script
defined for rocky.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/pike/contributor/internals/db_layer.html#the-standard-attribute-table

Partial-Bug: 1765391
Depends-On: I7630aab5e4f38d0fba862adc2426d4a7ca04a679
Change-Id: I77ce46c0f33e2a366076d51ce6586fb3008dc6b1

commit_message:
Add NUMBER_OF_MONITOR_NODES for bootstrap

The parameter "NUMBER_OF_MONITOR_NODES" is needed when run
bootstrap.sh[0], but it's missing, this ps to add it.

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/contrib/dev/vagrant/bootstrap.sh#L206

Change-Id: If83620bbdeaf8c4805e021242ca44da069e43922

please, add a release note for the new option'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-06-06 08:18:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Certainly not against adding this, but I wonder if it's worth documenting how to configure ansible in general? It can be done via ansible.cfg or environment variables. Ideally with a link to this: http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/reference_appendices/config.html."}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2018-06-06 14:18:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

There are lots of parameter for ansible-playbooks. We added a "EXTRA_OPTS" for kolla-ansible for operator to add arbitrary ansible-playbooks paramater. like

EXTRA_OPTS='--fork 10' kolla-ansible ...'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2018-06-06 21:48:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Allow passing forks to kolla-ansible script

For large installations it makes sense to use a higher number of forks
than the default.

Change-Id: I34cdc146a4ed2185fb36fbb34ab72916ec98bee5

value.

This should fix it.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-08 15:41:01.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Uncap networkx"

This requires code changes before it will actually work.  Uncapping
it without those changes in place is misleading and may result in
the global-requirements cap being lifted before taskflow is actually
ready to use the newer versions.

This reverts commit 4607f68ae73ebbe7296f16c7dff2fde1884ce947.

Change-Id: Ifb1eadf9725de0365e4a22a6f4c8e2975894dec2
'}, {'created': '2018-06-08 16:18:00.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Uncap networkx"

This requires code changes before it will actually work.  The current
requirements list will result in a non-functional taskflow, so we should
stop claiming support for a version of a dependency that is not
compatible until the code changes can be made.

This reverts commit 4607f68ae73ebbe7296f16c7dff2fde1884ce947.

Change-Id: Ifb1eadf9725de0365e4a22a6f4c8e2975894dec2
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Uncap networkx"

This requires code changes before it will actually work.  The current
requirements list will result in a non-functional taskflow, so we should
stop claiming support for a version of a dependency that is not
compatible until the code changes can be made.

This reverts commit 4607f68ae73ebbe7296f16c7dff2fde1884ce947.

Change-Id: Ifb1eadf9725de0365e4a22a6f4c8e2975894dec2

commit_message:
Added delay_auth_decision config option for swift

The authtoken config variable delay_auth_decision must be set to True.
The default is False, but that breaks public access, StaticWeb, FormPost,
TempURL, and authenticated capabilities requests (using Discoverability).

Change-Id: I420a95f5f9fda3321a4acfc5846e40294a8bd588
Closes-Bug: #1768795

commit_message:
Make nova nova_instance_datadir_volume configurable.

User can use custom directory for nova instance.
For example using a shared file system as backend.

Change-Id: I11fe4891719a2e2a34888d8b798df5602e294e4f

commit_message:
libvirt: don't destroy shared disks during rebuild if vif plug fails

If we're rebuilding an instance with disks on shared storage,
don't destroy the disks if vif plugging fails or times out with
neutron.

Change-Id: I4565bcc9540c385d0f18e60fa387beabb5dc9014
Closes-Bug: #1550919

commit_message:
WIP - Migrate to using keystoneauth session

This change migrates swiftclient to pass in a keystoneauth session when
creating an instance of keystoneclient. keystoneclient's behavior of not
requiring a session when created has been long deprecated and is slated
for removal.

Change-Id: I7bd503000cd734787ae306fceaa3b8e50f05e182
Closes-Bug: #1738243

[{'created': '2018-07-16 17:05:05.000000000', 'message': "Clean up env files for Cinder's Netapp backend

Remove the misleading comment from the cinder-netapp-config.yaml file in
the environments directory that claimed the file is deprecated in favor
of the 'sample-env-generator' file in the environments/storage directory.
The sample-env-generator has not been widely adopted, and the Netapp
file in the environments directory is still being maintained.

Update the sample-env-generator files so they specify the
OS::TripleO::Services::CinderBackendNetApp composable service.

Closes-Bug: 1779397
Change-Id: If0343e96700bf13c0d49c3ae3c311ada1c26a0c0
(cherry picked from commit d989c01ce4a5e24cce54ddf206db67634396a00e)
"}]
commit_message:
Clean up env files for Cinder's Netapp backend

Remove the misleading comment from the cinder-netapp-config.yaml file in
the environments directory that claimed the file is deprecated in favor
of the 'sample-env-generator' file in the environments/storage directory.
The sample-env-generator has not been widely adopted, and the Netapp
file in the environments directory is still being maintained.

Update the sample-env-generator files so they specify the
OS::TripleO::Services::CinderBackendNetApp composable service.

Closes-Bug: 1779397
Change-Id: If0343e96700bf13c0d49c3ae3c311ada1c26a0c0
(cherry picked from commit d989c01ce4a5e24cce54ddf206db67634396a00e)

diff.

subject: [425149] Support response code 400 as expected error code.
messages:
[{'account_id': 19391, 'date': '2018-07-17 15:22:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17896, 'date': '2018-07-17 16:22:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-17 16:23:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I agree with Rick. Supporting a 400 is a very bad idea. This should be the absolute last recourse we take (and by that I mean we should never support a 400).'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-17 16:27:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I agree with Rick. Supporting a 400 is a very bad idea. This should
 > be the absolute last recourse we take (and by that I mean we should
 > never support a 400).

The more detailed reason is because we only support error codes that represent failed authorization response codes. Neutron will throw a 404 to disguise a 403 for the purposes of security, and it is risky enough that we have to support that as it has to be handled very carefully to avoid tests silently passing when they should instead fail. A 403 is obviously supported as that is the HTTP standard for failed authorization.

A 400 is never used anywhere in OpenStack to represent failed authorization. If anything raises a 400 that is because of a number of factors:

* the test is written incorrectly or is out of date (i.e. passing in a deprecated parameter)
* there is a bug in the service getting called
* a feature flag is needed to skip the test on some clouds that might not support the functionality getting called
* etc'}, {'account_id': 19391, 'date': '2018-07-18 15:38:32.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandon this patch based on the provided comments.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 15:22:42.000000000', 'message': "[425149] Support response code 400 as expected error code.

This patch is related to the following commit to support the
Patrole 'test_delete_group_snapshot_rbac' test case in
patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api/volume/test_group_snapshots_rbac.py:
https://gerrit.mtn5.cci.att.com/#/c/47186/

Change-Id: I731ab8ebaad1d7573b8cc0de381aebd6e8cff016
"}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-16 17:06:19.000000000', 'message': 'Remove RBAC test cases for quota classes.

The 2 test cases are removed because Cinder is not enforcing any rule for the
show/update action for the corresponding test case.  The rules being enforced
are the Nova "os_compute_api:os-quota-class-sets:show" and
"os_compute_api:os-quota-class-sets:update" instead.  The Nova test cases can
be found in patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api/compute/test_quota_class_sets_rbac.py.
As such, there is no need for Cinder to host these test cases.

Please see comments for reference:
https://gerrit.mtn5.cci.att.com/#/c/46277/2/aicqa/blacklists/patrole-blacklist.txt@70

Change-Id: Ieaa69a95a74d910fd6e2ed6518df06449e331e68
'}]
commit_message:
Remove RBAC test cases for quota classes.

The 2 test cases are removed because Cinder is not enforcing any rule for the
show/update action for the corresponding test case.  The rules being enforced
are the Nova "os_compute_api:os-quota-class-sets:show" and
"os_compute_api:os-quota-class-sets:update" instead.  The Nova test cases can
be found in patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api/compute/test_quota_class_sets_rbac.py.
As such, there is no need for Cinder to host these test cases.

Please see comments for reference:
https://gerrit.mtn5.cci.att.com/#/c/46277/2/aicqa/blacklists/patrole-blacklist.txt@70

Change-Id: Ieaa69a95a74d910fd6e2ed6518df06449e331e68

'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-05-29 16:23:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Do you have a link to somewhere that says this is deprecated? I tried to find one, but I don't see anything stating they are deprecating this.


Nothing in the source either:

https://github.com/requests/requests/blob/00fd4c8eb4ac0fd7b8f8d76bbf15ab06351c052c/requests/packages.py"}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2018-06-05 18:45:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

This makes sense.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-06-05 18:55:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Does it? I haven't been able to find anything saying this import is going away."}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2018-07-12 19:11:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The "deprecated" note was perhaps me extrapolating too much from
    https://github.com/requests/requests/blob/master/requests/packages.py

but that part doesn't really matter.  Using bundled libraries is basically never the right thing to do.  We should fix this for our own project's hygiene regardless of what the requests library is intending to do there.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-07-16 14:49:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

It's not a bundled library though, and it is not something that is deprecated and will change."}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2018-07-16 15:08:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So the argument for not fixing this to be done the right way is...?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-07-16 15:11:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

That it's already done the right way?"}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2018-07-18 15:06:46.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Sure.  I mean, it's not.  But... yeah, let's go with the "it doesn't matter" plan.'}]

commit_message:
Use urllib3 instead of requests.packages.urllib3

The packaged version of urllib3 in requests is
deprecated, just use urllib3 instead.

Change-Id: I853bd53c1a4ecfdc053a2d7086efa11feebb628c

commit_message:
Switch connection/become settings for nova

Typically nova_compute is on localhost, so in
https://review.openstack.org/582957 we made the
change to set connection/become accordingly, but
as it turns out ironic does not deploy compute
on to localhost so that patch broke the ironic
tests.

So, given this is much the same requirement as
cinder's, we implement the same hack as done in
https://review.openstack.org/582579

Change-Id: Icf50423576cd95a891da743f2b8b7c01e81ceb38

subject: KubeADM-AIO: use apt-get install ansible
messages:
[{'account_id': 26598, 'date': '2018-06-21 15:24:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2018-06-21 20:13:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

this seems to be tweaking an issue where it can't upgrade pyyaml

we need to work out why this is fragile and address that first"}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2018-06-28 09:27:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Debian 'stretch' (current stable) has Ansible 2.2 in repositories. If you need newer one then 2.5.2 is present in 'stretch-backports' repo.

Installing via pip may fail if there are no development packages installed to build 'pynacl' (one of 'ansible' dependencies). The reason is simple: on x86-64 pypi has binary version of that package available so pip just fetch binaries and go. On aarch64 we have to build it first."}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2018-06-28 09:27:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 26598, 'date': '2018-07-18 14:14:34.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-21 15:24:16.000000000', 'message': 'KubeADM-AIO: use apt-get install ansible

"pip --no-cache-dir install ansible" fails on aarch64 platform
The container will use all system memory and be killed since oom
Use "apt-get install ansible" instead and it is quicker

log:
Running setup.py install for pynacl: finished with status 'error'
FAIL: pwhash_scrypt
/tmp/pip-install-G_IH7z/pynacl/src/libsodium/build-aux/test-driver: line 107: 22089 Killed

Change-Id: I1cbd6464c46ac5e3137f52e9a6618a7a133d8dee
'}]
commit_message:
KubeADM-AIO: use apt-get install ansible

"pip --no-cache-dir install ansible" fails on aarch64 platform
The container will use all system memory and be killed since oom
Use "apt-get install ansible" instead and it is quicker

log:
Running setup.py install for pynacl: finished with status 'error'
FAIL: pwhash_scrypt
/tmp/pip-install-G_IH7z/pynacl/src/libsodium/build-aux/test-driver: line 107: 22089 Killed

Change-Id: I1cbd6464c46ac5e3137f52e9a6618a7a133d8dee

subject: Do not call crm_node -n when running in a container
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 8297, 'name': 'Sofer Athlan-Guyot', 'email': 'sathlang@redhat.com', 'username': 'chem'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28223, 'name': 'Cedric Jeanneret', 'display_name': 'cjeanner (Tengu)', 'email': 'cjeanner@redhat.com', 'username': 'cjeanner'}]
messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-07-18 05:48:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-07-18 07:48:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2018-07-18 13:49:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-07-18 13:52:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-18 05:48:10.000000000', 'message': "WIP Do not call crm_node -n when running in a container

In lib/facter/pacemaker_node_name.rb we do the following:
Facter.add('pacemaker_node_name') do
  setcode do
    Facter::Core::Execution.exec 'crm_node -n'
  end
end

This is problematic because starting with pacemaker 1.1.19 crm_node -n
will trigger a newly-introduced CRM_OP_NODE_INFO query which will hang
if the container runs 1.1.19 code and the cluster runs 1.1.18 code.

Let's simply avoid running these queries when run inside a container.

Change-Id: I9ae7df2f49f918507c5f98b2441b5b17423a38da
Closes-Bug: #1782231
"}, {'created': '2018-07-18 07:48:17.000000000', 'message': 'Do not call crm_node -n when running in a container

In lib/facter/pacemaker_node_name.rb we do the following:
Facter.add('pacemaker_node_name') do
  setcode do
    Facter::Core::Execution.exec 'crm_node -n'
  end
end

This is problematic because starting with pacemaker 1.1.19 crm_node -n
will trigger a newly-introduced CRM_OP_NODE_INFO query which will hang
if the container runs 1.1.19 code and the cluster runs 1.1.18 code.

Let's simply avoid running these queries when run inside a container.

Tested this by deploying successfully an overcloud with pcmk-1.1.19 in
containers and 1.1.18 on the host:
[root@controller-0 ~]# rpm -q pacemaker
pacemaker-1.1.18-11.el7_5.3.x86_64
[root@controller-0 ~]# docker exec -it galera-bundle-docker-0 sh -c "rpm -q pacemaker"
pacemaker-1.1.19-3.el7.x86_64

For this to work we also need the following RA fix:
https://github.com/ClusterLabs/resource-agents/pull/1173/

Previously this would fail with crm_node -n just hanging.

Change-Id: I9ae7df2f49f918507c5f98b2441b5b17423a38da
Closes-Bug: #1782231
'}]
commit_message:
Do not call crm_node -n when running in a container

In lib/facter/pacemaker_node_name.rb we do the following:
Facter.add('pacemaker_node_name') do
  setcode do
    Facter::Core::Execution.exec 'crm_node -n'
  end
end

This is problematic because starting with pacemaker 1.1.19 crm_node -n
will trigger a newly-introduced CRM_OP_NODE_INFO query which will hang
if the container runs 1.1.19 code and the cluster runs 1.1.18 code.

Let's simply avoid running these queries when run inside a container.

Tested this by deploying successfully an overcloud with pcmk-1.1.19 in
containers and 1.1.18 on the host:
[root@controller-0 ~]# rpm -q pacemaker
pacemaker-1.1.18-11.el7_5.3.x86_64
[root@controller-0 ~]# docker exec -it galera-bundle-docker-0 sh -c "rpm -q pacemaker"
pacemaker-1.1.19-3.el7.x86_64

For this to work we also need the following RA fix:
https://github.com/ClusterLabs/resource-agents/pull/1173/

Previously this would fail with crm_node -n just hanging.

Change-Id: I9ae7df2f49f918507c5f98b2441b5b17423a38da
Closes-Bug: #1782231

commit_message:
Follow-up changes to iRMC bios interface.

Minor formatting and fix-ups for the iRMC bios interface
addition patch.

Update new scciclient version which will support this feature
for newer iRMC server versions.

Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Van Trung <trungnv@vn.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I6cfe8175e687d6a900a17b31e75459d8b01a8edb

commit_message:
Update yaml files for Dell EMC VNX, Unity drivers

1. manila-backend-vnx.yaml:
  a. remove ManilaVNXServerMetaPool since meta_pool is not used by Manila VNX driver
  b. add ManilaVNXServerContainer

2. cinder-dellemc-vnx-config.yaml:
  a. remove default value of CinderDellEMCVNXStorageSecurityFileDir since it is not medatory option for Cinder VNX driver

Change-Id: Ie48cec52df720f3a13700d6048ecf78ba9067b51
Closes-bug: #1774942
(cherry picked from commit 5c09e674737142ce9b722eea65160eefc34b6fa1)

commit_message:
Support can_edit_user and can_edit_role settings in Angularized panels

The actions on Angularized users panel and roles panel does not support
following setting.

OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_BACKEND = {
    'can_edit_user': True,
    'can_edit_role': True,
}

This patch enables to support these settings.

To enable this settings, add 'OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_BACKEND' into
'REST_API_REQUIRED_SETTINGS' setting.

Change-Id: I7888bd2c2977dc010911d2e7ecf42815354e081b
Closes-Bug: #1779268

[{'created': '2018-07-18 12:38:26.000000000', 'message': 'Release os-brick 2.5.3

We have a few more bug fixes to get in from
Rocky development.  This update releases
those fixes.

commit_message:
Release os-brick 2.5.3

We have a few more bug fixes to get in from
Rocky development.  This update releases
those fixes.

Change-Id: I57b9e870ab3aaa53704976e78d4da18761e2507e

commit_message:
Improve the error logging for zombie amphora

In the case that nova failed to delete an amphroa they will continue to send
health heartbeat messages the the health manager. This patch improves the
logging of these amphora.

It also optimizes the statistics update flow when event streaming is
disabled by removing two extra database calls.

This patch also removes the un-used BaseControllerTask class.

This patch also finally solidifies that there will be one LB per amphora.

Conflicts:
	octavia/controller/healthmanager/health_drivers/update_db.py
	octavia/tests/unit/controller/healthmanager/health_drivers/test_update_db.py

Change-Id: Idf83b19216c680a4854c1239ed9c5bc5ce7364a7
(cherry picked from commit 1417f6f0f8cbf13fd26440ae2dc53de42873d6cc)

commit_message:
Add the config option for Oslo Messaging executor type

* With Pymysql driver and "eventlet" Oslo Messaging executor type
  Mistral seems to work fine. Just in case there's a regression in
  comparison with using "blocking" executor this patch makes a
  a change in a form of a config option that defines an RPC
  executor rather making it hardcoded.

Change-Id: Id73364eee29f2113fc983718b9891a496ca32ee4

I saw comments on IRC from Julia & jroll about not splitting this apart. I'll set out my thoughts, and we can discuss on IRC later. It could easily be squashed back into a single patch if people think that is best.

* it's generally encouraged to split apart large changes, to allow reviewers to see each part independently, in manageable chunks

* the parts that have been split away are mostly the boilerplate changes required to add a new DB/object/API field. These should be easy to review. The core logic changes in the drivers and conductor are left in this patch and will still be a challenging review, even without those boilerplate distractions

* rloo labelled the patch as WIP, I think we should acknowledge that. It looks pretty close, but still has work to do, including that laid out by rloo in her email.

To quote rloo's email:

"The patch needs to be split into smaller patches, probably needs more unit tests, reno, documentation, more deploy steps or is one sufficient as a start, need to think about issues if any with upgrading to this..."

I know we want this feature, but I don't think we should lower our basic standards to get it. I'm prepared to put some time into it before feature freeze to push it over the line.

Let me know your thoughts.'}, {'account_id': 14629, 'date': '2018-07-04 08:33:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Build failed.

Hi Mark, thanks for continuing this and splitting it up! My 'WIP' is because there were things that were still outstanding -- I suspect that if you consider what I had vs what others have when they 'submit' their feature, this is probably not a WIP :)

The idea of splitting a feature into patches is something that the community wanted, to make patches smaller and hence easier to review. Personally, I don't agree with this, I prefer one patch with all the changes so I can see it all. However, I go with the flow. Also, the reason for separate patches, is because I've seen really well err not-great code, and trying to review/comment one patch that has sooooo many issues is difficult for both reviewer and reviewee. Having them break it up hopefully helps them see some structure/sense to how the code works or ought-to-work. Regardless, you've split it up, so let's move forward with what we have :)

I think the reason for not splitting it up is because it looked good to jroll & TheJulia and given the time it takes to split up etc, they probably felt that time would be better spent getting this done. I am certainly not lowering *my* standards to get this done :)"}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-07-06 15:40:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-07-06 15:40:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

'}, {'created': '2018-07-06 15:40:11.000000000', 'message': "Deploy steps - conductor & drivers

This adds a 'deploy_step' decorator. A deploy step must take as the
only positional argument, a TaskManager object.

A step can be executed synchronously or asynchronously. A step should
return None if the method has completed synchronously or
states.DEPLOYWAIT if the step will continue to execute asynchronously.
If the step executes asynchronously, it should issue a call to the
'continue_node_deploy' RPC, so the conductor can begin the next
deploy step.

Only steps with priorities greater than 0 are used.
These steps are ordered by priority from highest value to lowest
value. For steps with the same priority, they are ordered by driver
interface priority (see conductor.manager.DEPLOYING_INTERFACE_PRIORITY).

All in-tree DeployInterfaces are converted to have one big deploy_step
(their existing deploy() method).

A new RPC method 'continue_node_deploy' (RPC API version 1.45) is used
by deploy steps to notify the conductor to continue node deployment
(e.g. execute the next deploy step).

Similar to cleaning, the conductor gets the node's deploy steps and
executes them, one at a time. The conductor also handles out-of-tree
drivers that don't have deploy steps yet; a warning is logged in these
cases.

Co-Authored-By: Ruby Loo <rloo@oath.com>

Change-Id: I5feac3856cc4b87a850180b7fd0b3b9805f9225f
Story: #1753128
Task: #22592
"}, {'created': '2018-07-06 21:16:01.000000000', 'message': "Deploy steps - conductor & drivers

commit_message:
Deploy steps - conductor & drivers

This adds a 'deploy_step' decorator. A deploy step must take as the
only positional argument, a TaskManager object.

A step can be executed synchronously or asynchronously. A step should
return None if the method has completed synchronously or
states.DEPLOYWAIT if the step will continue to execute asynchronously.
If the step executes asynchronously, it should issue a call to the
'continue_node_deploy' RPC, so the conductor can begin the next
deploy step.

Only steps with priorities greater than 0 are used.
These steps are ordered by priority from highest value to lowest
value. For steps with the same priority, they are ordered by driver
interface priority (see conductor.manager.DEPLOYING_INTERFACE_PRIORITY).

All in-tree DeployInterfaces are converted to have one big deploy_step
(their existing deploy() method).

A new RPC method 'continue_node_deploy' (RPC API version 1.45) is used
by deploy steps to notify the conductor to continue node deployment
(e.g. execute the next deploy step).

Similar to cleaning, the conductor gets the node's deploy steps and
executes them, one at a time (one deploy step right now). The conductor
also handles out-of-tree drivers that don't have deploy steps yet; a
warning is logged in these cases.

Co-Authored-By: Ruby Loo <rloo@oath.com>

Change-Id: I5feac3856cc4b87a850180b7fd0b3b9805f9225f
Story: #1753128
Task: #22592

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-13 12:22:53.000000000', 'message': "OVN Dbs HA: Set sysctl value 'net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind' to 1

When OVN DBs pacemaker bundle is started on the controller nodes,
all the ovsdb-servers are configured to listen on the virtual ip
(on ports 6641/6642). But only master node is configured with virtual ip.
On the other nodes, we see the below error messages

ovsdb_jsonrpc_server|ERR|ptcp:6641:172.17.1.18: listen failed: Cannot assign
requested address.

The commit [1] addressed this issue in puppet-tripleo by setting the
sysctl value 'net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind' to 1 using puppet's sysctl::value.
But the ovn-dbs.yaml service file is missing this puppet tag when the
container 'ovn_dbs_init_bundle' is started.

We can fix the issue by defining this tag, but this also requires setting
'privileged=true' when starting the docker container.

Instead, this patch sets the sysctl value using the 'host_prep_tasks' section.

[1] - I6f762534350a3f96696c87ccd2d14545dccc8a0b

Change-Id: I5ae8cd368bcd58810b18e172ee685fdbf0e48d98
Closes-bug: #1781585
"}, {'created': '2018-07-17 18:21:04.000000000', 'message': "OVN: Set sysctl value 'net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind' to 1

When OVN DBs pacemaker bundle is started on the controller nodes,
all the ovsdb-servers are configured to listen on the virtual ip
(on ports 6641/6642). But only master node is configured with virtual ip.
On the other nodes, we see the below error messages

ovsdb_jsonrpc_server|ERR|ptcp:6641:172.17.1.18: listen failed: Cannot assign
requested address.

The commit [1] addressed this issue in puppet-tripleo by setting the
sysctl value 'net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind' to 1 using puppet's sysctl::value.
But the ovn-dbs.yaml service file is missing this puppet tag when the
container 'ovn_dbs_init_bundle' is started.

We can fix the issue by defining this tag, but this also requires setting
'privileged=true' when starting the docker container.

Instead, this patch makes use of the t-h-t param 'KernelIpNonLocalBind'
which was introduced in this commit [2].

[1] - I6f762534350a3f96696c87ccd2d14545dccc8a0b
[2] - Idd3d432b8f7eb573d94cd56be8e05614510ebddf

Change-Id: I5ae8cd368bcd58810b18e172ee685fdbf0e48d98
Closes-bug: #1781585
"}]
commit_message:
OVN: Set sysctl value 'net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind' to 1

When OVN DBs pacemaker bundle is started on the controller nodes,
all the ovsdb-servers are configured to listen on the virtual ip
(on ports 6641/6642). But only master node is configured with virtual ip.
On the other nodes, we see the below error messages

ovsdb_jsonrpc_server|ERR|ptcp:6641:172.17.1.18: listen failed: Cannot assign
requested address.

The commit [1] addressed this issue in puppet-tripleo by setting the
sysctl value 'net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind' to 1 using puppet's sysctl::value.
But the ovn-dbs.yaml service file is missing this puppet tag when the
container 'ovn_dbs_init_bundle' is started.

We can fix the issue by defining this tag, but this also requires setting
'privileged=true' when starting the docker container.

Instead, this patch makes use of the t-h-t param 'KernelIpNonLocalBind'
which was introduced in this commit [2].

[1] - I6f762534350a3f96696c87ccd2d14545dccc8a0b
[2] - Idd3d432b8f7eb573d94cd56be8e05614510ebddf

Change-Id: I5ae8cd368bcd58810b18e172ee685fdbf0e48d98
Closes-bug: #1781585

[{'created': '2018-06-26 21:56:30.000000000', 'message': 'Overhaul ironic role

Removed unused variables when able and updated to the new ironic driver
definitions found here.

https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/admin/upgrade-to-hardware-types.html

The intention is to support the drivers via profiles, so the table from
the above link was converted to a dictionary.  This dictionary was used
as a source when combining / concatenating the various drivers for each
profile into a usable list.

The standalone logic was simplified, docs are updated to state what
variables need to be set.

ironic_dhcp_provider: none for standalone
ironic_sync_power_state_interval: -1 for standalone

Closes-Bug: 1758351

commit_message:
Overhaul ironic role

Removed unused variables when able and updated to the new ironic driver
definitions found here.

https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/admin/upgrade-to-hardware-types.html

The intention is to support the drivers via profiles, so the table from
the above link was converted to a dictionary.  This dictionary was used
as a source when combining / concatenating the various drivers for each
profile into a usable list.  The standalone logic was simplified.

Change-Id: I19553af41b5e669386b855209c61235bf37371f2
Closes-Bug: 1758351

commit_message:
Register Controller and Gateway as Agents

Add ovn-controller running in a chassis as agent to neutron DB.
Two new agent types are introduced
1) OVN Gateway agent - for gateway chassis i.e
   'ovn-cms-options=enable-chassis-as-gw' in chasiss's external_ids
1) OVN Controller agent - for chassis which runs ovn-controller
Need to add metadata agent type with later patches

Note: Either clients need to periodically report status to neutron
server or server has to mock it if client is not having this
functionality. Otherwise server will set "alive" field to "xxx"
and start showing this [1] warning. Need to implement either of that
in next patches.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/db/agents_db.py#L257
Change-Id: I095631dd73d5215e02c393b6f358dc1358869ab4

commit_message:
Consider interface and region options with OSC

The --os-interface/OS_INTERFACE and --os-region-name/OS_REGION_NAME
options were considered by aodh CLI but ignored when using the OSC
integration.

Change-Id: Iad6f28d942626aa4117020d0d15df1c084a58560

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-13 19:43:54.000000000', 'message': "Handle HostMappingNotFound when deleting a compute service

If the compute service we're deleting has never been
discovered (mapped to a cell using discover_hosts) or the
host mapping was already deleted, we need to handle the
HostMappingNotFound error when deleting a compute service
so that we (1) don't 500 out of the API and (2) continue to
delete the compute service.

Change-Id: I0d7644db3537a67b94e75972b3c4fce25a623763
Closes-Bug: #1780727
"}]
commit_message:
Handle HostMappingNotFound when deleting a compute service

If the compute service we're deleting has never been
discovered (mapped to a cell using discover_hosts) or the
host mapping was already deleted, we need to handle the
HostMappingNotFound error when deleting a compute service
so that we (1) don't 500 out of the API and (2) continue to
delete the compute service.

Change-Id: I0d7644db3537a67b94e75972b3c4fce25a623763
Closes-Bug: #1780727

commit_message:
Migration: Create an ansible.cfg for profiling and provide timestamps

We add a callback module for the ansible-playbooks which will profile
all tasks and provide execution timestamp. We need to rise verbosity
with -vv to show the timestamps during execution along other
useful details.

Change-Id: I3cce5ab17f01d807e74941662c61ca16ea72cd61

commit_message:
Nova: add live_migration_interface option

This option is useful in environments where the live-migration traffic
can impact the network plane significantly.
A separate network for live-migration traffic can then use this config
option and avoids the impact on the management network.

Change-Id: Id16c95e77730e5b244cf5bc69beb0e549c979701

commit_message:
Add ceph configuration for cinder-backup

This PS allows the cinder-backup to use a separate ceph backend, you
can add a ceph ip and admin keyring to .Values.backup_ceph so that
cinder-backup can use the new ceph.

blueprint add-ceph-configuration-for-cinder-backup

Change-Id: Ib2c4ca3945a15107d77e36635bda52297de9f164

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-26 10:23:51.000000000', 'message': "hardware: Start accounting for network requests

Modify the 'numa_fit_instance_to_host' function to take network requests
into account. This is mostly a case of linking everything together and
wrapping it in a pretty bow.

Part of blueprint numa-aware-vswitches

Change-Id: If6eb402428f29416ce01dfc32474248c560ae019
"}, {'created': '2018-05-07 15:44:53.000000000', 'message': "hardware: Start accounting for network requests

Modify the 'numa_fit_instance_to_host' function to take network requests
into account. This is mostly a case of linking everything together and
wrapping it in a pretty bow.

Part of blueprint numa-aware-vswitches

Change-Id: If6eb402428f29416ce01dfc32474248c560ae019
"}, {'created': '2018-05-10 13:43:54.000000000', 'message': "hardware: Start accounting for network requests

Modify the 'numa_fit_instance_to_host' function to take network requests
into account. This is mostly a case of linking everything together and
wrapping it in a pretty bow.

Part of blueprint numa-aware-vswitches

Change-Id: If6eb402428f29416ce01dfc32474248c560ae019
"}, {'created': '2018-06-11 14:30:11.000000000', 'message': "hardware: Start accounting for network requests

Modify the 'numa_fit_instance_to_host' function to take network requests
into account. We don't actually do anything with this yet (that will
come later) so this is mostly a case of linking everything together and
wrapping it in a pretty bow.

Part of blueprint numa-aware-vswitches

Change-Id: If6eb402428f29416ce01dfc32474248c560ae019
"}, {'created': '2018-06-14 16:23:36.000000000', 'message': "hardware: Start accounting for networks in NUMA placement

Modify the 'numa_fit_instance_to_host' function to take networks into
account. We don't yet do anything with this at runtime, given that we're
not populating host NUMA network information, but that can come later.
It also doesn't stop us from unit testing things, which is nice.

Part of blueprint numa-aware-vswitches

Change-Id: If6eb402428f29416ce01dfc32474248c560ae019
"}, {'created': '2018-06-21 16:38:21.000000000', 'message': "hardware: Start accounting for networks in NUMA placement

commit_message:
hardware: Start accounting for networks in NUMA fitting

Modify the 'numa_fit_instance_to_host' function to take networks into
account. We don't yet do anything with this at runtime, given that we're
not populating host NUMA network information, but that can come later.
It also doesn't stop us from unit testing things, which is nice.

Part of blueprint numa-aware-vswitches

Change-Id: If6eb402428f29416ce01dfc32474248c560ae019

(1 comment)

I've looked around these patches a bit and am kinda summarizing the issue I see here, since this is where you're starting the whole (ab)use of NetworkRequest line of thinking. What I describe is a little complicated, but honestly, storing networkrequest in two new places isn't exactly simple.

Anyway, this'll get you started on where my mind is on this stuff and we can discuss further in YVR as we said."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-05 14:56:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Per the spec, this change goes away. The API will populate the RequestSpec.numa_networks field which will be an instance of InstanceNUMANetworks. The request spec goes to the scheduler and NUMATopologyFilter which will take the InstanceNUMANetworks object and pass to the hardware module to see if the request fits the host, and then if it does, update the limits dict with the same numa_networks field which will eventually be used to claim resources on the compute host. Then it's the same object passed around all 3 places, but not persisted in the DB in any of them."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-06-08 13:30:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-06-08 14:48:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
objects: Add RequestSpec.network_metadata

We need a way to pass information about networks from the conductor to
the scheduler. These are not really part of the network requests but
rather metadata about these networks, meaning the 'NetworkRequest'
object doesn't really make sense. Instead, we use the recently added
'NetworkMetadata' object like the good citizens we are.

Part of blueprint numa-aware-vswitches

Change-Id: Icb295bbd8c83e2e340a7ac3ecc1f159e0db7c7b1

commit_message:
Support resetting interfaces to their default values

This change extends the 'baremetal node set' command with a new family
of arguments --reset-XXX-interface. They reset the XXX_interface field
to its calculated default. This feature is primarily needed to make
changing hardware types simpler, but is also useful on its own.

Refactored the set command code to avoid excessive copy-paste.

Change-Id: I7be88975cea4cae33e84c2b69e3a0cc4fb04ba22
Story: #2002868
Task: #22821

subject: Change 'command' type from string to list
messages:
[{'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2018-07-09 10:21:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2018-07-09 10:23:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Hongbin,

This works with 1.20 container API version but will fail with lower API version. Should we also do a check if the API version is lower than pas a string?'}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2018-07-09 10:24:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Hongbin,

This works with 1.20 container API version but will fail with lower API version. Should we also do a check if the API version is lower than pas a string?'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-07-10 01:41:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)

@Madhuri,

Thanks for working on this. Several comments inline. In addition, I think we need to bump the API version to 1.20 or later in https://github.com/openstack/python-zunclient/blob/master/zunclient/api_versions.py#L34 . That is because we changed the command type starting from API version 1.20.'}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2018-07-11 08:33:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2018-07-11 08:36:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thank you Hongbin for the review.
I have updated the patch. But the zunclient will fail in below case:

zun --zun-api-version 1.18 create  cirros ping -c 4 8.8.8.8
ERROR: Invalid input for field 'command'.Value: '[u'ping', u'-c', u'4', u'8.8.8.8']'. [u'ping', u'-c', u'4', u'8.8.8.8'] is not of type 'string', 'null'

Failed validating 'type' in schema['properties']['command']:
    {'type': ['string', 'null']}

On instance:
    [u'ping', u'-c', u'4', u'8.8.8.8'] (HTTP 400) (Request-ID: req-085901ea-ae47-4f73-ad5d-b423e3151043)"}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-07-12 01:34:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-07-12 01:35:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Thank you Hongbin for the review.
 > I have updated the patch. But the zunclient will fail in below
 > case:
 > 
 > zun --zun-api-version 1.18 create  cirros ping -c 4 8.8.8.8
 > ERROR: Invalid input for field 'command'.Value: '[u'ping', u'-c',
 > u'4', u'8.8.8.8']'. [u'ping', u'-c', u'4', u'8.8.8.8'] is not of
 > type 'string', 'null'
 > 
 > Failed validating 'type' in schema['properties']['command']:
 > {'type': ['string', 'null']}
 > 
 > On instance:
 > [u'ping', u'-c', u'4', u'8.8.8.8'] (HTTP 400) (Request-ID:
 > req-085901ea-ae47-4f73-ad5d-b423e3151043)

I see. This should be fixed now. We now check the api version and convert the command to string if the version is lower than 1.20"}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-07-12 01:36:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2018-07-12 06:23:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Thanks Hongbin, it worked now.'}, {'account_id': 21785, 'date': '2018-07-18 06:02:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21785, 'date': '2018-07-18 06:02:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2018-07-18 10:37:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}]

commit_message:
Change 'command' type from string to list

This changes the type of command parameter from string
to list as changed in server side[1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575709/

Change-Id: I980834cee0031ef12a720d46eebaed33e8cb4c02
Closes-bug: #1780656

messages:
[{'account_id': 8873, 'date': '2018-05-31 14:44:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2018-05-31 14:55:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Looks good!, 

I'm downloading to check if 
self.subnet = self.create_subnet(self.network)

creates a subnet without dns_server configured, which, it works for reference soultion, but it's a know bug for ovn, for example."}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2018-05-31 14:59:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

good, it's created without dns_server configured, so it will verify for regressions of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571006/ :)"}, {'account_id': 8873, 'date': '2018-05-31 15:39:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-05-31 15:46:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Someone must have seen Solo over the weekend :)'}, {'account_id': 8873, 'date': '2018-05-31 16:00:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2018-05-31 16:03:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Do you think there's a way to detect the fqdn and try to resolve that? :)"}, {'account_id': 8873, 'date': '2018-05-31 17:18:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

The dns_domain is set in Neutron confs. If you create a network without specifying the domain, then its dns_domain field is empty, but the FQDN will be determined by Neutron confs... So I think we'd have to add a tempest conf to match the neutron conf and that's smelly."}, {'account_id': 8873, 'date': '2018-05-31 18:15:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2018-06-01 08:33:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

What about discovering the fqdn in VMA (resolv.conf?), and using that to try to ping VMB , just a bit of shell script in cirros :D'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-06-01 09:07:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I run this test on my local devstack and it passed fine. I'm not sure why it's failing here"}, {'account_id': 8873, 'date': '2018-06-01 12:29:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> What about discovering the fqdn in VMA (resolv.conf?), and using that to try to ping VMB , just a bit of shell script in cirros :D

Because then you're no longer testing expected behavior... It's circular logic. Check out the next patch in the series. It depends on a fix for network:dns_domain and enhances this test to ping the FQDN in a way that isn't circular."}, {'account_id': 8873, 'date': '2018-06-01 14:18:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 8873, 'date': '2018-06-01 14:19:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

It seems the ping binary in gate guest images (some Ubuntu image) is ignoring the -c and -w parameters, so the latest patchset switched over to use a wait_until_true loop instead.'}, {'account_id': 8873, 'date': '2018-06-01 17:06:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

The latest patchset still passes locally but fails at the gate. This time it doesn't look like ping is not given enough time to succeed - The test failed after 340~ seconds. Now I'm not sure why it's failing at the gate (but passed on Miguel's, Slawek's and my setups)."}, {'account_id': 8873, 'date': '2018-06-01 17:37:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 8873, 'date': '2018-06-01 17:40:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 8873, 'date': '2018-06-04 18:54:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 8873, 'date': '2018-06-04 18:54:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow-1

Replicated the test 8 times to try and gather more info to see why it fails at the gate but passes locally for multiple people.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-06-22 11:19:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8873, 'date': '2018-06-22 18:57:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Wow what a great catch :)

I can look it up but do you happen to know if we have a helper that can wait until a VM is up and running?

[{'created': '2018-06-26 14:07:09.000000000', 'message': 'DVR: Inter Tenant Traffic between networks not possible with shared net

Inter Tenant Traffic between two different networks that belong
to two different Tenants is not possible when connected through
a shared network that are internally connected through DVR
routers.

This issue can be seen in multinode environment where there
is network isolation.

The issue is, we have two different IP for the ports that are
connecting the two routers and DVR does not expose the router
interfaces outside a compute and is blocked by ovs tunnel bridge
rules.

This patch fixes the issue by not applying the DVR specific
rules in the tunnel-bridge to the shared network ports that
are connecting the routers.

Closes-Bug: #1751396
Change-Id: I0717f29209f1354605d2f4128949ddbaefd99629
(cherry picked from commit d019790fe436b72cb05b8d0ff1f3a62ebd9e9bee)
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: Inter Tenant Traffic between networks not possible with shared net

Inter Tenant Traffic between two different networks that belong
to two different Tenants is not possible when connected through
a shared network that are internally connected through DVR
routers.

This issue can be seen in multinode environment where there
is network isolation.

The issue is, we have two different IP for the ports that are
connecting the two routers and DVR does not expose the router
interfaces outside a compute and is blocked by ovs tunnel bridge
rules.

This patch fixes the issue by not applying the DVR specific
rules in the tunnel-bridge to the shared network ports that
are connecting the routers.

Closes-Bug: #1751396
Change-Id: I0717f29209f1354605d2f4128949ddbaefd99629
(cherry picked from commit d019790fe436b72cb05b8d0ff1f3a62ebd9e9bee)

commit_message:
Add functionality for vendor_data

Using vendor metadata helps alleviate the need to spin custom images
for things like package mirrors, timezones, or network proxies.

Adds new config option 'vendor-data' which takes a JSON formated
string to be used as static vendor metadata.

Adds new config option 'vendor-data-url' which takes a URL which
serves dynamic JSON formatted vendor metadata.

Adds new NovaMetadataContext class which writes
/etc/nova/vendor_data.json and enables it via nova.conf.

Closes-Bug: 1777714

[{'created': '2018-06-13 13:54:06.000000000', 'message': 'process to gracefully exit when last watcher exits

In case all the watchers (in the CNI case the pod watcher only) have
gracefully exited, continuing the process only serves to give a false
appearance of things working. At the same time, it prevents the
containerized deployment orchestrator from realizing that the Kuryr pod
is not functional so it does not restart it.

This fix allows non health proves environments where all watchers have
gracefully exited to be restarted by k8s/ocp and eventually work again
should the issue that made the graceful exits happen be solved.

commit_message:
process to gracefully exit when last watcher exits

In case all the watchers (in the CNI case the pod watcher only) have
gracefully exited, continuing the process only serves to give a false
appearance of things working. At the same time, it prevents the
containerized deployment orchestrator from realizing that the Kuryr pod
is not functional so it does not restart it.

This fix allows non health proves environments where all watchers have
gracefully exited to be restarted by k8s/ocp and eventually work again
should the issue that made the graceful exits happen be solved.

Change-Id: Id70978e06d980bc0ffa08bcee02d78bef9dcbeb8
Closes-Bug: #1776676
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

commit_message:
convert os-vif docs to follow PTI

- This change converts os-vif to use
  sphinx-build and doc/requirements.txt to
  be inline with new PTI requirements.
- This change tests docs requirements as part
  of the lower-constraints env.

Change-Id: Ic136941a17f90d6a6a8432fec96f8612c4bca8a2

messages: [{'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-07-18 09:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-07-18 10:56:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nthanks!'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-18 09:16:27.000000000', 'message': 'Increase etcd3gw dependency version

There is an upstream issue[1] in etcd3gw, when running on Python3, a
lock is never treated as acquired (although in fact it is acquired).
This makes that qinling cannot work properly on Python3.

The fix[2] is included in etcd3gw 0.2.2. So the requirements must be
updated for qinling to run normally on Python3.

[1]. https://github.com/dims/etcd3-gateway/issues/24
[2]. https://github.com/dims/etcd3-gateway/pull/25

Change-Id: I3868864b957c8a5cd8c26acadc7e17f1c427699c
'}]
commit_message:
Increase etcd3gw dependency version

There is an upstream issue[1] in etcd3gw, when running on Python3, a
lock is never treated as acquired (although in fact it is acquired).
This makes that qinling cannot work properly on Python3.

The fix[2] is included in etcd3gw 0.2.2. So the requirements must be
updated for qinling to run normally on Python3.

[1]. https://github.com/dims/etcd3-gateway/issues/24
[2]. https://github.com/dims/etcd3-gateway/pull/25

Change-Id: I3868864b957c8a5cd8c26acadc7e17f1c427699c

commit_message:
tasks: Record a venv_tag local fact for distro installations

Distro installations do not deploy virtual environments but they still
need a local venv_tag deployed. The reason for this is because this fact
is used by the integration repo to determine if the keystone software is
the same across all nodes in the keystone_all group so we can safely run
the DB migration.

Change-Id: I9bab11b3c643f2411d78267aa6114081fe76b9ef

as personal data which falls under its retention policy. As a crude

commit_message:
Persist ceph-ansible fetch_directory using mistral

When scaling ceph monitors, ceph-ansible uses context from the
fetch_directory to prevent new monitors from behaving like they
are the only monitors.

Save the fetch_directory in swift after each ceph-ansible playbook
run; and if there is a fetch directory in swift, restore it before
each playbook run.

Note that https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582811 only resolves
1769769 for Master where config-download external deploy tasks
run ceph-ansible. This change resolves 1769769 when using mistral
for Queens/Pike (when backported).

Change-Id: I4b576a6e7fbfb18fa13221e2d080bf7876a8303e
Depends-On: I995ad32345a39238ffb9cbcf9966dedc60c75ff8
Closes-Bug: #1769769
(cherry picked from commit 2f300dfd906ae747e626efa27f4dc0380aef361a)

[{'created': '2018-06-08 06:27:11.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I8975f6c22207495f5948c780752d3c14ddbbcd92
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I8975f6c22207495f5948c780752d3c14ddbbcd92

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Ib7b19bed1a16c0864068066fdb5b9e45595dd228

commit_message:
Fall back to PARTUUID if UUID returns nothing.

blkid does not always return a UUID when querying partitions (sda2 in my
case).  It does seem to return a PARTUUID though, so use that if needed.

Change-Id: I6f8dbd8fb8a02f6246b7ab00801159544f3288d6
Story: 2002052
Task: 19701

commit_message:
Add regenerate controller pod script

When developing using containerized mode, you'd need to go over the
steps on [1] quite a few times. This script just automates the process
for ease of development.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/kuryr-kubernetes/latest/installation/devstack/containerized.html

Change-Id: I034b1d79941e1f986dd7c4991c7c971bb202bf75

commit_message:
Improve docker/distribution reload handlers

Move the wait-for-registry-up loop and systemd daemon reloading
commands behind the user-faced "restart docker(-registry)"
handlers. So users may just refer to it w/o manual daemon reload
tasks and w/o knowing of other advanced sub-steps details. But
those handlers may still be notified directly as well.

Add a fixed delay of a 10s for the docker service reload handler,
which is nice to have for the loaded systems running that command
way too long.

Add wait-for-docker-service-up loop into the docker service
reload handler for the better failures detection.

Simplify future support on CoreOS/atomic distributions
(which require reloading docker and socket in particular order)

Based on
https://github.com/kubernetes-incubator/kubespray/blob/ \
  810596c6d8f1e13afa934ddeef996d4f42b29890/roles/docker/handlers/main.yml

Depends-On: I26cc07aa05912c3e84d59003686eae210e924a16
Change-Id: I28e8c682005e77b87a347f4d2a2dff219fab488c
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Ensure JAVA_HOME env var contains architecture

During the build of the Elasticsearch image, the Dockerfile sets an
env var specifying the architecture that the image is built for. This
change ensures that this env var is correctly used in the JAVA_HOME
directory.

Closes-Bug: 1780811

Change-Id: I3eeacabafcc3855165519a739792f0570fdfd5d8
