revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-26 16:39:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix gnocchi package

Due to an error in the __init__.py file name the
telemetry_tempest_plugin.gnocchi package was not an actual package.
Hence, tempest did not run the gnocchi tests.

Also fixed the location of the tests yaml file.

Change-Id: I9c1b99eb8e29950830dc21e98934e107910ba831
'}]
commit_message:
Fix gnocchi package

Due to an error in the __init__.py file name the
telemetry_tempest_plugin.gnocchi package was not an actual package.
Hence, tempest did not run the gnocchi tests.

Also fixed the location of the tests yaml file.

Change-Id: I9c1b99eb8e29950830dc21e98934e107910ba831

Transform metrics.update notification

The metrics.update notification has been transformed to
the versioned notification framework.

Change-Id: I2f6aba0c032baf181b103d2a16b8e768815170c9
Implements: bp versioned-notification-transformation-rocky

subject: trivial: Increase integration pip timeout
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 09:39:08.000000000', 'message': "trivial: Increase integration test timeout

It seems our tests don't run as fast as they used to. Give them a little
leeway but increasing the test timeout by 50% to unblock later changes.
Future changes can work on reducing this time again.

Change-Id: I860846772d7d61f9b223333f4435ba6e2c7ae5ac
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-07-18 09:10:30.000000000', 'message': "trivial: Increase integration pip timeout

It seems our tests pull in a lot of dependencies and the PyPI caches
aren't fast enough. Give the tests a little more leeway but increasing
the pip timeout by 2x to unblock later changes. Future changes can work
on resolving the slow pip issues.

Change-Id: I860846772d7d61f9b223333f4435ba6e2c7ae5ac
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
trivial: Increase integration pip timeout

It seems our tests pull in a lot of dependencies and the PyPI caches
aren't fast enough. Give the tests a little more leeway but increasing
the pip timeout by 2x to unblock later changes. Future changes can work
on resolving the slow pip issues.

Change-Id: I860846772d7d61f9b223333f4435ba6e2c7ae5ac
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add 'rm -f .testrepository/times.dbm' command in testenv

Running py2* post py3* tests results in error. Add
'rm -f .testrepository/times.dbm' command in testenv to
resolve this.

Change-Id: I7ed08de5dbc1ac6c75de07e74845b031f84e6698

commit_message:
Respect Nova Scheduler filters

The main purpose of this blueprint is to add Watcher filtering
mechanism similar to Nova Scheduler filtering. This filters would
be used during Audit's execution and should provide at least
affinity/anti-affinity, HA/AZ segregation.

Change-Id: I42b4b9d2b0d4b92b385524c7aae606babdd1aeb2
Implements: blueprint scheduler-filters

[{'created': '2018-07-17 10:33:40.000000000', 'message': 'Add docs requirements to venv

Prompted by a change from OpenStack TC the doc requirements live
separately. When that change entered this repo it slipped to add that
requirements to the venv to be able to do docs related operations (e.g.
create release notes). Thus currently the documented usage [1] does not
work for n-odl.

This patch adds the docs requirements to venv, restoring that
functionality.

[1]: https://docs.openstack.org/reno/latest/user/usage.html

Change-Id: I970d27c80343f185f7b2ec92da651f1fb6dcc986
'}]
commit_message:
Add docs requirements to venv

Prompted by a change from OpenStack TC the doc requirements live
separately. When that change entered this repo it slipped to add that
requirements to the venv to be able to do docs related operations (e.g.
create release notes). Thus currently the documented usage [1] does not
work for n-odl.

This patch adds the docs requirements to venv, restoring that
functionality.

[1]: https://docs.openstack.org/reno/latest/user/usage.html

Change-Id: I970d27c80343f185f7b2ec92da651f1fb6dcc986

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-11 00:37:19.000000000', 'message': 'docs: Add information on test removal/interop to REVIEWING

This patch set adds information on test removal, relocation,
renaming to REVIEWING because it is important that such
actions do not break interop. Interop is closely tied to
Tempest because it directly references Tempest tests that
are not only expected to exist, but to also work.

Thus it is important that there be REVIEWING guidelines
in places to assist reviewers understand the this importance.
Also references are included for defcore/interop to help
users find more information on these topics.

Currently interop is only mentioned in 1 place in Tempest [0]
and yet there is little information about it. This patchset
aims to make it easier to find more information about it
for reviewers and users alike.

[0] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tempest/tree/doc/source/test_removal.rst

commit_message:
docs: Add information on test removal/interop to REVIEWING

This patch set adds information on test removal, relocation,
renaming to REVIEWING because it is important that such
actions do not break interop. Interop is closely tied to
Tempest because it directly references Tempest tests that
are not only expected to exist, but to also work.

The same is true of breaking blacklist/whitelist
references to Tempest tests, this is also included
in the new documentation section.

It is important that there be REVIEWING guidelines
in place to assist reviewers understand this importance.
Also references are included for defcore/interop to help
users find more information on these topics.

Currently interop is only mentioned in 1 place in Tempest [0]
and yet there is little information about it. This patchset
aims to make it easier to find more information about it
for reviewers and users alike.

[0] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tempest/tree/doc/source/test_removal.rst

Change-Id: Ifbde674b42355077fcd8daa07be8be1248b77b0f

commit_message:
Add support for deploying Monasca Thresh

Monasca Thresh is a Java topology for Storm which generates
alerts from metrics. It depends on Java code in the
monasca-common library. In this change we support building
the Monasca Thresh Storm topology from source. To enable us
to submit the topology to Storm we inherit from the Storm
container (rather than the Monasca base image) so that we can
use the Storm client.

Change-Id: I389af89086cdab6d243c4a4fa65fd157535a5045
Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-containers

commit_message:
Fix the freezer-scheduler start failed

the start of freezer-scheduler need openstack auth which got
from env[0][1] by default, this ps to provide valid keystone
auth url with valid keystone api version to use.

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/freezer/blob/master/freezer/scheduler/arguments.py#L119
[1]: https://github.com/openstack/freezer/blob/master/freezer/scheduler/arguments.py#L49

Change-Id: I7097f6bd4fe7d13bb78b9f5a5841e14d27ea4b3e
Closes-Bug: #1752242

I also have a concern that should I add a new queue to put the running processes, which can avoid db calls in the loop: when the process starts, pop it from waiting_live_migrations, and put it into running_live_migrations, by doing this, I don't have to call db each time I check the status, and I will pop it out of the running queue once it is finished or errored."}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-05-31 07:56:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Compute: add support to abort queued live migration

This patch modified compute manager and bumps the
nova-compute service version to be able to abort
live migration in ``queued`` and ``preparing`` status.
The following patch will modify the API part.

Part of blueprint abort-live-migration-in-queued-status

Change-Id: I3689dd6544c387676983be47cf925c3fd7ce72f1

[{'created': '2018-06-21 15:17:30.000000000', 'message': 'Django 2.0 support

Replace django.core.urlresolves with django.urls

(In Django 2.0) The django.core.urlresolvers module is removed
in favor of its new location, django.urls.
It was deprecated in Django 1.10:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/releases/1.10/#id3

To test the dashboard with python3 and Django 1.11,
python3-django111 job is added to tox.ini and a corresponding
entry is added to .zuul.yaml.

requirements.txt is also updated not to include horizon dependecies.
This allows horizon plugins not to track changes in basic stuffs
like Django.

KeyError from memoized decorator occurs in watcher-dashboard python3
tests but it seems it is not specific to Django 2.0 support,
so it is not touched. Hopefully it can be fixed later.

Change-Id: Ia98e4685f217c1e932d4b68b864cd9f52c88b134

commit_message:
Django 2.0 support and fix lower-constraints

Replace django.core.urlresolves with django.urls

(In Django 2.0) The django.core.urlresolvers module is removed
in favor of its new location, django.urls.
It was deprecated in Django 1.10:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/releases/1.10/#id3

To test the dashboard with python3 and Django 1.11,
python3-django111 job is added to tox.ini and a corresponding
entry is added to .zuul.yaml.

requirements.txt is also updated not to include horizon dependecies.
This allows horizon plugins not to track changes in basic stuffs
like Django.

KeyError from memoized decorator occurs in watcher-dashboard python3
tests but it seems it is not specific to Django 2.0 support,
so it is not touched. Hopefully it can be fixed later.

lower-constraints job is also fixed.
- Previously install_command specifies upper-constraints.txt even for
  lower-constraints tox env. As a result, lower-constraints job actually
  tests upper-constraints.
  This commit moves -c option for upper-constraints.txt to 'deps'.
- lower-constraints.txt is updated.
- nose-exclude 0.3.0 actually does not work. 0.5.0 needs to be used.

Change-Id: Ia98e4685f217c1e932d4b68b864cd9f52c88b134

commit_message:
Fix ServerMigrationSampleJsonTestsV2_24 to use its own sample file

The ServerMigrationSampleJsonTestsV2_24 functional tests set up
``self.api.microversion`` to 2.24 in its' setUp(), by doing this
it will not need to add its' own sample files, as there will be
no difference anyway. But this makes Tests that inherent from this
test class impossibe to run as the microversion will always been
overriden.

This patch fix it by change the tests to use self.microversion and
adds its' own sample files.

Part of blueprint abort-live-migration-in-queued-status

Change-Id: I07222efb8d566fa1dd395ef948eae6e6c4b13678

subject: Keep the API validation using WSME
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-28 04:51:14.000000000', 'message': 'Keep the API validation using WSME

There was spec to perform the watcher API validation
using JSON schema but during PoC [1] it was found that
WSME validation is already there for watcher APIs and we
can extend and fix those if needed.

To avoid confusion for members/future team who are not
part of mentioned review discussion, this commit removes
the approved spec for doing validation using JSON shema
as of now and keep the API validation using WSME.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/567787/

Change-Id: I645095a39ac97c49b44fcb52bfb81de24da81f43
'}]
commit_message:
Keep the API validation using WSME

There was spec to perform the watcher API validation
using JSON schema but during PoC [1] it was found that
WSME validation is already there for watcher APIs and we
can extend and fix those if needed.

To avoid confusion for members/future team who are not
part of mentioned review discussion, this commit removes
the approved spec for doing validation using JSON shema
as of now and keep the API validation using WSME.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/567787/

commit_message:
Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python 3

The previous version returned a byte string, which caused errors on
Python 3. I borrowed the fix from [1].

Change-Id: If89a3808271756925708e5f48f4a9726b5e25aec

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-18 06:29:02.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I346d4ab64536734835c6a33e8a585ae343c82018
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I346d4ab64536734835c6a33e8a585ae343c82018

'}, {'created': '2018-05-04 20:31:07.000000000', 'message': "Use ThreadPoolExecutor for max_concurrent_live_migrations

This changes the max_concurrent_live_migrations handling
to use a ThreadPoolExecutor so that we can control a bounded
pool of Futures in order to cancel queued live migrations
later in this series.

There is a slight functional difference in the unlimited
case since starting in python 3.5, ThreadPoolExecutor will
default to ncpu * 5 concurrently running threads. However,
max_concurrent_live_migrations defaults to 1 and assuming
compute hosts run with 32 physical CPUs on average, you'd
be looking at a maximum of 160 concurrently running live
migrations, which is probably way above what anyone would
consider sane.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Part of blueprint abort-live-migration-in-queued-status

Change-Id: Ia9ea1e164fb3b4a386405538eed58d94ad115172

commit_message:
Use ThreadPoolExecutor for max_concurrent_live_migrations

This changes the max_concurrent_live_migrations handling
to use a ThreadPoolExecutor so that we can control a bounded
pool of Futures in order to cancel queued live migrations
later in this series.

There is a slight functional difference in the unlimited
case since starting in python 3.5, ThreadPoolExecutor will
default to ncpu * 5 concurrently running threads. However,
max_concurrent_live_migrations defaults to 1 and assuming
compute hosts run with 32 physical CPUs on average, you'd
be looking at a maximum of 160 concurrently running live
migrations, which is probably way above what anyone would
consider sane.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Part of blueprint abort-live-migration-in-queued-status

Change-Id: Ia9ea1e164fb3b4a386405538eed58d94ad115172

commit_message:
Fluentd configures rsyslog to send logs properly

Fluentd configures rsyslog on the docker, but as the /etc/rsyslog.d directory
is not mounted, the rsyslog service is not configured.

This patch add the /etc/rsyslog.d directory to the fluentd container, so
rsyslog service is configured

Closes-Bug: #1780722
Change-Id: I94bd6aaa5f9da86fa642ac1225db1aa3ad3d2754

Make specs build

Move specs under the doc/source path so they're picked up by tox -e
docs. Fix rst errors. Make them show up in toctrees.

Change-Id: I96cb7a93b129d0839733e446b66ab19d05f91acc

commit_message:
Unable to pass additional parameters to update_router test case

This commit fixes the bug. We can now pass additional json
attributes to update_router test case. 'name' and 'admin_state_up'
is needed after the loop since this method is used by test cases
which do not pass these attributes to the modified method.

Change-Id: Icf2e7ccce85e4f8e4918890e8492c58950ce9658
Closes-Bug: #1424099

commit_message:
z/VM Driver: add power actions

Implement power_on, power_off, pause, unpause and reboot methods for
zvm virt driver.

Change-Id: I4199ec0e52ef2c9bd1cce2c8bc30097aaa5d7b82

commit_message:
Add promote-to-replica-source to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the promote-to-replica-source command.

The trove command promote-to-replica-source is now:
    openstack database instance promote to replica source

Change-Id: I0009b3e1074ddabaed6b02f5578f28cffc995b30
Partially-Implements: blueprint trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

commit_message:
Change neutron CLI to openstack CLI in neutron doc

neutron CLI is deprecated and will be removed in the future. Use
openstack CLI instead.

Change-Id: I00fa6ee2e2ac19627a172ff49a55fe664e4f5c43
Closes-Bug: 1749801

messages:
[{'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2018-07-13 23:04:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-14 01:14:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2018-07-14 02:14:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2018-07-14 02:16:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-14 19:09:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Looks like you got all the cases cleaned up in Tempest. I see no reason why this can't be removed per REVIEWING.rst or plugin documentation which clearly states: "An external plugin can rely on using any configuration option coming from Tempest, there will be at least a full deprecation cycle for any option before it's removed."

Since this was deprecated 3 years ago here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/185080/13

I think that is more than enough cycles for removal, so +2 for removal.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-07-17 05:50:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I was searching through its usage and only one place i found where we should fix this[1] before removing. All other place are documents only which can cleaned up already. 

otherwise it looks good to me. 

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/tripleo-ci/tree/scripts/tripleo.sh#n1187'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-07-17 06:04:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I was searching through its usage and only one place i found where
 > we should fix this[1] before removing. All other place are
 > documents only which can cleaned up already.
 > 
 > otherwise it looks good to me.
 > 
 > [1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/tripleo-ci/tree/scripts/tripleo.sh#n1187

fixed in below patch- If you can make this patch dependent of tripleo patch - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583110/.

We could have removed it without fixing on tripleo as it is deprecated since 3 years but let's not break anyone if that script is being used somewhere."}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2018-07-17 15:54:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Ghanshyam,

The value of TripleO is True, and the default value of this option is also True. Is there any effect if removing this option from Tempest before removing it from TripleO?'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-07-18 01:30:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

> Ghanshyam,
 > 
 > The value of TripleO is True, and the default value of this option
 > is also True. Is there any effect if removing this option from
 > Tempest before removing it from TripleO?

ok, with default value i think we can merge. anyway we have patch up for them so they can merge that.'}]

commit_message:
Remove deprecated allow_tenant_isolation option

allow_tenant_isolation option of auth and compute groups has been
deprecated over 3 years since I78a4884e980ef7d0103639cb3792a54c69fb7761.
So we have spended much enough time for removing them, this patch does.

Change-Id: I0b0a5e16a5e3785579f95f75fa149b311d918e8c

commit_message:
Add Network Policies Driver

This patch adds the driver skel for Network Policy Support and hooks the
previously merged handler to use it. Follow up patches will provide translation
between NP and Neutron security groups and driver implementation.

Partially Implements: blueprint k8s-network-policies
Co-Authored-By: Eyal Leshem <eyal.leshem@toganetworks.com>
Change-Id: Ie8cca7b717677347f6a100e8d3b3912bdc20a148

commit_message:
ignore devices that have already been processed

Similar to how osdize in charms.ceph checks for already processed
devices we need to avoid checking if they are pristine or not.

Additionally, mapped LUKS devices need to be filtered from being zapped
as they may hold valuable data. They are only used as underlying devices
for device mapper and dmcrypt to provide a decrypted block device
abstration so if they really need to be zapped a mapping needs to be
removed first.

This change also pulls charms.ceph modifications.

Change-Id: I96b3d40b3f9e56681be142377e454b15f9e22be3
Co-Authored-By: Dmitrii Shcherbakov <dmitrii.shcherbakov@canonical.com>
Co-Authored-By: Chris Procter <chris.procter@canonical.com>
Closes-Bug: 1781453
(cherry picked from commit 8dad311db43e3c57c3569cc8e062dd8846470647)

commit_message:
Add execution-delete to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the execution-delete command.

The trove command execution-delete is now:
    openstack database backup execution delete

Change-Id: I9934a047d48daed53567b59bb51a2eab4d6e37b5
Partially-Implements: blueprint trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

commit_message:
Manila share driver for Inspur AS13000 series.

Features that Inspur AS13000 Driver support:
share create/delete,
snapshot create/delete,
extend size,
create_share_from_snapshot,
update_access.
protocol: nfs/cifs
ThirdPartySystems: INSPUR CI

Change-Id: If0e1134e80f799186bb7cd057ff0f2d713f39a06
Implements: Blueprint inspur-as13000-manila-driver

commit_message:
Add diskimage-builder project install

Disk-image-create file has been removed from 'diskimage-builder/bin/'.
see:
https://github.com/openstack/diskimage-builder/tree/master/bin

So,We nedd install diskimage-builder project before execute
disk-image-create command.

Change-Id: Idd052154ac3603a70a4b23eb17f4c84a8b321358

commit_message:
Replace support matrix ext with common library

The code to generate a support matrix has been pulled into a common
library. Using this instead of duplicating code in various projects that
need it.

Change-Id: If5c0bf2b0dcd7dbb7d316139ecb62a936fd15439
Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update WSGI process group

Ensure WSGI processes run under the 'gnocchi' group to
support restriction in permissions to /etc/gnocchi/* to
root or members of the gnocchi group.

This change also picks up changes in charms.openstack
to support this functionality, as well as fixing
misc issues with upgrades.

Change-Id: I14d865cd96b7c250ad92c8bdee74693a6eccc769
Closes-Bug: 1780490
Closes-Bug: 1779062
Related-Bug: 1781468

commit_message:
Handle mapping multiple heat parameters from one config option

When mapping enable_ipxe to heat template parameters we actually need to
ensure that multple template parameters are set.   Rather than enforcing
this on the whole PARAMETER_MAPPING dict, create a new dict to handle
these special options.

Blueprint: multiarch-support
Change-Id: I864336f2e4ff91449c8e7765bb11b2f68146165b

commit_message:
Support different versions of networkx

Since the entry of networkx 2.0 nodes has a different
behaviour. Checking if dg.nodes is iterable is enough to add
compatibility for new/older versions.

Change-Id: Ie894b5801bd7b3815432882cd626941e89d9f9a1

commit_message:
Support networkx 2.1

Support changes required for networkx 2.1; mostly a couple of returns
became iterators so wrap them in list()

Closes-Bug: #1712693
Closes-Bug: #1718576
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/578094
Change-Id: I5c589472d1673b984a41ff629916910ff525196a

commit_message:
Update pylint to 1.7.6, uncap networkx

One of the pylint dependencies has updated to be python3 only; this
version of pylint correctly caps things so it still works with
python2.

This also exposes that we need to uncap networkx due to
I34045f87ca19c2f184b040f4d89347374cce518b.  We should remain on
version 1 for now thanks to upper-constraints, but we need to maintain
the lower-constraint.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/583102
Change-Id: Iac9afc7766d3640815dc20cfd6de1245d36a09cc

commit_message:
Use hard coded values in schema than reference

API request schema should be using hard coded values
than reference of other nova code.

If refference code is changed for any reason and without
knowledge of that is being used in schema then, it can
change the schema unintentionally which leads to API backward
incompatible change.

It is always better to use raw and hard coded values in schema
to avoid unintentional API changes.

This commit removes the db value reference from few schema.

Change-Id: Ie1431b7f08172292d77d72fd8d0471a2c1b392b0

the lower-constraint.

---
Support different versions of networkx

Since the entry of networkx 2.0 nodes has a different

commit_message:
Update pylint to 1.7.6, uncap networkx

This review squashes:
    Iac9afc7766d3640815dc20cfd6de1245d36a09cc
    Ie894b5801bd7b3815432882cd626941e89d9f9a1

We need to do this as we can't fix pylint without networkx as that
failes requirements-chak due to us having a cap on networkx and we can't
uncap networkx as part of tripleo-buildimage installs without
constratints which gets us 2.1 and DIB desn't support 2.x

This is the commit message Iac9afc7766d3640815dc20cfd6de1245d36a09cc
---
One of the pylint dependencies has updated to be python3 only; this
version of pylint correctly caps things so it still works with
python2.

This also exposes that we need to uncap networkx due to
I34045f87ca19c2f184b040f4d89347374cce518b.  We should remain on
version 1 for now thanks to upper-constraints, but we need to maintain
the lower-constraint.
---

This is the commit message Ie894b5801bd7b3815432882cd626941e89d9f9a1
---
Support different versions of networkx

Since the entry of networkx 2.0 nodes has a different
behaviour. Checking if dg.nodes is iterable is enough to add
compatibility for new/older versions.
---

Change-Id: I82dc61fac6c156a4f0d574290c7632077aa53195

commit_message:
Add CUSTOM_CPU_FPGA Traits value to ironic inspection

iRMC driver inspects hardware to get qualitative resources. During node
inspection, the iRMC driver will automatically update the node.traits
field with CUSTOM_CPU_FPGA value based on information provided by the
node.

Co-Authored-By: Tran Ha Tuyen <tuyenth@vn.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I685c87561e74e0c7153e8fb948b819a783fad41f
Story: #2001999
Task: #19633

[{'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-06-28 07:58:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-06-28 13:33:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28008, 'date': '2018-06-28 14:52:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I think that the issue with grafana's db creation has nothing to do with monasca_pip_packages. 

The task that is breaking is from this repo:
https://github.com/flaviodsr/grafana-ansible/blob/796eb972d6712143a0430bc7b6a7aec2fbd9d231/tasks/setup_db.yml#L16

http://logs.openstack.org/21/578721/2/check/openstack-ansible-functional-ubuntu-xenial/9c2f547/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-06-28_14_08_34_610150

Aparently the issue could be with mysql_db module. The weird thing is that our grafana's deployments are working fina. This is only breaking in the openstack-ansible-funcional-ubuntu-xenial.

A good way to degub would be forking this grafana's repo and experiment workarounds, always considering to figure out the root cause of the problem."}, {'account_id': 28008, 'date': '2018-06-28 14:55:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

 > 
 > Aparently the issue could be with mysql_db module. The weird thing

commit_message:
Fix monasca

This ensures the dependencies on the monasca roles are deployed
after the initial deploy steps of monasca. This allows us to
install on the host the packages required for the extra roles,
until they are fixed. Moreover, the grafana-ansible role is being
moved to ansible-grafana from cloudalchemy repository.

Change-Id: I9381c4994e38933fd12c02c673bfe409daf2a59c
Co-Authored-By: Guilherme Steinmller <guilhermesp@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

messages:
[{'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-07-05 13:04:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-07-05 13:25:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

++'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-07-05 13:30:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not entirely sure about this. When we first created allocations as a concept the identifier was somewhat intentionally left ambiguous as there might be systems that wanted to use a non-uuid to identify a batch of allocations.

Are we sure we want to do that. It means that some systems may need to maintain local identifier to uuids-used-when-talking-to-placement maps, or will need to switch over to having uuids in some way.

That's probably okay, but let's be sure."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-07-05 14:05:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I'm not entirely sure about this. When we first created allocations
 > as a concept the identifier was somewhat intentionally left
 > ambiguous as there might be systems that wanted to use a non-uuid
 > to identify a batch of allocations.
 > 
 > Are we sure we want to do that. It means that some systems may need
 > to maintain local identifier to uuids-used-when-talking-to-placement
 > maps, or will need to switch over to having uuids in some way.
 > 
 > That's probably okay, but let's be sure.

If the intention is to not to restrict the consumer_id to UUID then we have to figure out what restrictions we apply. Today the DB restricts it to String(36) and the Consumer object model stores it in an UUIDField but the API validates nothing. This is clearly inconsistent. I'm open to make it consistent either as an UUID or any other field type but if this is not an UUID then we have to decide what it is and change placement accordingly."}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-07-05 14:35:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-21197 : SUCCESS in 56m 26s'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-07-05 17:50:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/580373/1/ : FAILURE in 2h 41m 00s'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-07-05 23:06:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > I'm not entirely sure about this. When we first created
 > allocations
 > > as a concept the identifier was somewhat intentionally left
 > > ambiguous as there might be systems that wanted to use a non-uuid
 > > to identify a batch of allocations.
 > >
 > > Are we sure we want to do that. It means that some systems may
 > need
 > > to maintain local identifier to uuids-used-when-talking-to-placement
 > > maps, or will need to switch over to having uuids in some way.
 > >
 > > That's probably okay, but let's be sure.
 > 
 > If the intention is to not to restrict the consumer_id to UUID then
 > we have to figure out what restrictions we apply. Today the DB
 > restricts it to String(36) and the Consumer object model stores it
 > in an UUIDField but the API validates nothing. This is clearly
 > inconsistent. I'm open to make it consistent either as an UUID or
 > any other field type but if this is not an UUID then we have to
 > decide what it is and change placement accordingly.

This reminds me of how we handle project_id/user_id today in nova. These are actually not restricted to UUIDs except in one place, I believe. That is, in the database schema they are String(255) and StringField in most of the unified objects. This goes back to the history of how keystone project_id/user_id need not be UUIDs depending on what backend is being used, or something like that.

Here though, somebody created the database schema with UUID in mind apparently, judging by the String(36) and the use of UUIDField in the objects and even the variable name is 'consumer_uuid'. So, I'm not sure whether there was a discussion around it, but to make it more generic, a lot of that code would need to change."}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-07-06 04:09:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-07-06 07:05:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-07-09 20:07:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

> the variable name is 'consumer_uuid'.

This is what sells it for me.  Not the fact that we call it consumer_uuid within the code, but that it's all over the docs as `consumer_uuid` (even though that keyword never appears in an actual payload).

Want to get at least an ack from cdent that he doesn't feel strongly enough to hold this up for further discussion before I +W though."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-07-09 20:37:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Discussed this further with cdent [1], and we agreed that, although it's unfortunate, this is the right thing to do given the momentum of the existing code.

However, we also reminded ourselves [2] that we ought to be sanitizing incoming "UUIDs" to 8-4-4-4-12 format in general. While other cases should be covered by one or more separate patches, this is certainly the right place to do it for consumer UUIDs.

...including gabbi tests that create allocations with the "same" consumer UUID, with and without dashes, and prove that they are indeed the same allocation.  That will fail today.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-placement/%23openstack-placement.2018-07-09.log.html#t2018-07-09T20:05:56'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-07-09 21:09:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I proposed a gabbi test for the unsanitized UUID: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/581137/'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-09 21:12:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-07-09 21:16:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Add UUID validation for consumer_uuid

When an allocation is created with PUT /allocations/{consumer_uuid} the
consumer_uuid is not validated as UUID in the API and the DB schema only
checks that is fits into String(36). However the Consumer object stores
this value in a UUIDField oslo only raises a warning today.

This patch adds a UUID validation for that URL path.

Change-Id: Idedd85ca9266f10ce09231c34cab7ca43029a56c
Closes-Bug: #1780238

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Icb8426985ea156ed8b5f4dd454ed8457c11ec2a0

commit_message:
Remove the unused [keystone_authtoken] section

1. Vitrage use [service_credentials] section[0], rather than
[keystone_authtoken] section, it should be remove from the docs.

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/vitrage/blob/5c4bd36e8090ecbfca48980bc47c89e4808230b1/vitrage/opts.py#L56

Change-Id: Ic9c366e48d1ec7836a8948e738b231962deb94ed

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-12 18:18:21.000000000', 'message': "Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

Change-Id: I4279311e1022d8625503b41e69573e680fbb742a

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

Change-Id: I4279311e1022d8625503b41e69573e680fbb742a

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Ie84d18b0bcc2a33587bd72204c0eb3dad687be7e

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

Change-Id: Ib41f12b837f73ea534c6a0f926a70f7a82d7a194

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

Change-Id: I32752523e9ed484bf0864be4db146bb333f9f55e

commit_message:
Add "delete_port_binding" network API method

This adds a method to delete the binding for
a given port and host, which is something the
compute service will need to do for port bindings
on the source host during post-live-migration or
the destination host when rolling back from a failed
live migration.

There is no top-level definition of this in
nova.network.base_api.NetworkAPI because the
later patches that use this will only do so
via other public interfaces into the neutronv2
API code.

Part of blueprint neutron-new-port-binding-api

Change-Id: Ia18d3d78d8782a0c5827fc90b8ab2d346f28ccab

[{'created': '2017-11-28 23:29:53.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Add code to bind a port against a dest host during live migration

This plumbs in the neutron API client side code for creating port
bindings to the destination host during a live migration.

Since we don't have python API bindings in python-neutronclient yet,
this relies on pure REST API calls using a keystoneauth Adapter object.

The port binding extension API calls are based on the spec:

https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/pike/portbinding_information_for_nova.html#binding-api-extension-for-ports

This plumbs in the neutron API client side code for creating port
bindings to the destination host during a live migration.

The port binding extension API calls are based on the extension definition:

I431be79975f6fc371822038ed4acdf02e7b8e99b

Since python-neutronclient does not yet have python API bindings
for the new binding-extended APIs, this change has to use a
keystoneauth1 Adapter object for making the calls. We could use
python-neutronclient as a proxy to the requests library, but then
we lose fine-grained control over error handling.

Depends-On: Ie31d4e27e3f55edfe334c4029ca9ed685e684c39

commit_message:
Add "bind_ports_to_host" neutron API method

This plumbs in the neutron API client side code for creating port
bindings to the destination host during a live migration.

The port binding extension API calls are based on the extension
definition:

I431be79975f6fc371822038ed4acdf02e7b8e99b

Since python-neutronclient does not yet have python API bindings
for the new binding-extended APIs, this change has to use a
keystoneauth1 Adapter object for making the calls. We could use
python-neutronclient as a proxy to the requests library, but then
we lose fine-grained control over error handling.

Depends-On: Ie31d4e27e3f55edfe334c4029ca9ed685e684c39

Part of blueprint neutron-new-port-binding-api

Change-Id: Ide22f87fece3ac7183e696891214cdafd03c7f48

commit_message:
objects: Add NUMATopologyLimits.network_metadata

We need some way to pass the metadata about requested networks back from
nova-scheduler to nova-compute for using during claiming. This satisfies
that requirement.

Part of blueprint numa-aware-vswitches

Change-Id: I3f62b2770dc2df70636f3cefa9144fde3c97ce42

commit_message:
Handle non-string keys appropriately

In python dict keys can be anything that is hashable; which
includes non-strings such as ints. Currently the code is blowing
up with these types of keys with exceptions like:

TypeError: argument of type 'int' is not iterable

So to fix that handle the case where non-string keys are found.

Change-Id: I4f576a089df6f68e43572bf0eee15e99f2b557fe

commit_message:
Fix usage of "|" for tests

With the more recent versions of ansible, we should now use
"is" instead of the "|" sign for the tests.

This should fix it.

Change-Id: I8d78a2b4ba2a8746cbb809e4f8c9370abe211350

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-26 17:48:10.000000000', 'message': "Dropping radvd process privileges

radvd needs to run as root, but has the capability to drop privileges on
linux hosts. Currently, radvd process is not using this feature and
this can be considered a serious risk.

In addition, some distributions like SUSE, radvd process runs as a non
privileged user by default, causing radvd failure to daemonize
because it can't write the pid in the corresponding neutron folder and
break the IPv6 functionality.

This patch allows radvd process to run with the same user used by
neutron. In order to allow this, it changes the radvd config file
permissions to 444 because radvd doesn't allow that this file can be
writeable by self/group. The readonly mode is not a problem updating the
file because of the way the neutron_lib replace_file function handles
the files operations.

Closes-Bug: #1777922

Change-Id: Ic5d976ba71a966a537d1f31888f82997a7ccb0de
Signed-off-by: aojeagarcia <aojeagarcia@suse.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9f2b40f2cecc116906e77d69797c0c6877bd5b4d)
"}]
commit_message:
Dropping radvd process privileges

radvd needs to run as root, but has the capability to drop privileges on
linux hosts. Currently, radvd process is not using this feature and
this can be considered a serious risk.

In addition, some distributions like SUSE, radvd process runs as a non
privileged user by default, causing radvd failure to daemonize
because it can't write the pid in the corresponding neutron folder and
break the IPv6 functionality.

This patch allows radvd process to run with the same user used by
neutron. In order to allow this, it changes the radvd config file
permissions to 444 because radvd doesn't allow that this file can be
writeable by self/group. The readonly mode is not a problem updating the
file because of the way the neutron_lib replace_file function handles
the files operations.

Closes-Bug: #1777922

Change-Id: Ic5d976ba71a966a537d1f31888f82997a7ccb0de
Signed-off-by: aojeagarcia <aojeagarcia@suse.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9f2b40f2cecc116906e77d69797c0c6877bd5b4d)

commit_message:
Improve exception that is raised following invalid service

This patchset changes the exception that is raised following
an invalid service being passed in for testing. Instead of
a NotFound getting raised (which doesn't make sense), the
original exception, RbacInvalidServiceException, is raised
instead. In addition "Exception" is appended to the original
exception name for greater clarity and consistency with other
exception names.

This patchset is similar to [0] which aims to simplify and
consolidate how service input is validated.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/577963/

Change-Id: Ib91a6581f89a528630d756840176b0e16663fa6f

commit_message:
Fix usage of "is" instead of the "|" in Ansible

With the more recent versions of Ansible,
we should now use "is" instead of the "|" sign for the tests.

This should fix it.

Change-Id: I2c13b65f124cbaf0f562196603d3ea65f42e064d

Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

commit_message:
Update "auth_url"

Following the change in Keystone Install Guide [1],
this patch replace port 35357 with 5000 for "auth_url".

For more details, please check similar changes which have been done
on other projects: Nova [2], Neutron [3], Cinder [4], Glance [5].

In addition, update deprecated "auth_uri" to "www_authenticate_uri",
according to [6].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541857
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562812
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566491
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565464
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558932
[6] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522

Change-Id: I262c3b75f98e3ae85b913a5086c3c5ff5edba8f9

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-03 20:16:04.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure clouds.yaml is placed correctly

When placing the clouds.yaml file, it needs to be accessible to
the user running ansible. This is especially confusing when using
localhost delegation, but targeting the playbook at localhost
because if the play is using sudo, it is root, but the clouds.yml
reading will be done as the user running the playbook rather than
the remote user on the target.

To ensure that the file is placed in the right directory and with
the right permissions, we provide the right variable values as
host_vars for localhost. This caters properly for localhost
delegation for the service setup tasks which use it.

Change-Id: I9f4204b312bb1712c251bbe38bbce6afb230a1e0
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure clouds.yaml is placed correctly

When placing the clouds.yaml file, it needs to be accessible to
the user running ansible. This is especially confusing when using
localhost delegation, but targeting the playbook at localhost
because if the play is using sudo, it is root, but the clouds.yml
reading will be done as the user running the playbook rather than
the remote user on the target.

To ensure that the file is placed in the right directory and with
the right permissions, we provide the right variable values as
host_vars for localhost. This caters properly for localhost
delegation for the service setup tasks which use it.

Change-Id: I9f4204b312bb1712c251bbe38bbce6afb230a1e0

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not

Change-Id: I872ea4b71f35c5bad53fe1bcf2a50a6f21b8f9ee

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I872ea4b71f35c5bad53fe1bcf2a50a6f21b8f9ee
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
use open() instead of file()

Under python 3 the built-in file() has been removed. Use open()
instead, since it works for both python 2 and 3.

Change-Id: Ifec91646f036dabd8dd6dcd4c648ef4b5bf23427
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Remove PyPI downloads

According to official site,
https://packaging.python.org/guides/analyzing-pypi-package-downloads/
PyPI package download statistics is no longer maintained and thus
should be removed.

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I0190d49f1f6153937a2032f199a17696c21efa83

resource reservation services in OpenStack.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 02:19:34.000000000', 'message': 'Clone Kuryr repository by TARGET_BRANCH

The variable $TARGET_BRANCH will be set by devstack. It will point
to the right branch that the devstack is based on. For example,
if the devstack is on a stable branch, TARGET_BRANCH will point to
that stable branch. Using this variable will save us the manual
effort to update the branch whenever we cut a release.

Change-Id: I45f93aa328c4e166d131d18c579651e4e96c3254
'}]
commit_message:
Clone Kuryr repository by TARGET_BRANCH

The variable $TARGET_BRANCH will be set by devstack. It will point
to the right branch that the devstack is based on. For example,
if the devstack is on a stable branch, TARGET_BRANCH will point to
that stable branch. Using this variable will save us the manual
effort to update the branch whenever we cut a release.

Change-Id: I45f93aa328c4e166d131d18c579651e4e96c3254

commit_message:
Should not allow duplicate device name when provide bdm for create

Currently when we create instance with bdm provided, if multiple bdm is
using the same device name, for example, all of them are vdb, the latter
bdm will override the previous
bdms and it will lead to only one bdm created.

We should raise error for this kind of scenario.

Change-Id: I1578473091e43ce1b05a0a81f242213f4e6bc216
closes-bug: #1648323

[{'created': '2018-07-02 10:45:58.000000000', 'message': 'Support nova compute-api microversion `2.53`

This patch enables blazar to use microversion `2.53` for nova compute api
from the nova client. This microversion is needed when multiple cells are
in the environment and blazar wants to store uuids intead of internal
ids in nova DB because the internal ids can be duplicated between cells.

Change-Id: I67718490a07ee2edf05d043755dcc02fda3516a9
'}, {'created': '2018-07-09 08:20:45.000000000', 'message': 'Support nova compute-api microversion `2.53`

With compute API microversion `2.53`, nova changed `/hypervisor`
API to return compute host uuids instead of internal ids. This is needed
when multiple cells are in the environment because the internal ids can
be duplicated between cells.

However, if you set blazar.conf for that microversion, blazar raised an
internal server error when creating a host.

This is because with that microversion one nova client exception is
changed from NotFound to BadRequest. This patch fixes the bug by
catching the changed exception as well.

Change-Id: I67718490a07ee2edf05d043755dcc02fda3516a9
Closes-Bug: #1780738
'}, {'created': '2018-07-10 08:01:56.000000000', 'message': "Support nova compute-api microversion '2.53'

Nova has changed '/os-hypervisors' API to return compute host UUIDs
instead of internal ids since the version 2.53 [1].

However, if the version 2.53 is set for the nova_client_version option
in the blazar.conf, an internal server error is caused when creating a
host because the nova client exception has been changed from NotFound
to BadRequest since that version.

This patch solves the problem by handling both of those exceptions.

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#list-hypervisors

Change-Id: I67718490a07ee2edf05d043755dcc02fda3516a9
Closes-Bug: #1780738
"}, {'created': '2018-07-16 18:02:54.000000000', 'message': "Support nova compute-api microversion '2.53'

commit_message:
Support nova compute-api microversion '2.53'

Nova has changed the '/os-hypervisors' API to return compute host UUIDs
instead of internal ids since version 2.53 [1].

However, if version 2.53 is set for the nova_client_version option in
blazar.conf, an internal server error is caused when creating a host
because the nova client exception has been changed from NotFound to
BadRequest since that version.

This patch solves the problem by handling both exceptions.

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#list-hypervisors

Change-Id: I67718490a07ee2edf05d043755dcc02fda3516a9
Closes-Bug: #1780738

commit_message:
Set Tempest concurrency to one

We are going to add API tests using Gabbi to the blazar-tempest-plugin.
But if the Gabbi tests are executed by different workers, their order
gets violated.

This patch changes Tempest concurrency to 1 to ensure the Gabbi tests
are executed in the order specified in the YAML file. This can increase
test execution time, but it should be negligible.

Change-Id: Id4dc3cc8640e8f902f96130a85e50008b5e8b96d

Thank you, Tetsuro! Your doc fix is for aligning with current implementation. However, I think the current implementation is not appropriate. E.g. for the create lease API, Blazar sends response after it completes creating a lease but the response code is 202 (this is used for Asynchronous API [1]). I think 201 is better for that.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/http/response-codes.html'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-07-09 08:34:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-06 01:58:52.000000000', 'message': 'Fix success status code in document

Blazar basically returns 202 for post and put methods
and 204 for delete method, but the document says it
returns 200 for sccess. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: Ia5afd12552e4c9169ebe35324d5a5b4495359b63
'}, {'created': '2018-07-11 06:35:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix post and put status codes

Blazar returned 202(Accepted) for post and put methods and
204(No content) for delete method. But the post method should
be 201(Created) because blazar ensures that a new host or a
new lease is created before the response. And the put method
should be 200(OK) since blazar ensures that the resource is
updated properly.

This patch also fixes the response code with the api reference.
The release note is submitted in a separate patch.

Change-Id: Ia5afd12552e4c9169ebe35324d5a5b4495359b63
'}, {'created': '2018-07-12 14:51:47.000000000', 'message': 'Fix POST and PUT status codes and update API Reference

Blazar returned 202 (Accepted) for POST and PUT methods. However, the
POST method should return 201 (Created) because Blazar ensures that a
new host or a new lease is created before responding. Similarly, the PUT
method should return 200 (OK) since Blazar ensures that the resource is
updated properly.

This patch also fixes the status code documented in the API Reference
for DELETE requests, which was wrongly described as 200 (OK) instead of
204 (No Content). The release note is submitted in a separate patch.

Change-Id: Ia5afd12552e4c9169ebe35324d5a5b4495359b63
'}, {'created': '2018-07-17 02:51:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fix POST and PUT status codes and update API Reference

Blazar returned 202 (Accepted) for POST and PUT methods. However, the
POST method should return 201 (Created) because Blazar ensures that a
new host or a new lease is created before responding. Similarly, the PUT
method should return 200 (OK) since Blazar ensures that the resource is
updated properly.

This patch also fixes the status code documented in the API Reference
for DELETE requests, which was wrongly described as 200 (OK) instead of
204 (No Content). The release note is submitted in a separate patch.

Change-Id: Ia5afd12552e4c9169ebe35324d5a5b4495359b63
'}, {'created': '2018-07-18 00:43:26.000000000', 'message': 'Fix POST and PUT status codes and update API Reference

Blazar returned 202 (Accepted) for POST and PUT methods. However, the
POST method should return 201 (Created) because Blazar ensures that a
new host or a new lease is created before responding. Similarly, the PUT
method should return 200 (OK) since Blazar ensures that the resource is
updated properly.

This patch also fixes the status code documented in the API Reference
for DELETE requests, which was wrongly described as 200 (OK) instead of
204 (No Content). The release note is submitted in a separate patch.

Change-Id: Ia5afd12552e4c9169ebe35324d5a5b4495359b63
'}]
commit_message:
Fix POST and PUT status codes and update API Reference

Blazar returned 202 (Accepted) for POST and PUT methods. However, the
POST method should return 201 (Created) because Blazar ensures that a
new host or a new lease is created before responding. Similarly, the PUT
method should return 200 (OK) since Blazar ensures that the resource is
updated properly.

This patch also fixes the status code documented in the API Reference
for DELETE requests, which was wrongly described as 200 (OK) instead of
204 (No Content). The release note is submitted in a separate patch.

Change-Id: Ia5afd12552e4c9169ebe35324d5a5b4495359b63

commit_message:
Install python-neutron-lbaas before starting neutron

When installing onto pre-provisioned servers ("split-stack"), if the
python-neutron-lbaas package is not pre-installed, the deploy would
fail when Neutron LBaaS is enabled because tripleo would start Neutron
before installing the required package.

This commit moves neutron::services::lbaas into an earlier step to
ensure the packages are installed at an appropriate time.

Closes-bug: 1777023
Change-Id: I4aebcb66363918e692703d787d823ea0f39f0388

commit_message:
Replace unicode with six.text_type

The unicode() built-in does not exist under Python 3 so use
six.text_type, which is set correctly to str or unicode, instead.

Change-Id: I8932e1ea55ad36e5c10ad0c3206a32c7293100f7

(2 comments)

I'm not a big fan of this solution, though it may turn out to be the lesser of several evils.

The reason for my discomfort is the distance (call stack-wise) between the conditional that's deciding whether to populate the image URL and the code that uses / doesn't use that datum.

A couple of alternatives come to mind, though as I say, I'm not convinced they're any prettier.

- Add a kwarg indicating whether we need to populate the field or not.  If it defaults to False, then we only have to specify it for the legacy notification calling paths.  That way the logic lives at the same level as the code that uses / doesn't use the value.  (I haven't investigated how extensive this change would be.)

- Hack up a way to make the image_url field lazy-load.  Offhand the way that comes to mind is to make instance_info a local subclass of dict with a __getitem__ that special-cases 'image_ref_url'.

This is a soft -1 while we discuss alternatives."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-07-03 11:50:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-07-03 11:51:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-26 15:02:44.000000000', 'message': 'Call generate_image_url only for legacy notification

The legacy instance.exists notification includes the full url of the glance
image of the given instance. But the versioned notification only includes
the image uuid. Generating the full url can be a costly operation as it
needs to talk to Keyston.

So this patch makes sure that generate_image_url only called when the
generated information will be used.

Change-Id: I78c2a34b3d03438457cc968cd0a38b8131e4f6e6
Closes-Bug: #1757407
'}, {'created': '2018-07-03 11:50:54.000000000', 'message': 'Call generate_image_url only for legacy notification

commit_message:
Call generate_image_url only for legacy notification

The legacy instance.exists notification includes the full url of the glance
image of the given instance. But the versioned notification only includes
the image uuid. Generating the full url can be a costly operation as it
needs to talk to Keystone.

So this patch makes sure that generate_image_url only called when the
generated information will be used.

Change-Id: I78c2a34b3d03438457cc968cd0a38b8131e4f6e6
Closes-Bug: #1757407

subject: Fix unit test to have appropriate FakeHost
messages:
[{'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-07-10 10:28:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2018-07-12 14:10:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Tetsuro: thanks for fixing this bug. An alternative is to do a copy.deepcopy of the FakeHost. I tested it and it works well. What do you think of using this approach instead?'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-07-13 11:50:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-07-13 11:58:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Pierre
I first came up the same idea, but copy()\xa0and\xa0deepcopy()\xa0are designed to copy objects(instances) not classes.
When you pass a class the original class is returned.

    $ python
    >>> class A:
    ...     a = 1
    ... 
    >>> import copy
    >>> B = copy.deepcopy(A)
    >>> B.a
    1
    >>> del A.a
    >>> B.a
    Traceback (most recent call last):
        File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
    AttributeError: class A has no attribute 'a'

But I agree that creating a new class is a better idea.
Done in the latest patch set. How about it?'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-07-14 08:46:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

FYI:
The test execution order can be found in blazar/.testrepository/XX
Before the fix, the bug occurred when the same worker is used for the two test cases.
So we can confirm that this is fixed seeing that case.

[success case before the fix]
time: 2018-07-14 08:12:53.474827Z
tags: worker-0
test: utils.openstack.test_nova.NovaInventoryTestCase.test_get_host_details_with_invalid_host
time: 2018-07-14 08:12:53.482578Z

time: 2018-07-14 08:12:53.460417Z   # Earlier than the above! Successes.
tags: worker-1
test: utils.openstack.test_nova.NovaInventoryTestCase.test_get_host_details_without_az
time: 2018-07-14 08:12:53.471410Z

[failure case before the fix]
time: 2018-07-14 08:12:46.359474Z
tags: worker-1
test: utils.openstack.test_nova.NovaInventoryTestCase.test_get_host_details_with_invalid_host
time: 2018-07-14 08:12:46.367261Z

time: 2018-07-14 08:12:46.368726Z   # Later than the above. Fails.
tags: worker-1
test: utils.openstack.test_nova.NovaInventoryTestCase.test_get_host_details_without_az
time: 2018-07-14 08:12:46.379166Z'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2018-07-16 17:49:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-07-17 01:33:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

thanks!'}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-07-17 02:19:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Workflow

I expect https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583080/ solves the gate failure.'}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-07-17 02:51:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-07-18 00:45:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-07-18 00:45:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Fix unit test to have appropriate FakeHost

The unit test "test_get_host_details_without_az", which is added
in commit 8dd7a70a37b06cb122ae4988e7af024eb41a657d, sometimes failed.

This was because another test right above
"test_get_host_details_with_invalid_host" changes the FakeHost not
to have vcpus attribute, which results in InvalidHost exceptions
in following tests. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: Ied0b486dc61b51d717d8c0894df065026c76e99f
Closes-Bug: #1780946

commit_message:
Add unshelve instance error info to fault table

When the image of the SHELVED_OFFLOADED instance is deleted, the unshelve
instance will report an error, but the fault info not added into instance
fault table.

Closes-bug: #1779826

Change-Id: I365fcc148b27959acad1d3c4f8bb45c1ed790318

commit_message:
autodoc mock out monascaclient

current monascaclient version does not work with osc-lib 1.11.0.
Mock out the module for now until a new monascaclient is released
and put in upper constraints

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/579139/

commit_message:
Add security hardened images that can boot from uefi

This is a similar image than the hardened one, but it has some
differences:
- removes the blacklist of vfat module, as we need it
- Sets DIB_BLOCK_DEVICE to efi instead of mbr
- Uses the overcloud-secure-uefi element, that creates the proper layout

Change-Id: I0e1c79462da170fb9dc99e12c05817b9f565c0de
Depends-On: If9e0504438632f1a22b45b7c95e7bfb8cb6f41d3

commit_message:
Add generate_overcloud_roles var to overcloud-deploy role

This enables use of the openstack overcloud roles generate command
to generate an overcloud_roles.yaml instead of requiring a hard-coded
one to be passed.

This will be useful to CI test the example roles in t-h-t/roles and also
provide coverage of the roles generate CLI itself.

Change-Id: I89e3cb0f83b4b14dce9a9eed735f7e5b84451bdd

commit_message:
heat plugin: control 'local_pref' of BGPVPN resource

The the 'local_pref' attribute of a Heat BGPVPN resource
can now be controlled in a Heat template.

Change-Id: Ic8b38b89138e6e45e8574d27ae2a69a413c657f5
Partially-Implements: blueprint routes-control

commit_message:
Move scenario009 to the check queue

This scenario tests OpenShift deployment managed by TripleO on BM
nodes. We got the job working last week and it's been working fine
since then.

Let's move it to the check queue as a non-voting job for now and,
eventually, make it voting.

Change-Id: I302c03844603d270bb3a9787f6e2084e23fb7f9c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 04:46:30.000000000', 'message': 'Cap additional nova-network tests at Queens

As noted in I7aea99d7c1818b8edcda41ba4eaa062a8ea069eb, nova is working
on removing the nova-network only compute REST APIs in the Rocky
release, which means any requests to those APIs after Queens will result
in a 410 response, regardless of microversion or whether or not neutron
is being used.

The os-floating-ips-bulk API is being removed in nova change
I89d081108b398d8efba9636279088c61349b21e6. As a result,
os-floating-ips-bulk tests will no longer works against Rocky+ versions
of nova. Skip this test using the check added in the previous change.

Related to blueprint remove-nova-network

Change-Id: I1a2accebce29c3be6acec7ede67b1250552a42ca
'}]
commit_message:
Cap additional nova-network tests at Queens

As noted in I7aea99d7c1818b8edcda41ba4eaa062a8ea069eb, nova is working
on removing the nova-network only compute REST APIs in the Rocky
release, which means any requests to those APIs after Queens will result
in a 410 response, regardless of microversion or whether or not neutron
is being used.

The os-floating-ips-bulk API is being removed in nova change
I89d081108b398d8efba9636279088c61349b21e6. As a result,
os-floating-ips-bulk tests will no longer works against Rocky+ versions
of nova. Skip this test using the check added in the previous change.

Related to blueprint remove-nova-network

Change-Id: I1a2accebce29c3be6acec7ede67b1250552a42ca

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-29 13:32:02.000000000', 'message': "Replace 'raise StopIteration' with 'return'

With PEP 479, the behaviour of StopIteration is changing. Raising it to
stop a generator is considered incorrect and from Python 3.7 this will
cause a RuntimeError. The PEP recommends using the return statement.

More details: https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0479/#examples-of-breakage

Change-Id: Ia067940066a5666926dcf61136b03d721a87666e
"}]
commit_message:
Replace 'raise StopIteration' with 'return'

With PEP 479, the behaviour of StopIteration is changing. Raising it to
stop a generator is considered incorrect and from Python 3.7 this will
cause a RuntimeError. The PEP recommends using the return statement.

More details: https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0479/#examples-of-breakage

Change-Id: Ia067940066a5666926dcf61136b03d721a87666e

commit_message:
Select default openstack plan for tripleo deploy

This replicates the logic added to tripleo-common in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/579892/ so we select
the default plan-samples/openstack files when no user provided
files exist in the tht_render dir.

Change-Id: I5ce97e7970648e65041a69a691aade2193834fb9

commit_message:
Lower Ceph PGs count in scenario004

Each OSD can only host maximum 200 PGs, in scenario004 we create 9
pools to enable MDS/Manila and RGW so we need to lower the PGs
count further, compared to scenario001.

Also lowers the values in low-memory-usage.yaml environment file.

Change-Id: If95a0e3fe5aeef61f9712d8006e0f49c11a0c90f
Closes-Bug: 1781910

[{'created': '2018-07-17 16:24:27.000000000', 'message': "ensure we do not modify private data from drivers

When we ask for a list of options from a drivere for generating the
sample config or documentation, we want to insert the actual 'driver'
option at the front of the list. This keeps each driver from having to
do that, and allows us to generate the sample with good
defaults. However, if a driver returns us a static data structure, we
do not want to modify *that* set of data, because the driver tests
will need the original structure intact. So, have list_opts() deepcopy
the data it is given, again to avoid having to ensure each driver
author does that copy.

Change-Id: Ie8c1bc606f5f69a72b2383200a40b26e252067a9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-07-17 16:35:47.000000000', 'message': "ensure we do not modify private data from drivers

When we ask for a list of options from a drivere for generating the
sample config or documentation, we want to insert the actual 'driver'
option at the front of the list. This keeps each driver from having to
do that, and allows us to generate the sample with good
defaults. However, if a driver returns us a static data structure, we
do not want to modify *that* set of data, because the driver tests
will need the original structure intact. So, have list_opts() deepcopy
the data it is given, again to avoid having to ensure each driver
author does that copy.

This change also requires updating the test for list_opts() for the
URI driver to no longer assume the 'driver' option will be in the
results. At the same time I am reordering the arguments to
assertEqual() so that the expected value is listed first and renaming

Change-Id: Ie8c1bc606f5f69a72b2383200a40b26e252067a9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
ensure we do not modify private data from drivers

When we ask for a list of options from a drivere for generating the
sample config or documentation, we want to insert the actual 'driver'
option at the front of the list. This keeps each driver from having to
do that, and allows us to generate the sample with good
defaults. However, if a driver returns us a static data structure, we
do not want to modify *that* set of data, because the driver tests
will need the original structure intact. So, have list_opts() deepcopy
the data it is given, again to avoid having to ensure each driver
author does that copy.

This change also requires updating the test for list_opts() for the
URI driver to no longer assume the 'driver' option will be in the
results. At the same time I am reordering the arguments to
assertEqual() so that the expected value is listed first and renaming
the variable holding the actual values from the discovery call.

Change-Id: Ie8c1bc606f5f69a72b2383200a40b26e252067a9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

commit_message:
Add scheduler_thread_pool_size configuration

Add scheduler_thread_pool_size configuration and set default value to
1000 to match oslo_service default for service threadgroup [1]

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.service/blob/master/oslo_service/service.py#L718

Change-Id: Ie971f8321a472ef34396faed81aa676eaa006701

commit_message:
use retry_db_errors from neutron-lib

The externally consumed APIs from neutron.db.api were rehomed into
neutron-lib with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557040/

This patch consumes the retry_db_errors from lib in prep for
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570016 which this patch depends on in
order for the UTs to work.

Change-Id: Id0e39f1d5e63bf01b7fd0708d2543b476b5292dc
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570016

commit_message:
Add client commands for quotas

Add commands to set quotas that restricts maximum number of
images and maximum total size of images. We also control
number and size for snapshots.

Change-Id: I7625384d954e06b59d5e96c0d2f19cd1da0b75a4
Depends-On: I1f8d49e8246383f6108d8e1dc6c7d0eec15c7ff3
Co-Authored-By: Artem Tiumentcev <darland.maik@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add image quotas

Added 4 main quotas:
- maximum number of images
- maximum number of snapshots
- maximum total size of images
- maximum total size of snapshots.

Images differentiated from snapshots by
image_type property (it is equal to "snapshot") for snapshots.

Please note that once you make an image public the image dissapear
from quota and we don't consider it in quota management.

Change-Id: I1f8d49e8246383f6108d8e1dc6c7d0eec15c7ff3
Implements Blueprint glance-basic-quotas
Co-Authored-By: Artem Tiumentcev <darland.maik@gmail.com>

commit_message:
delete bash_completion in subcommand

There are two "completion" in the subcommand table: bash-completion
and bash_completion. but "bash_completion" is not in help information
and it is repeated with "bash-completion", so delete it.

Change-Id: I5a7fd13b0cf58536c979fbc3603060ee9aef8556
Closes-Bug: #1670123

commit_message:
Bump py-amqp constraint

Due to the bug below we want to have py-amqp>=2.3.0 in constraints so
that connecting to rabbit endpoints don't timeout when relying on
/etc/hosts entries.

Change-Id: Ice814cd70b30daed14f47bbd8b07dfc3c42ecc11
Closes-Bug: 1780992

messages: [{'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-07-12 12:02:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-07-17 20:47:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-12 12:02:24.000000000', 'message': "Extend json exporter and fix elastic exporter

* rally task raw results include environment name and uuid which are
  quite informative, let's include them in the json report
* elasticsearch exporter did not use environment name from the task
  results, it retrieved this name from database instead which is
  redundant. This should be fixed now.

Change-Id: I475b67d248672650733f07126978a17acd5f7111
"}]
commit_message:
Extend json exporter and fix elastic exporter

* rally task raw results include environment name and uuid which are
  quite informative, let's include them in the json report
* elasticsearch exporter did not use environment name from the task
  results, it retrieved this name from database instead which is
  redundant. This should be fixed now.

Change-Id: I475b67d248672650733f07126978a17acd5f7111

subject: Move MQ vhost/user creation into role
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 21:05:01.000000000', 'message': "Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement two new variables:
- horizon_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host
- horizon_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

These are used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Change-Id: I5b7dfc89298501220d6f10c5b0b5840c278245b1
"}]
commit_message:
Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement two new variables:
- horizon_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host
- horizon_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

These are used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Change-Id: I5b7dfc89298501220d6f10c5b0b5840c278245b1
