commit_message:
Add support for certificates interface.

Add support for the dashboard to request and receive certificates
via the certificates relation, currently implemented by vault.

The first request to the dashboard can take sometime to return
so increase the timeout.

Change-Id: I173523ddbe3269e3fcdae49062cdb34e78786e44

- monasca-ui_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host
- monasca-ui_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

These are used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Change-Id: I02773691762d2a5ffcbc17d7d4582dc6c9a07129
"}]
commit_message:
Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement two new variables:
- monasca-ui_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host
- monasca-ui_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

These are used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Change-Id: I02773691762d2a5ffcbc17d7d4582dc6c9a07129

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

commit_message:
Nagios check should always return snap version

Currently the Nagios check will only return the version of the currently
installed snap if it has the prefix "v". This is not always the case,
the committed change fixes this behaviour.

Change-Id: I7e7567f7b3cdc2821afc6be47545c6778180a731

commit_message:
Enable discard

By default discard/trim requests are disabled for libvirt. This
patch enables them by default although in order to actually use
them, instances still need be using scsi disk devices. Also this
patch only permits Nova storage (e.g. instance root disk) to use
discard. For Cinder volumes this must be enabled in Cinder.

Change-Id: Iceb22fe5206629bc7b4096f518b8977c2e14def3
Closes-Bug: #1781382

I've got a series of nova changes that are now using this API, and I'm hitting an error in a resize flow where we confirm the resize and delete the source compute host port binding. We are confirming the resize here:

http://logs.openstack.org/33/556333/5/check/tempest-full/942d323/controller/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz#_Mar_31_01_29_27_098795

Deleting the port's host binding here:

http://logs.openstack.org/33/556333/5/check/tempest-full/942d323/controller/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz#_Mar_31_01_29_28_683944

And then later when the server is deleted during the test teardown, we get a 500 error from neutron:

http://logs.openstack.org/33/556333/5/check/tempest-full/942d323/controller/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz#_Mar_31_01_29_36_038592

http://logs.openstack.org/33/556333/5/check/tempest-full/942d323/controller/logs/screen-q-svc.txt.gz#_Mar_31_01_29_36_029130

Thinking about this, it's probably a bug in nova since this is a single-node job and we're resizing to the same host, so we deleted the sole port host binding, which is probably bad....looks like I need a check in the nova flow to see if the host binding that we're deleting is actually different from the instance's current host."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-01 14:19:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 57: Code-Review-1

Testing directly in the API, this is what I get:

1) Create binding:

$ curl -s -X POST http://localhost:9696/v2.0/ports/23aa3586-708f-4cbe-a744-da96ff7d5656/bindings -H "Content-type: application/json" -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN" -d '{"binding": {"host": "compute1"}}'

{"binding": {"status": "INACTIVE", "profile": {}, "vif_type": "ovs", "vif_details": {"port_filter": true, "datapath_type": "system", "ovs_hybrid_plug": true}, "vnic_type": "normal", "host": "compute1"}}

2) Activate binding:

curl -s -X PUT http://localhost:9696/v2.0/ports/23aa3586-708f-4cbe-a744-da96ff7d5656/bindings/compute1/activate -H "Content-type: application/json" -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN"

{"status": "ACTIVE", "profile": {}, "vif_type": "ovs", "vif_details": {"port_filter": true, "datapath_type": "system", "ovs_hybrid_plug": true}, "vnic_type": "normal", "host": "compute1"}

3) Get bindings for a port:

$ curl -s -X GET http://localhost:9696/v2.0/ports/23aa3586-708f-4cbe-a744-da96ff7d5656/bindings -H "Content-type: application/json" -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN"

{"bindings": [{"status": "ACTIVE", "profile": {}, "vif_type": "ovs", "vif_details": {"port_filter": true, "datapath_type": "system", "ovs_hybrid_plug": true}, "vnic_type": "normal", "host": "compute1"}, {"status": "INACTIVE", "profile": {}, "vif_type": "unbound", "vif_details": null, "vnic_type": "normal", "host": "compute3"}]}

4) Get binding for a port in a specific host:

$ curl -s -X GET http://localhost:9696/v2.0/ports/23aa3586-708f-4cbe-a744-da96ff7d5656/bindings/compute1 -H "Content-type: application/json" -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN"

{"binding": {"status": "ACTIVE", "profile": {}, "vif_type": "ovs", "vif_details": {"port_filter": true, "datapath_type": "system", "ovs_hybrid_plug": true}, "vnic_type": "normal", "host": "compute1"}}

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-06-29 17:05:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 67.'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-06-29 21:44:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 68.'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-06-29 23:40:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 69.'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-07-01 21:29:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 69:

In situations (such as in the neutron-grenade-dvr-multinode job) where:

1) DVR is enabled
2) The Port OVO obj_make_compatible method (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/414251/69/neutron/objects/ports.py@464) is invoked to create versions lower than the latest

The following sequence of events may take place:

1) The Port OVO obj_make_compatible method triggers the following traceback on the server side:

Jun 27 12:19:15.620997 ubuntu-xenial-rax-iad-0000380525 neutron-server[14313]: Traceback (most recent call last):
Jun 27 12:19:15.621325 ubuntu-xenial-rax-iad-0000380525 neutron-server[14313]:   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/eventlet/hubs/hub.py", line 457, in fire_timers
Jun 27 12:19:15.621653 ubuntu-xenial-rax-iad-0000380525 neutron-server[14313]:     timer()
Jun 27 12:19:15.622007 ubuntu-xenial-rax-iad-0000380525 neutron-server[14313]:   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/eventlet/hubs/timer.py", line 58, in __call__
Jun 27 12:19:15.622377 ubuntu-xenial-rax-iad-0000380525 neutron-server[14313]:     cb(*args, **kw)
Jun 27 12:19:15.623282 ubuntu-xenial-rax-iad-0000380525 neutron-server[14313]:   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/eventlet/greenthread.py", line 214, in main
Jun 27 12:19:15.623638 ubuntu-xenial-rax-iad-0000380525 neutron-server[14313]:     result = function(*args, **kwargs)
Jun 27 12:19:15.623996 ubuntu-xenial-rax-iad-0000380525 neutron-server[14313]:   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/oslo_concurrency/lockutils.py", line 274, in inner
Jun 27 12:19:15.624376 ubuntu-xenial-rax-iad-0000380525 neutron-server[14313]:     return f(*args, **kwargs)
Jun 27 12:19:15.625099 ubuntu-xenial-rax-iad-0000380525 neutron-server[14313]:   File "/opt/stack/new/neutron/neutron/plugins/ml2/ovo_rpc.py", line 109, in dispatch_events
Jun 27 12:19:15.625448 ubuntu-xenial-rax-iad-0000380525 neutron-server[14313]:     self._resource_push_api.push(context, [obj], rpc_event)
Jun 27 12:19:15.625803 ubuntu-xenial-rax-iad-0000380525 neutron-server[14313]:   File "/opt/stack/new/neutron/neutron/api/rpc/handlers/resources_rpc.py", line 243, in push
Jun 27 12:19:15.626151 ubuntu-xenial-rax-iad-0000380525 neutron-server[14313]:     self._push(context, resource_type, type_resources, event_type)
Jun 27 12:19:15.626489 ubuntu-xenial-rax-iad-0000380525 neutron-server[14313]:   File "/opt/stack/new/neutron/neutron/api/rpc/handlers/resources_rpc.py", line 255, in _push
Jun 27 12:19:15.626813 ubuntu-xenial-rax-iad-0000380525 neutron-server[14313]:     for resource in resource_list]
Jun 27 12:19:15.627162 ubuntu-xenial-rax-iad-0000380525 neutron-server[14313]:   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/oslo_versionedobjects/base.py", line 566, in obj_to_primitive
Jun 27 12:19:15.627494 ubuntu-xenial-rax-iad-0000380525 neutron-server[14313]:     version_manifest)
Jun 27 12:19:15.627812 ubuntu-xenial-rax-iad-0000380525 neutron-server[14313]:   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/oslo_versionedobjects/base.py", line 538, in obj_make_compatible_from_manifest
Jun 27 12:19:15.628205 ubuntu-xenial-rax-iad-0000380525 neutron-server[14313]:     return self.obj_make_compatible(primitive, target_version)
Jun 27 12:19:15.628534 ubuntu-xenial-rax-iad-0000380525 neutron-server[14313]:   File "/opt/stack/new/neutron/neutron/objects/ports.py", line 472, in obj_make_compatible
Jun 27 12:19:15.628890 ubuntu-xenial-rax-iad-0000380525 neutron-server[14313]:     original_binding = primitive['binding']
Jun 27 12:19:15.629211 ubuntu-xenial-rax-iad-0000380525 neutron-server[14313]: KeyError: 'binding'

This happens because in a system with DVR, some ports (those used for DVR routers) don't have a binding attribute. They have instead a distributed_bindings attribute

2) The above traceback takes place as a consequence of the execution of a worker thread in the Neutron server named dispatch_events (https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/plugins/ml2/ovo_rpc.py#L88), that attempts to push to the agents updates for all the OVOs (including those for ports) stored in self._resources_to_push. Note that dispatch_events retrieves and re-initializes self._resources_to_push (L91) and then proceeds to send the updates.

3) As a consequence, if the events to push to the agents in self._resources_to_push include an update of a DVR port (without binding attribute) and an update of a compute owned port that resulted from the port being bound, the traceback mentioned above will happen and the events will never get communicated to the agents. We can see that in the case of the failure reported by Matt the agent indicates that the port is not bound after detecting that the corresponding vif has been plugged to br-int: 

Jun 27 12:19:18.369010 ubuntu-xenial-rax-iad-0000380527 neutron-openvswitch-agent[29113]: WARNING neutron.agent.rpc [None req-ce1a6d72-b82f-49f9-a6b5-83a14e105c1c None None] Device Port(admin_state_up=True,allowed_address_pairs=[],binding=PortBinding,binding_levels=[],created_at=2018-06-27T12:19:11Z,data_plane_status=<?>,description='',device_id='c2681f54-a586-47a1-b424-1667e7f3fed0',device_owner='compute:nova',dhcp_options=[],distributed_binding=None,dns=None,fixed_ips=[IPAllocation],id=60e974b2-6515-4ba6-aea0-15e9498d2f30,mac_address=fa:16:3e:52:72:9d,name='',network_id=29f7a418-9114-4215-b106-0597826247f6,project_id='f599fc69524042b09a814e27f463c4af',qos_policy_id=None,revision_number=2,security=PortSecurity(60e974b2-6515-4ba6-aea0-15e9498d2f30),security_group_ids=set([4937d44c-97a7-4935-9d5a-e1c735393e80]),status='DOWN',updated_at=2018-06-27T12:19:14Z) is not bound

PS70 of this patch will improve https://review.openstack.org/#/c/414251/69/neutron/objects/ports.py@477 so DVR ports without binding attribute will be handled correctly. This will avoid the traceback shown above'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-07-01 22:21:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 69:

commit_message:
Multiple port binding for ML2

Functionality is added to the ML2 plugin to handle multiple port
bindings

Co-Authored-By: Anindita Das <anindita.das@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Miguel Lavalle <miguel.lavalle@huawei.com>

Partial-Bug: #1580880

Change-Id: Ie31d4e27e3f55edfe334c4029ca9ed685e684c39

[{'created': '2018-06-19 20:31:04.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Fix UnixDomainHttpProtocol class to support all eventlet versions

"}, {'created': '2018-06-22 19:31:59.000000000', 'message': "Fix UnixDomainHttpProtocol class to support all eventlet versions

so instead change the code to try and determine the
correct number of arguments to use in the call to

Change-Id: Ibe3dc8af6cf9f8bb4f8eababb7f4276e4db3f1f9
Closes-bug: #1777640
"}, {'created': '2018-07-10 19:30:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix UnixDomainHttpProtocol class to support all eventlet versions

It was recently decided to uncap eventlet:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
So eventlet is now capped at 0.20 not by global requirements,
it is capped in upper-constraints, because currently not every
openstack project is able to work with a newer eventlet version,
mostly because of the caps in projects requirements.txt.
According to global-requirements, last allowed version of
eventlet is 0.22.1:
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/tree/global-requirements.txt

In an effort to support both eventlet<0.22 and eventlet>=0.22,
change the code to try and determine the correct number of
arguments to use in the call to initialize the parent class.

Change-Id: Ibe3dc8af6cf9f8bb4f8eababb7f4276e4db3f1f9
Closes-bug: #1777640
'}]
commit_message:
Fix UnixDomainHttpProtocol class to support all eventlet versions

It was recently decided to uncap eventlet:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
So eventlet is now capped at 0.20 not by global requirements,
it is capped in upper-constraints, because currently not every
openstack project is able to work with a newer eventlet version,
mostly because of the caps in projects requirements.txt.
According to global-requirements, last allowed version of
eventlet is 0.22.1:
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/tree/global-requirements.txt

In an effort to support both eventlet<0.22 and eventlet>=0.22,
change the code to try and determine the correct number of
arguments to use in the call to initialize the parent class.

Change-Id: Ibe3dc8af6cf9f8bb4f8eababb7f4276e4db3f1f9
Closes-bug: #1777640

commit_message:
Allow setting test API microversions in gate tests

Add MANILA_TEMPEST_MIN_API_MICROVERSION and
MANILA_TEMPEST_MAX_API_MICROVERSION to the ci
post_test_hook. These options default to
the values specified in the api_version_request.py
file.

Also add the API Version History to the api-ref.

Change-Id: I21b3a705986216afb0ce73ca1f92571dda757408
Closes-Bug: #1781671

Closes-Bug: 1781582

commit_message:
Ensure nagios is enabled when enabling cluster status checks

Move the installation of the cluster status checking into
the conditional that checked with the NRPE directory exists.

This ensures that the managment plugin can be installed without
the charm being related to Nagios.

Change-Id: I998ba7c4b70207bb38f9898046f4e47bcb5723a4
Closes-Bug: 1781582

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-09 15:42:11.000000000', 'message': "[NetApp] Control snapshot folder visibility

By default, every share created allows access of its .snapshot
where files of each taken snapshot can be accessed. As per
some use-cases, it is desirable to not allow access to
the .snapshot folder.

This can now be done by using the extra_spec netapp:hide_snapdir.
When set to True, it will hide the .snapshot directory for every
newly created share.

Also, for existing shares, a config option named
netapp_reset_snapdir_visibility can be used to reset
all existing shares' setting to either hide or display
the .snapshot visibility on driver restarts.

Implements blueprint: netapp-snapdir-visibility
Change-Id: I30619bb13de528538b9887b00f39482f91a8db49
"}, {'created': '2018-07-09 21:09:29.000000000', 'message': "[NetApp driver] Control snapshot folder visibility

all existing shares' setting to either hide or display
the .snapshot visibility on driver restarts.

Implements blueprint: netapp-snapdir-visibility
Change-Id: I30619bb13de528538b9887b00f39482f91a8db49
"}]
commit_message:
[NetApp driver] Control snapshot folder visibility

By default, every share created allows access of its .snapshot
where files of each taken snapshot can be accessed. As per
some use-cases, it is desirable to not allow access to
the .snapshot folder.

This can now be done by using the extra_spec netapp:hide_snapdir.
When set to True, it will hide the .snapshot directory for every
newly created share.

Also, for existing shares, a config option named
netapp_reset_snapdir_visibility can be used to reset
all existing shares' setting to either hide or display
the .snapshot visibility on driver restarts.

Implements blueprint: netapp-snapdir-visibility
Change-Id: I30619bb13de528538b9887b00f39482f91a8db49

- Comparison between db object and hash string was causing
  ensure_shares to run every time. Fixed by reading property
  'info_hash' of db object.

commit_message:
Fix ensure_shares bugs

Fixed bugs that caused ensure_shares to not work properly. Mainly:

- Comparison between db object and hash string was causing
  ensure_shares to run every time. Fixed by reading property
  'info_hash' of db object.
- Driver implementation of ensure_shares would raise an
  exception in case of returning None. Fixed by adding
  'or {}' to method invocation.
- Missing share_servers parameter for each share passed
  to ensure_shares. Fixed by converting share_instance
  entities to dictionaries before passing to drivers.

Closes-bug: #1771866
Closes-bug: #1772644
Closes-bug: #1772647

Change-Id: Iac969e9cac6cea46deb12f5d8423be592cfeb72a

Added an API trace pattern filter in order to filter out

Additionally, the Cinder core trace function can now receive

order to achieve a similar purpose.

Change-Id: Ic0563848205a941cf8e779eee42e24ecdaf847dd
'}, {'created': '2018-06-29 13:09:22.000000000', 'message': '[NetApp ONTAP] Add filtering to API trace logging

API Tracing is valuable when diagnosing problems or
unexpected behaviors with the ONTAP Cinder drivers.

However, turning it on may spam logs and make it rather
harder to trace through specific API calls.

Added an API trace pattern filter in order to filter out
undesired API calls from the DEBUG log.

Change-Id: Ic0563848205a941cf8e779eee42e24ecdaf847dd
'}]
commit_message:
[NetApp ONTAP] Add filtering to API trace logging

API Tracing is valuable when diagnosing problems or
unexpected behaviors with the ONTAP Cinder drivers.

However, turning it on may spam logs and make it rather
harder to trace through specific API calls.

Added an API trace pattern filter in order to filter out
undesired API calls from the DEBUG log.

Change-Id: Ic0563848205a941cf8e779eee42e24ecdaf847dd

commit_message:
Exclude influxdb 5.2.0 from global requirements

The new version of influxdb client apparently does not handle correctly
unicode characters. It breaks Monasca tempest tests [1].
Monasca is the only project using influxdb library [2].

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/09/583209/1/check/monasca-tempest-python-influxdb/a166cac/logs/testr_results.html.gz
[2] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=influxdb&i=nope&files=requirements.txt%7Csetup.cfg&repos=

Change-Id: I8d41b8d2fc398337d4fd890a0a4cc63b03944e5a

commit_message:
Update api-ref and release notes for schema validation

This patch adds a reno for validate boolean parameters with spaces.
Also adds valid values in api-ref for boolean parameters that user
can pass in request body.

Implements: bp/json-schema-validation
Change-Id: Iff4b2906dba93a238d720a218fcf7a9f78b96a37

commit_message:
Merge server create for scheduler hint extension

As nova extensions has been deprecated already and goal is to
merge all scattered code into main controller side.
Currently schema and request/response extended code are there
among all extensions.

This commit merge the server_create for scheduler hint extensions.

Partially implements: blueprint api-extensions-merge-rocky

Change-Id: I0c5ceb4ed69c356aedc85cff74ef0a5d93c8f93e

commit_message:
Escalate UUID validation warning to error in test

The UUIDFields ovo field emits a warning if the field's value is not a
valid UUID. As previous patches removed all the violation from our test
code this patch now escalates the warning to exception raising to
prevent adding new violations in test in the future.

Change-Id: I0bf6d82b7c1a83419b8c54b085142af127b7a011

commit_message:

publish to pypi because of wrong build version number.

[{'account_id': 25634, 'date': '2017-12-13 10:12:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-12-13 10:12:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 25634, 'date': '2017-12-13 10:13:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

(2 comments)

I think you've gone too far here.

There's no reason for a shim layer as thin as 

 def foo(self, bar, baz):
     self.lib.foo(bar, baz)

I think what sahid was suggesting was an abstraction of:

 try:
     result = self.lib.call('operation1', foo, bar)
 except Whatever:
     ...
 else:
     thingy = result.baz()['blah']

into:

 thingy = self.lib.operation1(foo, bar)

Your ComputeDriver methods would still have multiple steps where appropriate."}, {'account_id': 6062, 'date': '2018-03-29 06:56:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 22.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-03-29 08:31:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22:

We definitely need more clarity on the config drive issue before proceeding.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-04-12 21:41:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 32: Code-Review-1

I'm a little confused about how this patch and the set behind it could have any positive reviews at this point. The only logs for the services I see are completely unreadable line-wrapped HTML blobs. I'm not really sure how we could be verifying that the right things. This log is empty:

http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-16244/logs/n-api.log

and this log has the real meat, but is unreadable:

http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-16244/logs/screen-n-api.txt.gz

I went looking through there to see if there was any evidence that a guest was running and hitting the metadata service, but I see none. I also see force_config_drive is turned off, and so I'm assuming that means the guests aren't really running or at least aren't running cloud-init.

I definitely think that tempest verification needs to be turned on so we can see that instances are starting and look at least semi-sane. With what is going on here, we could be starting empty instances with no image or they could be crashing on boot and we wouldn't know."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-04-16 21:11:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 32:

So, your compute service is starting with /etc/nova/nova.conf as the config file (which isn't right), but that file (and all the nova confs in the etc log dump) show libvirt as the compute_driver. Also, screen-n-cpu logs show actually starting the libvirt driver, but the base compute log shows your driver, but from the config which clearly doesn't specify your driver.

Can you please clean up the log dump so it doesn't have the duplicated logs (nova-api output is actually in screen-n-api, but nova-compute is in n-cpu.log)? Also, please have it dump the actual configs being used into the etc/ directory."}, {'account_id': 6062, 'date': '2018-04-17 01:26:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32:

ok, we will adjust our CI to have that information printed, thanks for the comments'}, {'account_id': 6062, 'date': '2018-04-17 08:11:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 33.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-04-17 09:17:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 33:

commit_message:
z/VM Driver: Spawn and destroy function of z/VM driver

It includes two main function, Spawn is used to deploy an
instance on the z/VM, and destroy is used to delete the instance

Change-Id: Ie3db769c5e62353b2fa39c1a7e1f025171ff4a4a
blueprint: add-zvm-driver-rocky

subject: z/VM Driver: add snapshot function

commit_message:
z/VM Driver: add snapshot function

This patch add snapshot function to z/VM driver, it will call
underlying zvmsdk to generate the image

Change-Id: I0409aba55487e92efa6370eed41936bf8a4ef25d
blueprint: add-zvm-driver-rocky

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-15 10:44:19.000000000', 'message': "Ensure config files rendered with sane permissions

All configuration files are being rendered with root.root ownership
with mask 0444 (including global read!).  Render configuration files
as owner root, with a group read permission appropriate to the
consuming charm.  This can be configured by setting the group
attribute of the Charm subclass, but will default to 'root' if
not supplied (preserving the previous behaviour).

Change-Id: Ib1e2d3801b171e5c7ea79d058fb36dfc532d5d20
Closes-Bug: 1780490

commit_message:
Ensure config files rendered with sane permissions

All configuration files are being rendered with root.root ownership
with mask 0444 (including global read!).  Render configuration files
as owner root, with a group read permission appropriate to the
consuming charm.  This can be configured by setting the group
attribute of the Charm subclass, but will default to 'root' if
not supplied (preserving the previous behaviour).

Change-Id: Ib1e2d3801b171e5c7ea79d058fb36dfc532d5d20
Closes-Bug: 1780490

commit_message:
Ensure target charm is used during upgrades

When upgrading openstack components, ensure that the charm class
representing the target release is used for packages and
config file rendering, supporting changes in config files or
packages to be installed.

Also set OPENSTACK_RELEASE_KEY to new release to ensure that
Charm class resolution in future hook executions observes the
current release, rather than the release at install.

Change-Id: I724ae652460e352e24ed7bf2bf57ea181fadff1c
Closes-Bug: 1779062

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-30 03:51:05.000000000', 'message': "Rework DEFAULT_SERVICE_REGIONS

DEFAULT_SERVICE_REGIONS is cumbersome when you have
more than one keystone endpoint and all you want to do
is set a global default service region.

This adds '*' as an optional fallback key to mean global default.
If an endpoint matches it will take precedence over the '*' value.

This also fixes the precedence order for DEFAULT_SERVICE_REGIONS
so that a user controlled cookie is used instead.

Change-Id: Ieefbd642d853fcfcf22a17d9edcc7daae72790a4
blueprint: global-default-service-region
Closes-Bug: #1772345

commit_message:
Rework DEFAULT_SERVICE_REGIONS

DEFAULT_SERVICE_REGIONS is cumbersome when you have
more than one keystone endpoint and all you want to do
is set a global default service region.

This adds '*' as an optional fallback key to mean global default.
If an endpoint matches it will take precedence over the '*' value.

This also fixes the precedence order for DEFAULT_SERVICE_REGIONS
so that a user controlled cookie is used instead when that cookie
is valid for the given catalog. This changes the way the setting
works, but retains the intended result the setting was originally
intended for.

Change-Id: Ieefbd642d853fcfcf22a17d9edcc7daae72790a4
blueprint: global-default-service-region
Closes-Bug: #1772345
Related-Bugs: #1359774 #1703390
